loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys W. M. is thirty-eight years old, married, and has two children. Her business is located at Ngong, a busy area in Nairobi, and is known by the name "Mwea General Shop." She has been serving the local people for the last two years, and her major challenge is that there are so many people engaged in the same kind of business as hers that customers are spoiled with choices. She is using her loan to buy maize and wheat flour, soft drinks, and cereals. She hopes to expand her business and become a wholesaler. She is a very hard-working business lady.

loans.use: Soft drinks, flour, and cereals

loans.name: Magdaleno

texts.es:
El señor Magdaleno T. P. es originario de la comunidad el coyol municipio de condega se dedica a actividades agrícolas y ganaderas su finca tiene una extensión de 160 mz de terreno siendo estas mas a la actividad de ganado, se le otorgo el crédito para la compra de 4 novillos de engorde para después venderlos de pesa en el matadero de condega ya que es una de las principales actividades de este cliente.

Su negocio comenzó desde niño ya que su papa también se dedicaba a este rubro por lo que no fue difícil para él aprenderlo y sacarle provecho a este negocio  de compra y repasto de ganado él espera que 
Con el crédito le vaya muy bien porque tendrá mas oportunidad de seguir trabajando y obtener un buen ingreso y comprar mas ganado de repasto cabe mencionar que este productor también se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y papa esto con el objetivo de mejorar cada día mas su finca y poder dejarle a sus hijos un buen patrimonio de su parte.


Don Magdaleno es casado y tiene cuatro hijos dos edad escolar y dos que trabajan con él ya mayores de edad. Este es sexto crédito que se le otorga y trabaja con ceprodel desde el dos mi cuatro y nos expreso que esta agradecido con la institución por la ayuda que se le a brindado ya que a mejorado sus condiciones de vida de su familia y espera seguir trabajando sin tener problemas.
texts.en:
Magdaleno T. P. is from Coyol, Condega. He is a farmer and cattleman. His farm is 160 manzanas (one manzana=7000 square meters approx.) which are dedicated almost exclusively to cattle raising. He was given a loan to buy 4 calves to raise for subsequent sale to the Condega slaughterhouse; this is one of the main activities of this client. His business began when he was still a child because his father was in the same line of work so it wasn't difficult for him to learn and take advantage of this cattle raising business. He expects the loan will do him good because he will have more opportunity to continue working, have higher income, and buy more cattle to raise. It is worth mention that this producer also farms basic grains and potatoes in order to improve his farm and leave a greater asset to his children. Magdaleno is married and has four, school-age children and two adult children that work with him. This is his 6th loan and he has collaborated with Ceprodel since 2004. He stated that he is grateful to the institution for the help it has given him because his family's living conditions have improved and he hopes to continue to work problem-free.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao N. is a 33-year-old married woman who lives in Preak Ta Ong Ti 2 village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Tha Thorn, are mango sellers who can earn a small income by selling their mangoes to support their family. Since their business is still going well, Mrs. Mao N. wants to expand it. She decided to ask for 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy more mangoes to enlarge her business. She hopes that the loan will increase the family income and improve the family's living conditions. Mrs. Mao N. is the mother of four children. Two of the children are students in the public school and two are too young to study or work. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more mango

loans.name: Pablo Vidal

texts.es:
Pablo M. de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa vende ropa. Ellos tienen 3 hijos todos estudiantes de escuelas particulares. 

Pablo hace 18 años ya tiene la farmacia inicio como vendedor ambulante de medicinas y con ayuda de sus padres pudo tener su propio local el primer nombre de la farmacia fue “droguería” (este nombre es común para las farmacias en Latinoamérica). 

Ahora el tiene una de las más grandes farmacias en todo el sector de Paraíso. Tiene dos empleados que le ayudan a vender los medicamentos. Trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 23h00 todos los días. La delincuencia es uno de los mayores inconvenientes que tiene. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas y productos para laboratorio y así incrementar su farmacia. En el futuro quiere ser distribuidor de medicinas en todo Guayaquil.
texts.en:
Pablo M. is 43 years old, and lives in a peri-urban area in Paraíso de Guayaquil. His home is made of cement and has all the basic services. His wife sells clothing and they have 3 children, all are students in private schools.

Pablo for 18 years has had a pharmacy. He began as a street vendor selling medicine, and with the help of his parents he was able to have his own stall, the name of the pharmacy was “droguería” (drugstore-this name is commonly used for pharmacies in Latin America).

Now he has one of the biggest pharmacies in all of the Paraíso area. He has 2 employees that help him sell the medicines. He works from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m. every day. Delinquency is one of the biggest problems that he has.

With the loan he wants to buy medicines and products for the laboratory and that way expand his pharmacy. In the future he wants to be a distributor for medicines in all of Guayaquil.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines, products for laboratories.

loans.name: Amado

texts.es: El señor Amado es casado con la señora Patricia y son padres de familia de 4 pequeñitos, 2 en edad escolar, el señor Amado es empleado de una empresa aduanal como tramitador desde hace 4 años, y su esposa tiene un negocio propio, donde le realiza cortes de cabello a caballeros y damas, además de tintes, mechas entre otros servicios. Ellos son una familia establecida y unida que están tramitando este crédito para terminar la construcción de un cuarto en le frente de su casa, ya que desean ampliarse para el negocio de su esposa.
texts.en:
Amado is married to Paticia and they have four children, two still school-aged. Amado has been employed as an expediter for a customs agent for the last 4 years. He and his wife own their own beauty parlor where they serve both men and women offering haircuts and hair coloring, among many other services. They are an established and united family that are negotiating this loan in order to finish building a room in front of their house that they want in order to enlarge the wife's business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building a room.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia M. is married and has four children. She runs a retail shop in Majaoni, Mombasa where she sells household goods. Her retail shop is one year old and is doing well. 

This loan marks Lydia's second time borrowing from KADET. With the money, Lydia plans to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, and sugar for her shop. Her clients are the area residents of Majaoini.

Lydia hopes to have a really bright future and to open up another business to supplement her income.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, maize flour, and sugar for her retail shop.

loans.name: Teodosio

texts.es:
Teodosio tiene 55 años de edad, es casado, tiene cuatro hijos mayores y dos hijos en edad escolar. Reside en la localidad de Pichari, específicamente en la ceja de la selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia.

A pesar de los obstáculos que se le presentaron en la vida, él sobresalió desde abajo y al final del camino tuvo su recompensa. Ahora se dedica por entero a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao y café. Trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposa e hijos y algunos peones que le facilitan la extracción y selección de sus productos. 
Normalmente labora desde las 7:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM y sus productos los venden en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad; por lo cual le está dando buenos resultados económicos. No contento con ello, en el futuro espera ampliar su terreno de cultivo con el propósito de incrementar su producción.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, además agradece a su banco comunal por el respaldo que le brindan. Con el dinero solicitado piensa darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus cultivos de cacao, con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de su producto.
texts.en:
Teodosio is 55 years old, is married and has 4 adult children and 2 children of school age. He lives in Pichari, specifically the rim of the Cuzco jungle where he has his home.

Despite the obstacles that he has faced in life he overcame them and in the end he got his reward. Now he dedicates his time completely to agriculture, specifically to cocoa and coffee. He works by himself but sometimes his wife and children help him as well as some workers that help pick and select his products.

Normally Teodosio works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM and his products are sold in the central gathering places of his neighborhood, which is why he has such good profits. Not satisfied with his success, he hopes in the future to expand his plotted land to increase his production. This is his first loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and is committed to meeting his set quotas and adds that he is grateful to his communal bank for the support that they give him. With the money loaned he will use it to take care of his crops of cocoa to improve the quality of his product.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To take care of his crops.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
el sr. Alexis B. L. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Suyapa de la ciudad de Nacaome departamento de Valle. Alexis se dedica a la venta de verduras, tiene poco tiempo de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
todos los dias se levanta temprano para cargar su carro pickup de verduras y salir a venderlas en diferentes barrios, colonias y caserios en donde no llegan muchas personas que venden verduras, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes y le gustaria llegar mas lejos ya que este es un buen negocio, las personas consumen muchas verduras todos los dias porque son muy nutritivas.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas verduras y asi poder tener mejores ventas.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Alexis is 29 years old and lives in the Suyapa neighborhood in the city of Nacaome, located in the Valle department. She sells vegetables, but has not been doing this for very long. She rises early every morning in order to load her pickup truck with vegetables, and then sell them in various neighborhoods and homes where few people go to sell vegetables. This is why she has many customers. She would like to be able to travel farther, as this is a good business. People eat many vegetables daily because they are nutritious. She will use the money from this loan to buy more vegetables so that she can increase her sales. She needs the money in order to pay for household expenses and help to move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Dios Es Nuestro Amparo 1 Group

texts.en:
Luchi is the coordinator of her group, Dios es Nuestro Amparo (God is our Protection), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the slums north of the capital, Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their two children.
Luchi is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling shoes by purchasing men's shoes and sandals, women's shoes (with and without heels) and purses to sell. She will use the profits to invest in inverters for her home to deal with frequent blackouts, as well as save towards repairing her roof. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase men's shoes and sandals, women's shoes and purses for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Activas es un excelente  comité conformado en fecha 22 de Marzo del 2010, integrado por 15  mujeres de la ciudad de Ita. Este grupo se formó  gracias a que la Sra. Fermina Morán se acercó a la asesora y conformaron el grupo, y ahora ya se encuentran trabajando muy contentas en el 2° ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Las integrantes de este grupo destinan su crédito a diferentes actividades  tales como: compra de frutas y verduras, compra ingredientes para la preparación de alimentos, compra de mercerías, compra de mercaderías para la despensa (azúcar, arroz, yerba, panificados, lácteos, carnes, etc.), compra de ropa para la venta. .
Es un grupo muy activo, todas las integrantes demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad, asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo. .
Dentro del grupo se encuentra la señora Fermina quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, ella comenzó con esta actividad después de integrar comité de mujeres. .
Ella ofrece sus mercaderías a su casa, y también sale a ofrecer en casas de conocidos  y amigos. .
Le va bien hasta ahora ya que le genera un ingreso, e invierte en su casa, y actualmente quiere comprar más prendas de vestir para contar con mas variedades como remeras, vestidos, suéter, pantalones, jeans, para solicita el crédito.
texts.en:
The committee Mujeres Activas is an excellent committee formed on March 22, 2010, and is made up of 15 women from the city of Capiatá. This group was formed thanks to Fermina who went up to the assessor and formed the group. Now she finds herself working very contently in the second cycle of the Program of the Committee of Enterprising Women. The members of this group use their loans for different activities like: buying fruits and vegetables, buying ingredients for the preperation of food, buying for a notions store, buying merchandise for a market ( sugar, rice, maté, breads, dairy, meats, etc.), and buying clothes for resale. It is a very active group, all of the members show comradeship and solidarity, they attend the weekly meetings and do activities to collect funds for the common good of the group. In the group is Fermina who works selling clothes. She began this job after forming the committee of women. She offers her merchandise from her house and also leaves to offer in houses of her friends. It has gone well up to now as it creates an income, which she invests in her house for various things, and now she wants to buy more items of clothing to have more varieties like T-shirts, dresses, sweaters, pants, and jeans. This is why she needs the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Gerrit Larsen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy T-shirts, dresses, sweaters, pants, and jeans.

loans.name: Flor Kantutita Group

texts.es:
C.F. GERMAN BUSCH
A.C. FLOR KANTUTITA
FECHA: 15/07/2010

La Asociación Comunal “FLOR KANTUTITA”, es una asociación que solicita crédito por cuarta vez, es parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve personas, tienen como presidenta a la señora Rosario del Carmen L. C.. 

La señora Rosario del Carmen L. C. trabaja en Pro Mujer desde hace 3 ciclos (aproximadamente un año y medio).  Tiene como negocio la venta de comida desde hace ocho años. La venta es realizada en la Zona de Alto Lima. 

El primer crédito fue por Bs.1500.-, actualmente la asociación le aprobó Bs.3500.-, ella indica que le servirá para la compra de víveres al por mayor.
 
En el caso de las  integrantes de la asociación comunal, tienen diversos negocios, como: venta de telas, venta de comida, comerciante, venta de cosméticos, confección de chompas de cuello alto, pasanaku (sistema de ahorro diario, no formal), producción y venta de CD, DVD´s, VCD.
texts.en:
Regional Office GERMAN BUSCH Communal Bank “FLOR KANTUTITA” Date: 07/15/2010 The communal bank “Flor Kantutita” is requesting a loan for the fourth time; it is a part of the German Busch Regional Office. It is made up of nine people. Their President is Rosario del Carmen L. C.. Rosario del Carmen L. C. has worked with Pro Mujer for 3 loan cycles (approximately 1.5 years). Her business for the past eight years has been selling food. She sells in the neighborhood of Alto Lima. Her first loan was for Bs. 1,500.00. Currently the communal bank has approved her to receive Bs. 3,500.00. She says that she will use it to buy foodstuffs at wholesale prices. The members of the communal bank have several types of businesses, such as: Selling fabrics, selling food, general sales, selling cosmetics, making turtle-neck sweaters, pasanaku (an informal system of daily savings), and making and selling CDs, DVDs, and VCDs.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food items at whole-sale prices

loans.name: José Ylden

texts.es:
Jose es un padre de familia de 48 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el sector Macuaco del distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola situada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Se caracteriza por tener tierras fértiles y terreno accidentado, dada su cercanía con la sierra norte del país.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la crianza y venta de animales menores, específicamente aves de corral, el cría patos y gallinas en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donde vive o en una feria que se realiza una vez por semana en el distrito de Cayaltí.

Jose desea adquirir mas animales para ampliar su negocio y alimento balanceado para lograr que estos de desarrollen de manera correcta lo que hará que sean vendidos a mejor precio, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternatva un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Jose es un padre honrado, trabajador y que continuamente da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Jose is a 48 years old family man living with his wife and their two children in Macuaco, a sector of the Oyotún district, a rural area located two hours away from the town of Chiclayo. The area is characterized by rich lands and uneven ground, being located close to the country's northern mountain range. For more that ten years he has been engaging in breeding ans selling small animals, poultry in particular: he breeds ducks and chickens in an area located at the back of his house, and when they have grown enough he sells them to traders that visit the area where he lives or at a weekly fair located in the Cayaltí district. Jose wishes to buy more animals to improve his activity, as well as feed for his animals so that they will grow correctly and he will be able to sell them at a better price.Wishing to reach his goal, he has come to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time, requesting a loan of 1000 PEN. Jose is a honest and hard-working father who constantly does the best he can to provide for his family. His main desire is to be able to give them better living conditions. He is known to be a calm and responsible man by the neighbors and acquaintances of the area where he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animls and animal feed to improve his activity.

loans.name: Rafael Leopoldo

texts.es: Rafael es un padre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a 4 hijos en el. El Se dedica a trabajar en la  compra y venta de ganado por lo que lo heredo de su padre ya que él se dedicaba a tiempo completo a su actividad Con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades él se encarga de apoyar a su esposa con los gastos familiares. Rafael trata de dar lo mejor de sí para mantenerse en el negocio y sacar adelante a los que quiere. Por lo que quiere obtener muy buenas ganancias por medio de este crédito, que será implementado para la compra de más ganado. El es un hombre muy tranquilo, trabajador y responsable.
texts.en:
Rafael is 42 years old, a father, and lives with his 4 children. He works in the buying and selling of cattle, which he inherited from his father and to which he dedicates himself to full time. With his earnings, he helps his wife with their household costs. Rafael tries to give his all in his work in order to maintain his business and to move those he love forward. With this credit, he hopes to obtain better profits by purchasing more livestock. He is a calm, hard-working, and responsible man.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Mr. Song V. (pictured here), is 32 years old. His wife, Mrs. Sokhim Chang, is 28 yeas old. They live in a suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh city. They have been married for ten years and have three daughters. Two of them are in school and another one is still young. 

Song has been a construction worker for five years, and his wife has been a garment factory worker for seven years. The house where they live is small and it’s difficult for family members to stay, so Song is asking for his first loan of $900 to renovate his house.

loans.use: To renovate the house where he lives.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de verduras y granos secos, ella vende tomates,zanahorias,cebollas,pepinos y toda variedad de granos secos, ella lleva a diferentes lugares como Urubamba, Pisac y también los vende en la ciudad del Cusco y en algunas oportunidades manda a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, su esposo se dedica a cultivar verduras en su pequeño terreno de cultivo y por medios de estos trabajos pueden sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un puesto para vender las verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras  y también para comprar abonos y semillas para su terreno de cultivo.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata communal bank. The bank is located in the community of Yuncaypata, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Julia is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling vegetables and dried grains. She sells tomatoes, carrots, onions, cucumbers, and all varieties of dried grains. Julia travels to different places like Urubamba, Pisac, and also sells them in the city of Cuzco. When she has the opportunity, she also sends them to Puerto Maldonado. Her husband works growing vegetables on his small piece of farmland and through these jobs, they are able to help their children get ahead. Julia wants to have a stand to sell the vegetables. She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables, as well as fertilizer and seeds for their farmland.

Julia is grateful for everyone who has made this dream possible and she promises to make her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, as well as fertilizer and seeds for their farmland.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita L., 58, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow. Her three children are already working and helping her with the household and the finances. By the grace of God, Teresita has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a variety store where her main products are mostly school supplies. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a few pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piece rates.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 200 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries, beverages, and school supplies to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Teresita dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship[sup]*[/sup]* members to share stories of her work every week.

<sup>*</sup>All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Momodu  Jang

texts.en:
26-year-old Momodu is married with no children.  In 2008, Momodu established his provisions, drinks and pure water business.  He began his business after his education because the job market was very tough and so he chose to start his own business.  

Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 1,634,720SLL every month from this business as he always has consistent demand for his goods.  Momodu needs a loan of 4,000,000SLL to buy more provisions and drinks.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 147,125SLL. In the future, Momodu plans to help his wife attend a nursing course.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Rwahi Womens Group-Ntungamo

texts.en: K. Kate, 47 years old, has belonged to the Rwahi Women's group for the past 26 years, relying on her agro produce sales business as a source of livelihood.  Year in, year out, she has brought hard work, conviction and determination to bear. She sells her foods at a food stall in the Rwahi trading center, which she claims is the reason she has stayed in business this long. She has mostly been selling beans, peas, sorghum and maize, which are staple foods in Uganda. She continues to farm. In a week, her profits total up to 100,000 UGX. With this loan, she plans to buy onions to plant and resell upon harvesting.

loans.use: to purchase onions to plant and resell after harvesting

loans.name: Damba

texts.en:
Damba C. is 53 years old and lives with his adult son in his own fenced house in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His son works as a private businessman.

In 2000 Damba opened a small shop where he sold food. Since then, he managed to expand his shop into a bigger grocery store. During years of successful operation, his earnings enabled him to provide for his three other children who are now married and live separately on their own.

Damba is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more products to sell at his shop. In the future, he plans to expand his grocery store into a supermarket. Damba is a hardworking and modest man and says, " My goal is to enlarge my house."

loans.use: To purchase more products for his store

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
With a kind smile in which time has drawn its deep furrows, Yusra welcomes her customers and takes their orders. Yusra, a micor-entrepreneur  from A. Byader – Amman is  57 years old. A hard-working woman and a mother of four, she took advantage of her distinguished abilities in cooking and turned them into a business that brings in a modest income for the family.

Yusra began by making "Maftol" (popular Jordanian food) at home. Afterwards she realized that producing only "Maftol" would not bring in a steady income for the family so she started making homemade pastry and different kinds of sweets. 

Yusra is requesting a loan of 500 JD to buy raw materials for her new business line. She is looking to open a shop for her business instead of working from home and hopes to realize the family dream of having their own home instead of their current rented one.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her new homemade Jordanian foods business

loans.name: Erminio

texts.en:
Erminio P. is from the village of Benito, Soliven, Isabela. He is 36 years old. Erminio is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Erminio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Erminio has been engaged in this business for 10 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Erminio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erminio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  Erminio is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Erminio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: La Fuente De Bendicion 7 Group

texts.en:
Hirza is one of the members of La fuente D. Bendicion 7 (The source of Blessing). They are micro-entrepreneurs dedicated to selling clothing, natural goods, shoes etc. in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. Hirza is the mother of five children  living together with her long term partner, in a rural village outsiD. the town. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.


Hirza is receiving her 4th loan. For each loan, she has maD. her payments on time and has maD. good investments. She is planning to invest her new loan to purchase cloths and shoes for her business, which she started with the first loan she received from Esperanza, around 2 years ago. Hirza will use the profits to build a room on her house. She is  working  hard for her children's  future to give them all they need to study and succeed.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice, fish, potatoes, meat, etc. in large quantity to resell

loans.name: Pacila

texts.en:
Pacila is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a tailoring business for the past five years, offering sewing services in a shop to her neighbours. Pacila faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demands in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the loan for 20,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase a bundle of materials and threads for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials and threads for tailoring business

loans.name: Cherono

texts.en:
Cherono has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years in Kitale town, western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces milk, eggs, vegetables and maize that are all sold locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to cater for the basic needs of her family. 

Cherono is 33 years old and a single mother of 3 school-aged children who all attend school.

She has requested for a loan of KES 65,000 through Juhudi Kilimo for poultry farming. The extra income from this loan will enable her to take care of her children andto  improve her family's living standards. She faces the challenge of diseases and lack of enough poultry feed.

loans.use: Poultry farming.

loans.name: Huy

texts.en:
Huy, born in 1983, is a mother of two children who are attending public schoO.. She is a farm laborer and a farmer who owns a 1.7-hectare plot of land where she grows rice.   Some of the rice yield is to sell and the rest is used by her family. 
Because her field has infertile soil, Huy is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide.  With the rest of the loan she is going to hire farming laborers to plow her field. Her husband, Men, is a water seller and a fisherman and is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel Antonio está casado desde hace 10 años, tiene 3 hijos menores a su cargo. El se dedica a una pulpería, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su vivienda  de esta manera puede aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar a con los gastos del hogar. El manifiesta que la única forma de crecimiento es a través de los créditos, porque le resulta muy difícil conseguir acumular el capital operativo. Razón por el cual necesita el crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos, detergentes, gaseosas y jugos. El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que vaya a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
texts.en: Miguel Antonio has been married for 10 years and has 3 young children in his care.  His business is a grocery store which is located in his home.  This allows him to increase his income and help with household expenses.  He says that the only way to grow his business is through loans because it is very difficult to accumulate operating capital.  For this reason, Miguel Antonio needs a loan to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, basic grains, detergents, soda and juice.  He is a very responsible person who has a desire to improve himself.  He has a jovial and enterprising spirit and there can be no doubt that he will manage to achieve all the goals that he has set himself.

loans.use: to buy candy, bread, basic grains, detergents, soda and juice

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala G. is 40 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is single and lives with her family. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her the significant value of work from the time she was young, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life.

Now Kamala dedicates herself to raising and selling livestock, and with the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for herself and her old parents, who have become her best friends.

Kamala is asking for a 2,000 AZN loan in order to buy more young livestock to raise and sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated woman's proposal.

loans.use: to purchase five young cattle

loans.name: Felly

texts.en:
Felly is 53 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Felly has a food production sales business in the Philippines. Felly requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan amount through Kiva field partner NWTF to buy some ingredients for her food products to sell.

Felly has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Felly would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy some ingredients for her food products business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 25 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. Rose has taken a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 42 años, vive en cu casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Ella se considera una mujer multifacética, a lo largo de su vida siempre se ha dedicado a diversos oficios, con el fin de encontrar un mejor beneficio económico para su familia. Entre los diversos oficios se ha desarrollado más en la agricultura, ganadería y en la venta de comida, en la que actualmente lo realiza de manera ambulante, valiéndose de una pequeña carpa, una mesa con bancas para que puedan sus clientes acomodarse y consumir lo que ella prepara. En este negocio sus hijos la apoyan, atendiendo a los clientes. Es así como transcurren sus días, durante la mañana expende comida y en las tardes alimentan a sus animales; pero en época de cosecha es toda la familia que comparte esta actividad y tratan de recolectar lo cosechado. Es su crédito número 13 que tiene con MFP,  esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal porque le ha permitido mejorar e implementar sus actividades de las cuales esta muy agradecida, una vez mas se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos y colaborar activamente en lo que necesite su grupo. Con el crédito que solicite, podrá comprar  productos no perecibles como arroz, azúcar, menestras y cereales al por mayor.
texts.en: Teofila is 42 years old and she lives in a house which she owns, together with her husband and their 3 children. she considers herself to be a multidimensional woman. She has taken on various occupations throughout her life, until finally she found the best business for her family. Among the various occupations she has had, the ones she developed the most are agriculture, farming, and catering. She currently sells foods itinerantly. She equips herself with a small awning and with a table and chairs so that her clients can make themselves comfortable while they enjoy the foods which she prepared. Her children help her with her business in attending to the customers. This is how she passes her days: during the morning she sells her foods and in the afternoons she feeds her livestock. But during the harvest season the entire family partakes in the activity to try to collect the products. This is her 13th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to be part of her communal bank because it has helped her to improve and implement her business activities. And for this she is very thankful. Once again she commits herself to being responsible with her payments and to actively collaborate with her group. With the loan she requests she will purchase non-perishable products, such as rice, sugar, beans, and cereal grains in wholesale.

loans.use: to supply her business with the purchase of rice, sugar, beans, and cereal grains in wholesale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Hawa, a native of Mongo village in Koindagu district northern Sierra Leone. Today, Hawa does her cooked rice business in the Koinadugu district headquarter town of Kabala. The wife and mother of three children has been a businesswoman for 12 years now. Her husband is a contractor and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Hawa has one of the most popular and favorite cooked rice shops which are colloquially called “college” in Kabala town. She has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 4,000,000.00 in order to further expand her business. She wants this loan so that she can buy food items like rice and groundnuts, and use the remainder to buy a freezer and a generator for her college.

loans.use: to buy food items like rice and groundnuts, and use the remainder to buy a freezer and a generator for her College

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 43 años. Ella es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio con la venta del tramo de su esposo.
Marta con el préstamo reforzara su negocio con la compra de granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar…etc.) carne, verduras…entre otros productos. El sueño y su motivación de trabajo es que sus hijos se preparen y tengan una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Señora Martha Lorena is a hard-working woman and entrepreneur of 43 years old.  She is the owner of a small convenience shop, which she began with the help of her husband.  

With this loan, Marta will improve her business with the purchase of basic grains (rice, beans, oil, sugar, etc.), meat, and vegetables, amongst other products.  Her dream and motivation to work so hard is for her children to be prepared and obtain a university degree.

loans.use: purchase basic grains (rice, beans, oil, sugar, etc.), meat, and vegetables amongst other products.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna de 34 años, convive con Constantino de 45 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hermosos hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia en el distrito de Pichari. Desde hace varios años atrás, Reyna ha dedicado incursionar en el negocio de venta de productos en general, vio la necesidad que había en su barrio, no existe un negocio de este rubro y sin pensarlo dos veces lo puso en marcha. Generalmente la hora trabajo es a partir de las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 8: 00 de la noche, ya que recibe una cantidad considerable de clientes, en donde sus hijos la ayudan en la atención a sus clientes. Normalmente los producto que vende son de primera necesidad para el hogar, es por ello que se siente contenta y satisfecha por lo que viene realizando; su punto de venta lo realiza en el primer piso de su propia casa. Sus planes a futuro es abrir otra tienda con la finalidad de obtener más ingresos económicos para el bienestar de su familia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles alquilará un nuevo local para instalar otra tienda más.
texts.en:
Reyna is 34 years old and in a common-law marriage with Constantino, age 45. Their relationship has resulted in three beautiful children. They live together in their own home in the District of Pichari. Several years ago, Reyna decided to venture into a business selling general products since there was a need in her neighborhood. This type of business did not exist and she did not think twice about moving forward. She generally works from 6am to 8pm. Reyna receives a considerable number of customers and her children help with attending to them. She normally sells household products and is very pleased with what she has accomplished. Her store is located on the first floor of her house. Reyna plans to open another store in the future so that she can generate more income to provide for her family’s welfare.

This will be her second loan with MFP. She promises to be prompt with her payments. With this loan of 2000 PEN, Reyna will rent a new location so that she can establish another store.

loans.use: to rent a location for opening another store.

loans.name: God Is With Us Group

texts.en:
Abdul was born 35 years ago in the small town of Lunsar. He is married to a businesswoman, and the couple has two children, one who is in primary school while the other is still too young to attend. Abdul is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs.

Abdul sells clothes such as jeans, t-shirts, sneakers, etc. He has been in business for nine years now. Abdul will use his share of the loan (1,200,000 SLL) to buy jeans, t-shirts, sneakers, etc. in bulk to add to his stock.

With the help of this loan, Abdul and his group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, sneakers, etc. in bulk to add to his stock.

loans.name: Bernaflor

texts.en:
Bernaflor is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Bernaflor has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy bananas and coconuts. Bernaflor has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bernaflor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts

loans.name: Adalgiza

texts.es: Adalgiza de 50 años se dedica a la pintura de cuadros,  fábrica cerámica  y vende prendas de plata mediante pedidos, a una clientela construida durante muchos años.  Ella vive en la ciudad de Cartagena,  es  una mujer casada y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 20 a 24 años, con quienes sueña ver exitosos ; hace 17 años con la liquidación de la empresa donde trabajaba, inicio su actividad emprendedora;  primero vendiendo pescado , luego mercancías y  como gradualmente tuvo mucha aceptación, aumentó su clientela y la aprovechó para ofrecerle artículos elaborados en cerámica, pues  también se dedica a pintar biscochos en este material,  que funcionan como recordatorios de primeras comuniones, fiestas infantiles , quinceañeros, grados , adornos  y adicionalmente  hace cuadros; Toda esta actividad le ha permitido desarrollar  su vena artística y por eso se siente muy feliz.  Este es el quinto financiamiento que hace Adalgiza a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar pintura y cerámicas y  venderla as a sus clientes sobre pedidos; con los anteriores financiamientos  ha logrado extender su negocio, aumentar sus ingresos y también el  bienestar de su familia. Con su nuevo capital de trabajo, logrará  impactar un nuevo mercado de clientes, pues esta es su meta y en ello tiene muy buena experiencia.
texts.en: Adalgiza is 50 years old. She paints pictures, makes ceramics, and sells silver jewelry to order to customers she has had for many years. She lives in the city of Cartagena and is a married mother of 2 children, aged 20 and 24. Her dream is for them to be successful. 17 years ago, with severance pay from a job she used to have in a business, she began her business activity. First she sold fish, later merchandise. Gradually she gained acceptance and built her clientele. She began to sell ceramic items. She also paints little ceramic cookies, which serve as souvenirs for first communions, children's parties, quinceañeras, graduations, and decorations. She also paints pictures. All of this activity has allowed her to develop her artistic talent and because of that she feels very happy. This is the fifth loan that Adalgiza has made with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. It is to buy paint and ceramics and to sell to customers via orders they make. With the previous loans, she has been able to grow her business, increase her income and also her family's wellbeing. With her new capital, she will impact new customers. This is her goal and she has a lot of good experience in it.

loans.use: to buy paint and ceramics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 52 years old and lives in the municipality of Plaridel. She is married and has four children.

Letecia works in the fishing industry. She catches and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for nine years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat.

Letecia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Letecia hopes to save for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Agichuluun

texts.en: Agichuluun is 23 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Govisumber province of Mongolia. His wife studies at the local vocational training center, but this year, she is staying at home, taking care of her one-year-old son. Agichuluun graduated from the Buddhist Religious University in 2008. He then returned home. He provides religious services to locals. He has many clients because of his education and experience. Also, Agichuluun operates a small grocery shop. His shop is located right next to his yurt. He bought a car with his previous loan. Now he is planning to build a house and has already purchased 800 bricks. He is a diligent man who is requesting a 2,700,000 MNT (Mongolian Tughrik) loan to buy construction materials and build his house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Villamor

texts.en:
Villamor believes that "Success is the fruit of patience and sacrifices". He is an industrious farmer who raised his family in a village, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He is now 56 years old and has only one child. Together with his wife, he has been managing their 1.5 hectares of farm land for almost 33 years now, and usually earns a net profit of PHP 25,000 every harvest season. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and transportation, Villamor is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other necessaries associated with planting rice.  He believes that through patience and hard work, he will increase their yields and income. He is hoping that in the future, they will earn and save more for future emergencies and renovate their own house so they can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and necessaries associated with planting rice.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es: Rosalba tiene 45 años de edad tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian la secundaria y por los cuales ella le hecha muchas ganas al trabajo, doña Rosa como de cariño le dicen se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, en su casa tiene aguacates, chiles manzanos, nopales, duraznos, guayaba, etc. los cuales su esposo y ella cultivan para después venderlos en el mercado de su población y tambien de casa en casa. Tiene aproximadamente con su negocio 4 años y ella espera que con el crédito que esta pidiendo a la fundación pueda hacer crecer su negocio y comprar más variedad de frutas y legumbres de temporada. La meta que tiene Rosa es poner un puesto estable en el mercado de su población para ya no andar cargando sus cubetas llenas de frutas y legumbres.
texts.en: Rosalba is 45 years old and she has 2 children attending middle school and who are her reason for working hard. She is affectionately nicknamed Rosa, and she engages in selling fruits and vegetables. She stocks avocados, Manzano peppers, prickly pears, peach tree and guava in her house, among other products she and her husband grow to then sell them in the local market and also going door to door. She has been running her activity for approximately 4 years, and she hopes that the loan she is requesting to the institution can help make her activity grow by buying a wider variety of fruits and seasonal legumes. Rosa’s dream is to set a fixed stall in the market of her village, in order to no longer carry around her cartons full of fruits and legumes.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and legumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy baskets, soft brooms, and chairs to sell

loans.name: Enomie

texts.en:
Enomie is 50 years old. She is a widow with four children.
 
Enomie has a shop that sells vegetables, onions, garlic and other spices. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional vegetables and spices. 

Enomie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Enomie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and spices to be sold wholesale and retail.

loans.name: Karel

texts.en:
Karel is a 37-year-old single man and is living with his parents. As the oldest son, he is responsible for supporting his family since his parents are getting older.
 
Karel works as a farmer as his father did for many years. Based on the skills that he learnt from his father, Karel continues the business by planting vegetables such as tomatoes, water spinach and corn. The agricultural products produced from his farm will be sold in the market. 

The challenge for Karel of being a farmer is the climate as the harvest depends on climate. Sometimes he cannot fully cover his needs as well as the household needs due to few crops generated. 

Karel is dreaming of hiring a plot of land which belongs to his neighbor. He wants to cultivate tomatoes, chili peppers, eggplant, etc. He thinks that the more vegetable he cultivates, the more income he will earn. That is the reason why Karel is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. He plans to use the loan to purchase more seeds, pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds, pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 48 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like detergent, canned goods, rice and other groceries.

Rosario has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Rosario aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like detergent, canned goods, hulled  rice and other groceries.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 25 years old and single

Jonalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Jonalyn has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 3 years and also earns an income from prepaid cellphone electronic loading.

Jonalyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Benigno

texts.en:
Benigno has been raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn, for almost 15 years. Benigno is very proud to be a farmer. With his farming business, he can provide a good education for his three children. He has nine children in all but the others have settled into marriage and live separately from him. 

As of now, he lacks funds to sustain his cornfield. Profits earned from the last crop was used for his family's expenses in meals, tuition fees, and paying credits from traders. Benigno is now asking for a loan of 35,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

In the future, Benigno would like to make his crop more productive for additional profits and someday improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Salimata a 27 ans, elle réside chez son père dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Mancourani II, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Mademoiselle Salimata n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer aux études, s’est vite initiée à la coiffure féminine depuis environs trois années. Avec une telle expérience dans un domaine, elle est beaucoup sollicitée par des jeunes demoiselles surtout lors des cérémonies (mariage, baptême, anniversaire, etc.). L’insuffisance des ressources propres  pour bien mener cette activité constitue l’objet et la justification de cette demande de prêt à Soro Yiriwaso afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. 
Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de huit mois et est à son premier prêt pour augmenter son fonds de roulement afin de pouvoir acheter 20 paquets de mèches de différentes qualités, 30 boites de gels et une douzaine de vernis de couleurs différentes à Bamako. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce premier prêt, un bénéfice moyen 90 000 FCFA lui permettant de résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Miss Salimata is 27 years old. She lives in her father’s home in a large traditional extended family in Mancourani II, one of Sikasso’s working-class neighborhoods. Miss Salimata didn’t have the chance to continue her studies and became a hairdresser about three years ago, shortly after leaving school. With such experience in the field, she is much sought after by young ladies, especially for ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, anniversaries, etc.). The insufficiency of clean resources to adequately operate this business is the reason and justification for this loan request to Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy ever-growing customer demand.

She has been associated with Soro Yiriwaso for more than eight months. She is on her first loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy 20 packages of hair extensions of varied qualities, 30 boxes of gels and a dozen boxes of different colors of nail polish at Bamako. 

With this second loan, she hopes to earn an average profit of 90,000 FCA, enabling her to cover her essential expenses, contribute to the household expenses, pay the interest on her loan and invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: To buy articles for her hair salon.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 34 years old, a business lady, she is a single mother of one child.  She has been selling soft drinks for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Ann will use the loan to buy soft drinks for her business.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. 

Her hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant which will increase her income.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is a 44 year old married man and a father of four children from Getafe, Bohol, Philippines. He is engaged in tricycle transport business for more than two years now. Felix needs a loan to buy fuel and spare parts for motorcycle like nuts and bolts. With this, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of the tricycle thus allowing him to use it to earn a living. In the future, Felix hopes of making his business a success. Moreover, he plans of exploring another venture to augment his income.

loans.use: to buy fuel and spare parts for motorcycle like nuts and bolts

loans.name: Nadia

texts.fr: Nadia a 27 ans. Elle vit en union libre et mère de deux enfants. Son activité est une boutique de boissons gazeuses.  C’est grâce aux revenus de cette activité qu’elle arrive à nourrir sa famille et payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock de boissons gazeuses.

loans.use: augmenter son stock de boissons gazeuses

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
In the city of Escobedo, Nuevo Leon, lives Miss Araceli, mother of three children. Her husband is employed in a company and she saw that they needed extra income to be able to pay for all their current expenses, for which it has been three years since she decided to start a small business. She dedicated herself to bargain sales. Her love of her family and her engaging spirit have made the realization of Araceli\\\'s project possible.

To be able to continue with her business, she requires a loan in the amount of $475 to be able to vary the merchandise to be able to expand her business and help her family as she has been doing to date. Your generosity can help Araceli, support her, the decision is in your hands. She and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, vive Doña Araceli, madre de tres hijos. Su esposo es empleado en una empresa y ella veía que requerían de ingresos extras para poder hacer frente a todos lo gastos presentes, por lo que hace tres años decidió emprender un nuevo pequeño negocio. Comenzó a dedicarse a las ventas al por menor. El amor por su familia y su espíritu emprendedor es lo que ha hecho posible la realización del proyecto de Araceli.

Para poder continuar con su empresa, ella, requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $475 DLLS y así poder surtir la mercancía que necesita para crecer más y poder ayudar a su familia como hasta el momento. Tu generosidad puede ayudar Araceli, apóyala, la decisión ésta en tus manos, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret Wanjiru intends to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is a single 30-year-old woman. She is a mother of two young children. She lives in the San Isidro neighborhood in the city of Coronel Oviedo. She has a business of selling chicken. She cooks them at her premises located on the main street of the city. She serves the hot freshly cooked chicken in plastic containers with manioc for the enjoyment of her clients. The loan will be use to have the capital in order to buy more chicken and to offer a larger menu with empanadas and breaded veal cutlets. The profits will help to support the family and to pay her children’s education expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca es una señora soltera con 30 años de edad, tiene su vivienda en el barrio San Isidro de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, y es madre de 2 hijos ambos menores de edad. Blanca se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos los cuales cocina al espiedo en su local comercial ubicado en la principal arteria de la ciudad. Ella entrega el pollo en envases de plástico a los clientes, recién cocinados y calentitos, acompañados de mandioca también servida caliente para un consumo placentero. El destino del crédito sería capitalizarse para la compra de pollos y a la vez ampliar su local con minutas como empanadas y milanesas. La utilidad generada será utilizada para la subsistencia de la familia y gastos de educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy chickens

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
Regina owns her home and lives there with two daughters on Simeón Roncal Street in the area of Alto San Pedro in La Paz, Bolivia. She is 48 years old and teaches in a primary school in the afternoons and in the evenings, she is busy making masitas (bread), biscochos, and empanadas. Her daughters help her to supplement their income, for she is a single mother. The loan would be to buy more baking materials in bulk since up till now, she has bought them by pound, which is more expensive and reduces her profits as well.

This is her first time with IMPRO but her wish to increase her sales qualifies her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Regina vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas en la calle Simeón Roncal de la zona de Alto san Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 48 años de edad, es profesora de primaria durante la tarde y por las noches se dedica a la elaboración de masitas, como ser pan, biscochos, empanadas, queques con ayuda de sus hijas, para mejorar sus ingresos ya que es madre soltera. El crédito que solicita es para comprar material en cantidad ya que a la fecha ella compra solo por libras lo cual hace que sus costos sean un poco altos y su ganancia se vea reducida por esta situación.

No tiene antecedente con IMPRO, pero su deseo de mejorar sus ingresos la califica para acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To buy raw material

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo is married and has 4 children. He was unemployed without a way to sustain his family, so he looked for a way to start his own business to be able to face his costs. With much effort he iniciated his own business with very little merchandise. Selling cleaning products, little by little he was able to maintain his home and start to grow his business, incorporating the sales of grocery items, and improving the quality of service he offered.

Adolfo needs a loan of $800, which he offers to pay back in 6 months. He will use this loan to provide more cleaning products and continue to work hard to sustain his family. He and his family very much appreciate your support in helping them.

Adolfo esta casado y tiene cuatro hijos que al quedar desempleado y no tener disposición económica para poder sustentar a su familia, buscó la forma de hacerse de su negocio propio para poder enfrentar sus gastos y con mucho esfuerzo inició su negocio con poca mercancía en artículos de limpieza y con este poco a poco a podido mantener a su hogar y crecer en el mismo, incorporando la venta de abarrotes y mejorando la calidad del servicio que ofrece.

Adolfo requiere de un préstamo de USD $ 800, que ofrece pagar en un plazo de 6 meses, utilizando este préstamo para poder surtir de artículos de limpieza y así seguir trabajando duro para poder sostener a su familia. Él y su familia agradecen tu apoyo para ayudarlos a salir adelante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To be able to buy cleaning products for his store, and continue growing his business so that he can support his family.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience O. is 33 years old.  She is married with 2 children and lives in Benin City, Nigeria.  She fixes and braids hair, and is currently a LAPO member.  She is seeking a loan of $475 to buy weavon, hair cream and relaxer to sell.

loans.use: To buy more weavon, hair cream and relaxer

loans.name: Phoy

texts.en:
Ms. Phoy L. (age 33) lives in a small village near the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Phoy has one daughter, who attends school in their village. Phoy herself never attended school. Phoy buys produce from farmers, which she then resells at a large market in Phnom Penh. Every day, Phoy leaves her village with her stock of vegetables at about 1:00 a.m., riding in a shared pickup truck. In Phnom Penh, she sells her produce to retailers, and then she returns home by about 5:00 a.m. She has been doing this for ten years and often sleeps only four hours a night.

In the attached photo, Phoy is bundling the leaves of the “kon tuit” (starfruit) tree. Cambodians eat these with some fish dishes.

Phoy is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA for $400, to buy produce from farmers to resell at the market in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase produce for resale in Phnom Penh

loans.name: Zuwena's Upendo Group

texts.en:
Zuwena is 45 years old. She is married and has 5 children who are between the ages of 21 and 28. She works as a food vendor from 9am to noon every day, which she began doing in 2005. From this business, she makes a monthly profit of about $45 from breakfast and snack sales.

Zuwena hopes for a loan to increase her sales. She will share this loan with Elizabeth, who is also a food vendor in her neighborhood in Dar es Salaam.

loans.use: to buy food stock

loans.name: Ediccia Raquel

texts.es:
One of the biggest businesses no matter where we are is the selling of food because we need these in order to be able to complete our day to day chores.

In El Sauce municipality, Leon department in Nicaragua, Mrs. Edicia P. dedicates her time to sell food , coffee and refreshments. She's a single mother with two girls which she needs to support. For this reason she works very hard and hopes to fulfill all of her daughters' needs.

Although she does the role of mother and father, Mrs. Ediccia P. has been able to attend to her home needs, run her business and overlook her daughters' development and growth. For this reason, she approached Ceprodel and they have given her the credit necessary in order to acquire raw materials in order to continue to prepare foods and sustain her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Uno de los negocios mas importantes en cualquier parte donde nos encontremos es la venta de comida debido a que a diario las personas hacen uso de los alimentos para continuar la labor de cada dia.

En el municipio de El Sauce del departamento de León en Nicaragua, la señora Ediccia P. se dedica al negocio de venta de comida en su localidad propia donde también vende café y refrescos. Es madre soltera y con dos niñas a quien mantener, es por tal razón que realiza un sobre esfuerzo en su trabajo para satisfacer todas las necesidades de sus pequeñas hijas.

A pesar de hacer el papel de padre y madre para sus niñas, la señora Ediccia P. se ingenia para realizar los quehaceres del hogar, atender el negocio y velar por el cuido de sus hijas. Por esta razón es que ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha beneficiado con créditos que los ha utilizado para la adquisición de su materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así continuar manteniendo su humilde núcleo familiar.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for her business

loans.name: Diariétou

texts.fr:
Diariétou D. is a 40 year-old mother of 4 children and has been a member of the Tilène Daraal village bank in Ziguinchor for 5 and a half years. She has always respected her engagements with the bank. She would like to buy bags of rice, oil cans and soap bars to re-stock her shop. The income from this business helps her take care of the needs of her family. Diariétou is asking for this loan which she plans to reimburse in 6 months in only one installment.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Diariétou D., 40 ans, mariée, mère de 04 enfants à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Tilène Daraal à Ziguinchor depuis 5 ans et demie.Elle a toujours respecté ses engagements.Elle veut achèter des sacs de riz, des bidons d'huile, des paquets de savon pour renforcer sa boutique. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d'assurer l'entretien de sa famille. Diariétou sollicite ce prêt qu'elle compte rembouser au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to re-stock up her shop.

loans.name: Maritza Marlene

texts.es:
Maritza A. is a strong woman, originally from the municipality of Condega, Nicaragua. For more than 15 years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of different purchases, right from her home, which has been able to turn into a store, by investing over the years.

In order to progress and invest in the education of her three young children, she is looking for a way to invest more in her business, and for that reason, she has asked for credit from Ceprodel, in order be able buy more products to see. Today, she is asking for the necessary credit, in order to enhance her commercialization work to her loyal clients.

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Deyna

texts.es:
Deyna is a seamstress. She makes comforters. Also she markets baby cradles (her main source of income that covers the maintenance of her two children.) Her dwelling this located in the 6th of August Zone of Rió Seco (El Alto).

She requires a loan to buy a computerized embroidery machine, which will help her to satisfy the demands of her market.

This is the second loan through Kiva. Her good payment history permits IMPRO to approve the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Deyna es costurera, confecciona edredones, también comercializa cunas de bebes (su principal fuente de ingreso que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos) Su vivienda esta ubicada en la Zona 6 de agosto de Rió Seco (El Alto).

Ella requiere crédito para comprar una máquina bordadora computarizada, la cual le ayudará para satisfacer la demanda de su mercado.

Este es el segundo crédito vía Kiva, su buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: To buy a computerized embroidery machine for her business of making comforters.

loans.name: Husniddin

texts.ru:
Husniddin T. and his wife sell all kinds of miscellaneous items on the central market of Isfara. He is 40 years old, married and has four children. This business is the main source of income for the family. Husniddin effectively increases his commodity circulation and fulfills any financial needs by getting loans. He has shown to be a very responsible client and payed off loans on time. He wants to get a new loan and use it to increase the variety of his merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Туронов Хусниддин и его жена продают разные мелкие товары на центральном рынке города Исфары. Хусниддину 40 лет, он женат и у него 4 детей. Занятие бизнесом приносит в семью основной доход. Хусниддин целенаправленно увеличивает свой оборотный капитал, нехватку средств восполняет получением займов. В погашении показал себя дисциплинированным клиентом. Он хочет получить новый займ для увеличения ассортимента продаваемых товаров.

loans.use: To increase turnaround

loans.name: Muhsin

texts.ru:
Muhsin H. is married and has three children. His wife works at home. Muhsin trades children’s' and men's clothing and women's shoes. He used to trade only clothes, but now he has two selling locations. The second location is where Muhsin's sales person mostly sells shoes. Muhsin works for an Italian company called Katri that produces fabric for making clothes. However, his salary at Katri is insufficient for supporting his family.

His neighbor recommended that Muhsin apply for a loan at Microinvest in order to expand his business. Now is a season for summer clothes, and Muhsin needs to purchase goods for resale. He hopes to obtain a loan from Kiva via Microinvest in order to expand his business by purchasing seasonal men's and children's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Мухсинджон Хайдаров женат, имеет троих детей. Жена домохозяйка. Сам он торгует на рынке детской и мужской одеждой, а также женской обувью. Раньше он торговал только одеждой, теперь у него есть две точки на рынке. Вторая точка состоит в основном из обуви, там сидит продавец. Сам Мухсин работает в ЗАО «Катри» это итальянская фабрика по выпуску материалов для шитья одежды. Но оклад в «Катри » ему недостаточен что бы содержать семью. Его соседка порекомендовала обратиться в Микроинвест, для расширения бизнеса. Так как в настоящий момент сезон летней одежды, и ему необходимо ехать за товаром. Он получит кредит от КИВА в Микроинвесте с целью расширения, приобретения сезонной мужской и детской одежды.

loans.use: To purchase summer clothes for resale

loans.name: Mwanaharusi's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi is a 42 year old married woman with 2 children, aged 12 and 3. She has been a milk seller since 2001. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 6 PM at her business where she can earn a monthly profit of about $90.

In the past, Mwanaharusi has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more milk for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Sara and Antonia, who have businesses selling beans and maize.

loans.use: To buy more milk for her business

loans.name: Luz Martha

texts.es:
La señora Luz Martha, tiene 55 años, actualmente se encuentra separada, estudió hasta 3er grado de primaria porque su madre estaba enferma en la Provincia de Julcan y  necesitaba cuidarla, después se dedicó de empleada donde su tía  en una panadería y un restaurante, tiene 02 hijos, son independientes, vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.
Para ayudarse económicamente, empezó desde que era joven a tejer toda clase de ponchos, chompas, bolsas de nailon a base de crochet, palitos, además  hacia bordados. También trabajaba en la fabrica de Esparrago donde era seleccionadora, se retiró porque tenía que cuidar a sus hijos. Tiene 08 años trabajando en el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su prima la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “MUJERES AL ÉXITO II” ella decidió integrarse a este Banco para apoyarse, salir adelante y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró conos de hilos de nailon, lanas, agujas.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra de lanas, hilos de tejer.
La empresaria sueña con exportar tejido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Martha is 55 years old and seperated from her husband. She studies until 3rd grade because her mother was sick in the Julcan Province and she had to take care of her. Afterward, she found employment in her aunt's bakery and restaurant. Luz has two children, who are adults. She lives in the El Porvenir District of the Trujillo Province in the Libertad Department (like a state). In order to support herself economically, she has worked since her youth sewing all types of jackets, coats, and handbags, from nylon to crochet, plastic, and recently embroidered. She also works in the Esparrago factory where she worked in human resources. She retired in order to take care of her children. For 8 years, she has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement. After her cousin referred her to the Community Bank, "Successful Women II" she decided join in order to support herself and move ahead. With her first loan of $100 she purchased bolts of Nylon, wool, and also sewing needles. With this lona of $400, which will be repaid after 4 months, she will invest in the wool and thread. The businesswoman's dream is to export fabric.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool and thread in bulk.

loans.name: Gulovsha

texts.en:
Gulovsha Q. is a very hardworking woman who knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married and has two children. She raises animals with the goal of later selling them. This activity has given her great satisfaction because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. The care that she takes to feed the animals and supply them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their population. 

She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she's also very dedicated to lovingly raising her two children, who also help to care for the animals during their free time. She wants to expand her business and purchase 15 sheep at an estimated cost of $60 USD each. She's requesting a loan of $1000 USD to buy the sheep and some fodder. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Delicia Rosa
