Analiza joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Analiza from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Kintei Ole Tingoi

texts.en:
Kintei Ole has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last nine years.  He is 38 years old, married to Muinante Ene Kuntei, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy 15 sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Kintei hopes to increase the number of animals that he rears to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: C2855 Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Francois is 27 years old and married with two children and two dependents.  He is the president of a group called “Abisunganye” and they all own separate businesses selling a variety of goods including spare parts, secondhand clothing, foodstuffs, etc. Francois sells spare parts for bicycles.

Francois would like to use this loan to help build a small shop from which to run his business. Any profits from the improved business will be used to pay school fees and provide for the basic needs of his family.

Abisunganye Group thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more produce and build a small shop.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: El señor Luis Manuel tiene 45 años, es casado y tiene tres hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El señor se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, es una persona muy responsable  y padre de familia que se hace cargo de su familia. El ya tiene 10 años de  dedicarse a esta actividad, dio inicio con la pequeña moto y con ciertos ahorros logro obtener su propio medio de transporte siempre está ofreciendo el mejor servicio. El financiamiento es para la compra de repuesto para la moto.
texts.en: Luis Manuel is 45 years old, married, and has three minor children in his charge. He provides taxi services. He is a very responsible person and father to his family, and takes care of his family. He has been providing taxi service for 10 years, starting with a small bike and with savings he was able to obtain his own vehicle. He always offers the best service. The loan is to buy a part for the vehicle.

loans.use: Buy a part for his vehicle.

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married with grown up children. He owns a small business selling clothing, shoes, as well as seeds and fertilizers in seven small towns in Nova Kahovka area. 

Mykola started this business 5 years ago. Today he's got many repeat clients. Mykola goes to each place once a week to bring his inventories. He also takes individual orders from people and brings them what they ask for.

Mykola is requesting a loan of 16,000 Grivnas to increase his working capital. He is hoping to make additional profit and use it to improve his family living conditions.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Karachi

texts.en:
Karachi is a widowed woman with seven children, all of whom had graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity and clothing.  

She has been operating a food stall business for the past four years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In her business, Karachi faces a major challenge in competition from other food stall operators. She hopes to expand and establish a café business in the future.

With the loan for 15,000 Ksh, she wants to purchase bundles of cooking flour, baking flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase cooking flour, baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman who lives in Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living buying and selling fresh/dried fish. Her husband Julius, who is 33 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living. They have two children who are 8 and 9 years old. Rowena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rowena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to continue to save up for future expansion of her business and to send her children to school. Rowena is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and school fees.

She has operated a cereals shop for the past six years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Jackline faces a major challenge regarding the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of groundnuts, beans, peas, and green grams for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of groundnuts, beans, peas and green grams for sale

loans.name: Chocolate Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento "CHOCOLATE" se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la Institución, compuesto por 9 personas,  sus actividades están entre venta de comida, promotora de cosméticos, modistas y transporte urbano, la mayoría de los integrantes son del barrio 8 de Septiembre de la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa de la Sra. América  que se dedica a la venta de comida en su mismo domicilio y que saca a vender todos los días por la noche y que vende  a sus vecinos y conocidos ya que ella tiene mucha clientela con el dinero del crédito la Sra. América comprara ingredientes y abarrotes para la elaboración de sus platillos ,  la Sra. Eliane se dedica vender productos cosméticos  y en las noches vende pizza, ella ofrece sus productos a las amigas que tiene y vecinas de su casa, ella no tiene hijos así que el dinero que junta es para ayudar a los gastos de sus padres y juntar para poder estudiar el año que viene alguna carrera técnica en un instituto, tiene su pareja que es taxista - chofer y que la motiva a estudiar aprovechando que ellos aun no tienen hijos con el dinero del crédito comprara cosméticos que se  encuentren en promoción. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras, están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Banco de Eprendimineto “Chocolate” (“Chocolate” Communal Bank) is working its first cycle with our Institution. It is composed of 9 people, engaging in various activities such as: meals sale, cosmetics promoter, seamstress and city transportation. The majority of the members come from the 8 de Septiembre neighborhood, in the Plan 3000 area. The group was born out of the initiative of América, who engages in selling meals in her own house. She works every day in the evenings, selling her products to neighbors and acquaintances, and she has many customers. With the loan she is requesting América will buy ingredients and groceries to prepare her dishes.
Eliane engages in selling cosmetics, on top of selling pizza in the evenings. She offers her products to her female friends and neighbors. She has no children, so with the money she earns she helps her parents paying for their expenses; she will also use some next year to study for a technical career in a school. Her partner works as a cabby and as a driver, and he encourages her to study now that they have no children yet. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cosmetics on special offer. All the members are hard-working and responsible people, and they are thankful to the institution for the help provided.

loans.use: To buy ingredinets and grocery ant to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Alexi Maria

texts.es:
Alexi de 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora que inicio su actividad cuando ella estaba embarazada y su esposo le compro una carreta.

Ella trabaja sola de miércoles a domingo por la tarde hasta la noche vendiendo comidas rápidas. Una de sus dificultades en su negocio es la competencia ya que hay muchos puesto sobre lo mismo por el sector. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar más su mercadería para la carreta como ollas, baldes, aceite, carnes para así expandir su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Alexi is 34 years old, she is a hardworking woman that began working when she was pregnant and her husband bought her a cart.
She works alone Wednesday through Sunday from the afternoon until nightfall selling fast-food. One of the problems of her business is the competition since there are many other sellers in the same area. With the loan she wants to buy more merchandize for the cart and expand her business and increase her earnings to give her family the best.

loans.use: to purchase pans, buckets, oil, and meat

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe A. is from the town of Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 42 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a food stall selling food products like fried chicken in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for three years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP per month from these activities. 
In 2010, Fe joined PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase chicken meats for her fried chicken business. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

* Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase chicken meat for her fried chicken business in the local communtiy

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
For the past two years Ama Y. has been selling plastic bowls and saucepans as a peddler at Besease near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is single and has one child. The income she makes from her sales is used to take care of her child and other expenses. A loan from Kiva will enable her to buy plastic bowls in larger quantities for resale. Ama plans to save her new profits to build a shop.
In the photograph, Ama has on her lap some of the plastic bowls she sells.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls in larger quantities for resale.

loans.name: Nidia Andrea

texts.es:
Nidia madre soltera, su hija le ayudan económicamente. Mujer emprendedora trabaja por cuenta propia teniendo una librería y fotocopiadora desde hace un tiempo, su proyecto es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda para mayor seguridad para su negocio y familia. Inicio con fondos propios, tiene planes de agrandar el negocio ofreciendo otros servicios como fax, acolochado, levantado de texto, variedad de productos.
El préstamo que solicitad será invertido en la compra de laminas de zinc, golosas, reglas de maderas para cambiar el techo de la casa. Agradece a la institución por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Nidia is a single mother whose daughter helps her financially.  She is an entrepreneurial woman who is self employed.  She has owned a stationery store and photocopying business for some time.  Her project is to improve the infrastructure of her home to make her business and family safer.  She started out with her own money and has plans to expand her business, offering other services such as a fax service, a text preparation service and also a variety of products.

The loan that Nidia has requested will be invested in buying metal sheets, bolts and wooden beams to replace her roof.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her in developing her business.

loans.use: to replace her roof

loans.name: Santa Catarina Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Santa Catarina y esta conformado por 11 mujeres indígenas D. la población D. Santa Catarina Mechoacan. Denominada Santa Catarina por la Virgen Santa Catarina ya que es la patrona D. la población. Mechoacan: significa “Lugar D. Pescadores”. Este grupo esta conformado por mujeres D. raza indígena muy trabajadoras que se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas para el apoyo económico en su hogar.
Gudelia tiene 33 años D. edad, ella es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos que estudian la primaria.
Gudelia tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa donD. venD.  pollo destazado (cortados en pedazo) y mole. Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar mas pollo para que su negocio crezca un poco más, tiene 5 años con su  negocio inicio con el debido a la necesidad que tenia D. mantener a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante, al principio comenzó con pocos pollos D. 5 a 10 pollos al día y sus ventas los realizaba D. casa D. casa en casa y asi fue creciendo poco a poco actualmente venD. D. 30 a 50 pollos.
Para ella es muy importante este negocio ya que con el pueD. mantener a sus hijos y darles educación, ella se esfuerza día con día para que a sus hijos no les falte nada. Es una mujer que a pesar D. las adversidades D. la vida ah salido adelante. Ella esta contenta con su negocio ya que le deja buenas ganancias, actualmente tiene muchos clientes ya que da a buenos precios cada pedazo D. pollo y es el trato que le da sus clientes es bueno y es por ello que va a adquiriendo nuevos clientes.
Su más granD. meta es que sus hijos estudien una profesión y tener un local propio para su negocio.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Cecilia(Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
Leticia(Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
Cristina(Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
María(Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
Rosa(Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
Cirina (Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
Tomasa (Venta D. pollos),
Gudelia (Venta D. pollos), 
Raquel (Venta D. ropa), 
Zoila (Elaboración D. servilletas), 
Rogelia (Venta D. artículos D. papelería).
texts.en:
This group is called “Santa Catarina” and is composed of 11 indigenous women from the town of Santa Catarina Mechoacan.  It is called Santa Catarina after the Santa Catarina Virgin since she’s the village’s patron saint.  Mechoacan means “Place of the Fishermen.” This group is composed of indigenous, very hard working women who carry out various economic activities to support their homes economically.

Gudelia, 33, is a single mother of three children who are in elementary school.  She has a small, home-based business selling butchered chicken (cut into pieces) and mole (traditional chili sauce).  She asked for the loan to buy more chicken so that her business can grow a bit more.  She’s been in business for five years.  She started because of the need she had to support her children and move them ahead.  At the beginning, she started with just a few chickens, from 5-10 daily and her sales were door to door.  This is how the business gradually grew and now she sells from 30-50 chickens.

This business is very important to her because she’s able to support her children and proviD. them with an education.  She strives daily so that her children will lack nothing.  She is a woman who, despite life’s adversities, has gotten ahead.  She is happy with her business because it produces good profits.  She currently has many customers since she sells each piece of chicken for a good price and the treatment she gives her customers is good; because of this she continues to acquire new customers.

Her main goal is that her children study a profession and to have a locale of her own for the business.

The other group members are:

Cecilia(Sells regional fast food), 
Leticia(Sells regional fast food), 
Cristina(Sells regional fast food), 
María(Sells regional fast food), 
Rosa(Sells regional fast food), 
Cirina (Sells regional fast food), 
Tomasa (Chicken sales),
Gudelia (Chicken sales), 
Raquel (Clothing sales), 
Zoila (Napkin manufacturing), 
Rogelia (Sales of stationery supplies).

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Enriquita has a shop that sells a variety of products like bananas and firewood and serves different varieties of meals. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy yellow and green bananas, raw ingredients for cooking viands (tasty dishes) and firewood.

Enriquita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Enriquita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy yellow and green bananas, raw ingredients for cooking viands and firewood

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 52 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Inés de 46 años y sus 3 queridos hijos menores, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Francisco la crianza de animal vacuno,  es una actividad que le viene de familia, desde muy pequeño aprendió a realizar esta actividad, actualmente él realiza este trabajo y es muy bueno haciéndolo, ya que su reses son muy solicitados en las ferias de Pucallpa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pastear a sus animales y poder permanecer al aire libre. Lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para él es llevar su ganado degollado hasta el camal de Pucallpa. En adelante espera incrementar el número de animales que tiene para así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP y por tal espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Asimismo se compromete en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más forraje para engordar mejor a su ganado.
texts.en:
52 year-old Francisco is a very unassuming and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 46 year-old Inés, and his three beloved children, who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

For Francisco, raising cattle is an activity that comes from his family.  He learned the business when he was very young.  He currently carries out this business and is very good at it.  His cattle are very much in demand in the markets in Pucallpa.

What Francisco most enjoys about his work is pasturing his animals and being able to spend time out in the open air.  He has been in this business for 13 years and the most difficult part of his work is taking his herd to the slaughterhouse in Pucallpa.  In the future, he hopes to increase the number of animals that he owns so that he can improve his income.

This will be Francisco's second loan from MFP and he hopes to receive the support of each one of you.  For his part, he pledges to be punctual in making his repayments.  Francisco will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy more fodder so that he can better fatten his herd.

loans.use: to buy more fodder with which to feed his animals

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, David has operated a shop, selling to his neighbors and passersby. In addition, he also sells water, which contributes additional income. David faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in his business.

David decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With a 20,000 KES loan he wants to purchase water pipes for a water distribution business. His dream is to purchase a water tank in the future.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes for a water distribution business.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a 45-year-old woman who is married and has three sons and two daughters. Majeda's husband Abdul Salam is a taxi driver who drives passengers inside and outside the city. His income is not enough to cover licensing and insurance fees, therefore Majeda took out a loan from FATEN to pay for them. 

Majeda is a conservative woman, therefore her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To pay for car licencing and insurance

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: Carmen de 34 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena  con su esposo y sus hijos en las edades de 1  a 12 años. Allí tiene un negocio en un punto  muy comercial  donde vende de variedades de productos, mediante crédito y de contado; Igualmente para generar otros ingresos los fines de semana tiene otro negocio en el que le va muy bien,  de venta de comidas  rápidas cuya infraestructura física ubica en la puerta de su miscelánea. Como en su negocio hay productos que rotan muy rápidamente, ella para comprar debe esperar reunir un dinero, para responder a su clientela cuando la mercancía se termina, pues su capital de trabajo no es suficiente y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa para niñas, chancletas, accesorios para damas y para el hogar, y también útiles escolares y papelería en general. Con su inyección de este nuevo capital de trabajo financiará su cartera, y surtirá su negocio para que su clientela aumente, así como también sus ingresos que es su gran meta.
texts.en:
Carmen, 34, lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and two children who are 1 and 12 years old.  She has a business there at a commercial spot where she sells a large variety of products both for cash and on credit.  In order to generate extra income she has a weekend job that she does very well in: fast food sales.  This job’s infrastructure is a table she sets up at the entrance to her variety shop.

Her business has items that sell out quickly but she often has to wait until she’s amassed enough money to respond to customer demand when her merchandise runs out because her working capital is small.  This is why she’s calling on her Kiva loan to buy clothes for girls, sandals, accessories for women and for the home and also school supplies and general stationery supplies.  With the injection of this new working capital she will finance her portfolio and stock her business so that her clientele will increase as well as her income which is her main goal.

loans.use: to buy girls' clothes, sandals, women's and home accessories, school supplies and general stationery supplies.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has two children.

Ammar has been the owner of a barber shop since 2004. He has a good experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls.

loans.name: Khader

texts.en:
Khader is a Palestinian man. He is married and has eight sons and two daughters. He has got a license for distributing gas canisters in a vehicle he owns, and he wants to purchase more gas canisters to distribute, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for them, so he needs to take out a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. 

When Khader takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will have more gas canisters to distribute and that will improve his income positively and he can provide his family with better living conditions. Khader is photographed next to the gas canister distribution vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase more gas canisters to distribute.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 33 years old, married and has five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 
Sandra has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.
Sandra has been in this business for a year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia tiene ya más nueve años con su negocio de venta de ropa usada.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar variedad de mercancía que es (Ropa para mujer, hombres, calzado, juguetes y aparatos eléctricos) por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que desea invertir en su negocio. 
Doña Silvia planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, ya que si esposo el señor Cesar se encargara de los familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos con el sueldo que recibe como músico.
texts.en:
Silvia has owned her business selling used clothing for more than nine years.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying a range of merchandise (women's and men's clothes, footwear, toys and electrical appliances).  Right now, she doesn't have the money she needs to make this investment in her business.

Silvia plans to repay her loan with the profits that she makes from her business as her husband, Cesar, will take charge of the family and the school expenses of their two children with the salary he earns as a musician.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Lota

texts.en:
Lota is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Lota has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Lota has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lota hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 32 years old. He is married.

Nelson is engaged in raising hogs, which he sells. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy additional feed for his hogs, which he intends to sell.

Nelson has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nelson hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for the hogs

loans.name: Ruth Elena

texts.es:
A sus 39 años de edad Ruth es una mujer emprendedora que ha luchado con gran esmero para sacar adelante a sus 7 hijos, actualmente tiene su propio negocio, una tienda en la que trabaja día a día con la ilusión de tener un progreso notable.

Ruth sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y es conciente que para ello debe seguir trabajando con la misma tenacidad que hasta ahora para que su negocio crezca, por esto hoy tiene la motivación de solicitar un crédito, el cual invertirá en surtido para la tienda, pues tener variedad, calidad y cantidad es clave para la mejoría de las ventas, y en este momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para la compra de Gaseosas, legumbres y snaks.
texts.en:
At the age of 39, Ruth Elena is an enterprising woman who has worked with much dedication to raise her seven children.  She currently has a business of her own: a grocery store that she works in day to day hoping to make notable progress.

Ruth dreams with her children becoming professionals and she’s aware that to do so she must continue working with the same tenacity she’s had to date so that the business will grow.  Because of this, today she’s motivated to request a loan that she’ll use to buy stock merchandise for the store because having variety, quality and quantity is the key for improving sales and she currently lacks the necessary capital to buy soft-drinks, vegetables and snacks.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and general merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Myrna has a pigpen and sells matured and grown pigs. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Wekhoyela Group

texts.en:
David is the facilitator of the Wekhoyela group. David and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

David takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, David had an excellent maize yield harvesting nine bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, David was only able to harvest 3 ½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to David and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, David will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wekhoyela group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

David and the group members appear in the photograph as shown.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rino

texts.en:
Rino is 29 years old and lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He runs a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business. He has had this business for 5 months. Rino earns about 10,000 PHP from this business.

Rino requested this loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts. Rino hopes to have a stable business. He also hopes to continue supporting his family financially.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.

Maricar has a vegetable garden and she sells vegetables such as patola, ampalaya, and string-beans every harvest time. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 13,200 to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden. 

Maricar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maricar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with two children. 
Marita has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and trout. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy fish to sell.
Marita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Sara San Isidro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre Sara san Isidro, los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre porque así se llama la persona que formo el grupo y en honor a su comunidad, es por eso que escogieron este nombre, la historia es acerca de la señora Sara ya que es la representante de este grupo, cuenta con 41 años de edad y está casada con el señor Porfirio Ruiz quien es campesino, tienen 2 hijos Manuel y Alejandra los cuales cursan sexto año de primaria y segundo año de secundaria, ella se dedica a la venta de productos agrícolas como sandias, melones, elotes, jitomates y chiles desde hace 4 años.

Doña Sara decidió iniciar con este negocio, por que tenia la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y sacar a sus hijos adelante, ya que no tenia la solvencia económica suficiente para conseguir darles una mejor educación, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como sandias, melones, elotes, jitomates y chiles.

 
Ella desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y así poder hacerlo crecer mucho mas, puesto que quiere construir un local para poner su tienda de frutas y verduras y así incrementar y mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, puesto que así podrá seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener una muy buena profesión y también seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

Ella esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y con Fundación realidad, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio.

Otras de las compañeras de doña Sara son: Silvia, María del socorro, Mireya y magdalena, quienes realizan variadas actividades como son: venta de frutas, comida, ropa y zapatos
texts.en:
This group goes by the name Sara San Isidro.  They named their group after the person who started it and in honor of their community.  This profile is about Sara as she is the group representative.  She is 41 years old and is married to Señor Profirio Ruiz who is a farmer.  They have 2 children, Manuel and Alejandra, who are in the sixth year of elementary school and the second year of high school.  She has been selling produce such as watermelons, melons, sweet corn, tomatoes and chilies for 4 years.  

Doña Sara decided to start this business because she needed to improve her quality of life and that of her family and provide for her children as she didn't have the financial means to give them a better education.  She plans to invest her loan in the purchase of products such as watermelons, melons, sweet corn, tomatoes and chilies.  
 
She wants to keep investing in her business so that it can grow since she wants to build a place from which to sell her fruits and vegetables.  This way she will be able to increase and improve her sales and income.  She can also continue supporting her children in their studies so they can work in a good profession and also, continue improving their quality of life.  

She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and to Fundación Realidad because, thanks to them, she is getting ahead and has been able to have her own business.  

Doña Sara's other partners are: Silvia, María del Socorro, Mireya and Magdalena who work at various other activities such as fruit, food, clothing and shoe sales.

loans.use: purchase watermelons, melons, sweet corn, tomatoes and chilies.

loans.name: Baasankhuu

texts.en: Baasankhuu, aged 35, is the host of the bathhouse in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running it since last spring and already has many permanent customers. He supplies water from the other baths by using a one ton cistern truck. But last month, his truck engine and gearbox broke down completely due to damage. Therefore he needs to repair his truck immediately in order to recommence his business. Otherwise, as he said, if it continues for many days, he will lose most of his customers. The loan he is taking out will be dedicated to purchasing the spare parts for his truck repair.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his truck repair.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Bor. She has a food stall, and has been in business for one year. She is 35 years old, married, and has six children, five of whom are still in school. 

Sarah heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans for sale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 28-year-old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a carpentry business. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are urban residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase a motorbike to start a motorcycle transport business. This will enable him to increase his income. His business goal is to open an additional carpentry outlet within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to start a motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is a 45-year-old woman who is married with one child. She is a hairdresser and has been in this business for 15 years. She has one apprentice who helps her in her salon. Her business is the only source of income for her family of three. Charlotte is very hardworking and is single handedly taking care of her daughter's university education. Her husband is sick and bedridden so he cannot help with the management of their home. 
With this loan, Charlotte will be able to buy a new washing sink to replace the old one in her salon. She believes having a new washing sink will enable her to work more effectively, which will boost her income to sustain her family.

loans.use: To buy a washing sink to support her salon business

loans.name: Libertad

texts.en: Libertad is an active member of Paglaum MPC since 2005 and access its programs and services including insurance services. Recently, she avails a loan to pay for tooth extraction and dentures.

loans.use: to pay for tooth extraction and dentures

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana has a small store she has owned for over 5 years. She sells a little bit of everything. Prior to opening her store she used to work with her late husband selling seafood. They worked together for about 8 years until one night he was killed in a robbery attempt. Although this was very tough for Ana, she had to continue to make income to support her 3 kids. She worked selling various items door-to-door until a family member from Spain gave her a $1000 loan to get her store up and running. She now needs to continue investing in her store in order to make her business successful. She plans on investing in beef, poultry, eggs and other foods to sell from her store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in meats and other foods for her market

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.en: Rosalia has a store which she has owned for about 8 years. She started her business with money she had saved up and the help of a loan from a family member. She sells a variety of different items ranging from rice to snacks. She is requesting the loan because she wants to turn her food market into a general store. She hopes she can begin to offer other products, specifically focusing on school supplies because the school year is set to start soon. This business is a very important part of Rosalia’s household. Although her husband works hard as a door-to-door salesman of goods, Rosalia must rely on her store in order to cover the basic expenses. With the loan she will continue supporting her three kids in their studies and she will also try to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: Invest in school supplies

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
R. Rani  47 years old (ID 172 – M), wife of Late Amullah Chandra Barman, is a member of Sabuj Mohila Somity. She becomes the member of group in 22-12-2002. She has three sons who are day laborers. Income of the family is very small to meet the family expenses. So, she started a grocery shop where she keeps rice, pulses, coarse flour, sugar, tea leaves, edible oils, onions, bread biscuits etc. Her elder son assists her in shop by selling betel and betel nut in a corner of the shop. Her son is seen sitting in the shop beside her. 

The shop is in her own land therefore, she does not have to pay any rent, she herself is the seller.  She wishes to keep more goods in her shop and start a small tea stall in one corner so that her son also is able sit in one corner of the shop to run the tea stall. She needs more capital fund to invest in her shop. Her need is US $ 1,000.

loans.use: Purchase of daily  necessary goods

loans.name: Fotu

texts.en: Fotu is a young married woman from Siumu, operating a banana plantation not far from her backyard. Her husband works the land in the plantation. She joined the South Pacific Business Development program in 2005 and is now on her fifth loan. She used to sell 15-20 bags of banana at Fugalei Market and she received $200-$300 a week from those sales. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy more raw material for the plantation.

loans.use: To buy more raw material for the plantation

loans.name: I Nyoman Darma

texts.id:
Breeding pigs in Bali is not only carried out by women, as an example, I Nyoman Darma a father is not ashamed to do it as it good work and lucrative. Currently, Nyoman Darma raises the local Bali breed because the community requires this breed for religious ceremonies. Nyoman Darma raises the breeder sow, which in a year can produce twice, each time with up to 8 piglets. He needed this additional capital to purchase another breeder sow, which he had already readied a pen. With this additional breeder sow his consideration and output will increase.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha beternak babi di Bali tidak hanya dilakukan oleh kaum wanita saja contohnya I Nyoman Darma adalah seorang bapak yang tidak pernah merasa malu untuk melakukan suatu pekerjaan yang baik dan menguntungkan. Nyoman Darma pun bisa melakukan usaha beternak babi dan semuanya dilakukan dengan sabar. Saat ini Nyoman Darma memelihara babi jenis Lokal atau babi Bali. Karena masyarakat di Bali banyak membutuhkan babi jenis ini untuk upacara keagamaan. Nyoman Darma memelihara induk babi yang dalam setahun bisa berproduksi sebanyak dua kali, dengan perkiraan jumlah anak per satu kali panen sebanyak 8 ekor. Nyoman Darma sangat membutuhkan modal tambahan untuk membeli satu ekor induk babi lagi.Untuk keperluan itu, Nyoman Darma sudah menyiapkan kandang yang kosong. Dengan menambah jumlah induk babi, perhitungan Nyoman Darma jumlah penghasilannya pun bertambah.

loans.use: Purchase Breeder Sows (Membeli induk babi untuk menambah populasi babinya, sehingga dapat dijual untuk meningkatkan pendapatannya)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of materials for furniture finishing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his small scale farming and barber shop

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Her difficult economic situation and the misunderstanding on her parents part for her need of a good education were the principal reasons that Lucia had to quit her secondary school studies. Afterwards, she began to work at a very young age, however, despite these disadvantages, she has always tried to improve her life. She is currently the single mother of 3 small children after her husband left her without any kind of economic support. Ever since, she has worked tirelessly selling merchandise in her area and right now the products with the biggest demand are slippers, towels,underwear etc. And so, she needs to expand her collection of goods. But to do so she needs a loan with which she can travel to Tacna to purchase these items to later resell in the market at Dominical plaza in her hometown. Lucia trusts that with your help, she can improve her economic situation and improve the lives of her children by giving them the opportunity to be educated all the way through university, an opportunity she never had.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Sus bajos recursos económicos y el desentendimiento de sus padres por su educación fueron las razones que Lucia tuvo para abandonar sus estudios secundarios y ponerse a trabajar a muy corta edad, pese a las dificultades que le puso la vida siempre trato de sobresalir. Actualmente es padre y madre de sus 3 hijos, puesto que su esposo la abandonó sin ningún respaldo económico cuando sus éstos aún eran muy pequeños, desde entonces trabajó perseverantemente en su negocio de venta de mercadería por campañas, en esta temporada el producto de mayor demanda es la venta de pantuflas, toallas, ropas interiores, etc. es por esa razón que desea aumentar el volumen de su mercadería y requiere obtener un préstamo de dinero con el que tiene programado viajar a la ciudad de Tacna para adquirir los artículos a fin de venderlos en la plaza Dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca. Lucia confiá que con tu apoyo su situación económica mejoraráy así sus hijos tendrán la oportunidad de ir y concluir sus estudios universitarios, oportunidad que ella nunca tuvo.

loans.use: To purchase more products for the summer.

loans.name: Lenith

texts.es:
Getting up early to prepare papaya juice, apple juice and other mixed juices, is the daily routine of Lenith, a lady who every morning sells her delicious nectars accompanied by a roll with ham or egg. Lenith is 40 years old and is the mother of 3 children, who are still in elementary school. Her husband, Julio, is self-employed as a mototaxi driver. They were always together in their goal of contributing to the progress of their children and are very proud of them. This is why Lenith has the desire to drive her business to the next level, and eventually build a place where she can sell her juices. She also wants to repair her husband's mototaxi since he's been struggling with different mechanical problems each day. With your help this mother will achieve her goals within a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Levantarse temprano y preparar los jugos de papaya, manzana, mixtos entre otros, es la rutina diaria de la señora Lenith, quien vende todas las mañanas sus deliciosos néctares acompañados de un pan con jamón o huevo. Lenith tiene 40 años de edad y es madre de 03 hijos aún etapa escolar, su esposo el señor, Julio, quien es trabajador independiente(chofer de mototaxi) siempre la apoya en todo, y ambos se trazaron una meta, contribuir con el progreso de sus hijos y sentirse orgullosos de ellos.Así mismo Lenith, tienen deseos de implementar su negocio y con el tiempo construir un local adecuado para la venta de los mismos, también quiere reparar el mototaxi de su esposo ya que a diario tiene muchas dificultades que impiden su normal desenvolvimiento.Con tu ayuda esta madre logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: To build a small place where she can run her juice business and repair her beloved husband's mototaxi. (Implementación de su pequeño centro de producción de jugos y reparación de la herramienta de trabajo de su querido esposo.)

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu sells tie-dye materials, pans and other essential goods.  Family members also help her sell some of the goods in the villages and collect the cash on a weekly basis.  With her previous loans from SMT, she diversified her business and would like to expand it further.  She is therefore requesting for a loan of $675 for so her business can continue to grow.

loans.use: To further expand a successful small business

loans.name: Parween

texts.en: Parween lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow and has five children who are in school. She is the one to support her family. She is a tailor and has good experience and a good number of clients. She works in her home. She wants to expand her business so she has requested an individual loan to buy new machines and open a tailoring shop to make good income and help her children to make a better future for her family. She is happy.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Marìa Marta

texts.es:
I´m María Marta B. X.. I`m 43 years old and I sell comales [clay dishes for making tortillas] and clay pots of all sizes. I live in San Raymundo, and since I was little I made comales since that is one of the most common activities. When I married and had kids (now 6 children in all), only making comales was no longer profitable since I had to sell them here in my pueblo and people didn´t pay much for them. So 15 years ago I decided to commercialize my products in other places. We currently go to Taxisco, Chiquimulilla, Pasaco, Sipacate--all on Guatemala´s coast.

Now I´m a wholesaler. I buy the products from people in my pueblo and I have clients who order large quantities of comales and pots. I need more capital to invest and I want to take advantage of this season, when everyone is making comales. If I buy now, then I can have my products stored before winter begins. I want to sell my products in other towns and also I´d like to hire two people who will work full time making comales so I can cover orders during the winter months.

I work hard so my children can continue in school. Four of them are in different grades. I want them to graduate and have a career that´s different from my job.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Soy María Marta B. X., tengo 43 años de edad, el negocio al que me dedico es la venta de comales para hacer tortillas y ollas de barro, de todos tamaños. Vivo en San Raymundo, desde pequeña me dedicaba a la elaboración de comales, ya que en este municipio es una de las actividades màs comunes, al formar mi hogar con mi esposo y al tener mis hijos que son 6 en total, ya solo elaborar comales no era tan rentable ya que los tenia que vender aquí mismo en el pueblo y las personas no pagaban mucho por ellos, hace ya 15 años que decidí salir a comerciar con mi producto a otros lugares, actualmente vamos a los municipios de Taxisco, Chiquimulilla, Pasaco, Sipacate que están en la costa de Guatemala. Ahora ya soy mayorista le compro su producto a las personas del pueblo y caserios cercanos, tengo clientes que me hacen pedidos grandes de comales y ollas, por eso necesito más capital para invertir ya quiero aprovechar que es el tiempo en que la gente produce bastantes comales y que al comprarlos pueda tener almacenado mi mercadería antes que inicie el invierno. Quiero visitar otros municipios para ofrecer mi producto y tambien contratar a dos personas para que me trabajen fijo y comprar material para elaborar comales, ya que esto me ayudará a poder cubrir los pedidos durante los meses de invierno, siempre trabajo muy duro para que mis hijos sigan estudian ya que 4 de ellos esta en diferentes grados y que puedan graduarse y tener una carrera para que puedan tener un trabajo diferente al mío.

loans.use: Wholesale investments in comales and clay pots

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Afua K. sells palm oil. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Afua and her six children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business selling palm oil.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Yana Ñahui Village Bank (meaning Black Eyes in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Paulina is a married 55-year-old mother of eight children. Paulina has a stand in a market in the district of Carmen Alto where she sells groceries. Paulina also raises small animals such as guinea pigs and rabbits in her home and sells them to middlemen.

Paulina needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($725 USD) that she will invest in rice, sugar, oil, noodles and milk.

Paulina´s dream is to improve her business, have a store in her home and that her children will be established economically.

loans.use: Paulina needs a loan that she will invest in rice, sugar, oil, noodles and milk.

loans.name: Neema's Neema Group

texts.en:
Neema is a 28-year-old married woman with three children, ages 2 months to 12 years. She has owned a small shop since 2003. Every day, she works from 1am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US225 from her sales.

Neema now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses selling vegetables and fruits and clothes.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Mr. Loem Khroeurn Group

texts.en:
Mr. Loem K. is the group leader in Kuy Village and this group consists of four members who plan to use the loan for different purposes. For instance, Mr. Loem K. is requesting a loan to buy fishnets for catching more fish. His wife, Mrs. Em Noeurn, is a farmer and she also raises four cows in order to re-sell them later at a better price. Mr. Loem K. is 44 years old and the father of three children who are all attending school. 
All the members have end-of-term loans and these members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fishnets for catching more fish.

loans.name: Atuganile

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Atuganile from Dar es Salaam. She is a divorced woman with two children, ages 15 and 24. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants because their parents do not take care of them. Since 2003, Atuganile has been selling traditional African. Her business is doing good. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Atuganile currently earns about $100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $275 USD to buy traditional African cloth such as kanga and vitenge, which she hopes to sell for a profit. Atuganile thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloth in bulk for her clothing store.

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar Abdul Majeed Group

texts.en:
Shamim Akhtar baji is the wife of A. M. and lives in the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan which is famous for its shrine of the great Punjabi Sufi poet Babar Fareed Ganj Shakkard. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 2 years. Shamim Akhtar baji is the mother of four young children: two sons and two daughters all of whom are attending school. Shamim baji's husband has owned a grocery shop in the community for the past 16 years. Shamim baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and taking care of her family.

Shamim baji has successfully repaid her past two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband's grocery shop. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shaheen baji is requesting a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Zahida baji is requesting a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Tasleem baji is requesting a loan to buy tools for her bicycle repairing business. Hafeez baji is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Yolith

texts.es:
La señora Yolith, socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín,  provincia de el Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a  la venta de abarrotes y su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Egilba Ramírez Gómez s/n,- cdra 03 caserío san isidro. Sus clientes son los vecinos y personas que viven en los caseríos más cercanos.
 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite, leche grande y pequeño en caja, fideos, papel higiénico, sal en paquetes, sillao, gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaños y sabores, sardinas, para surtir bien su negocio, también quiere invertir en su chacra. 

Tiene 40  años de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus dos hijos que aún dependen de ella. Es una mujer muy entusiasta, perseverante e independiente y le gusta manejar su dinero. Tiene como meta ampliar y surtir mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolith is a member of the Community Bank "Corazon de Jesus" (meaning, Heart of Jesus). She lives in the region of San Martin, in the province of El Dorado, in the District of San Jose de Sisa. She runs a convenience store and it is located in her home at Jr. Egilba R. Gomez s/n, -cdra 3 Caserio San Isidro. Her clients are her neighbours and people whose home is close by.

With this loan of S/.1000, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase rice, sacks of sugar, cooking oil, milk in large and small containers, pasta, bathroom tissue, sal paquets, soy suace, softdrinks of different types and sizes, and sardines, to stock her business. She also wants to invest in her cultivating field.

She is 40 years old, lives with her husband and her two children who still depend on her. She is a woman with great enthusiasim, perseverence, and independence, and she loves to manage her own money. Her goal is to expand and add more selection to her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sacks of sugar, cooking oil, milk in large and small containers, pasta, bathroom tissue, sal paquets, soy suace, softdrinks of different types and sizes, and sardines.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Munawar Irshad Ahmad Group

texts.en:
I am Munawar and I am 40-years old, married, and live in Pakpattan, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines. I feel  lucky that I got a blessing from God to live be a part of this city. My husband, I. A., works in a factory. I have five children: 4 daughters and 1 son. All of my children are enrolled in a local school and getting an education. My husband pays the household expenses and I pay for the education of my children with my clothes-selling business, a business I've had for over 2 years. I am requesting a loan to buy more clothes to expand my business. 

I am a group leader with 4 others in my group: Bushra baji requests a loan to buy a hair dressing machine for her parlor. Nasreen baji requests a loan to buy wheat to resell. Zubaida baji requests a loan to buy meat to resell. Zareena baji requests a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito G., 46 years old from East Poblacion, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store.  She is married and the mother of three children.  Her husband is a fire fighter, but his salary is not enough to sustain the family's needs. Charito's sari-sari store increases the family income. Mrs. G. and her husband put most of their extra money towards education for their children. Charito has worked hard to grow her business from the little store she built with 3000 Philippine Pesos (63 USD). She is amazed by how far she has come, and is hopeful for the future of her business. They have built a network loyal customers, mainly friends and neighbors. Charito had been a member of Paglaum MPC for three year, and she has never missed a payment.

loans.use: buying supplies and expanding inventory

location.town: Calamba-East Poblacion, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Jesús Angelita

texts.es:
La señora Jesús Angelita V. C., tiene 34 años, vive en la Urb.  La Rinconada, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio primaria completa, dejo los estudios porque se inclino mas por el negocio y porque se vino a vivir a Trujillo, tiene 02 hijas que dependen enteramente de ella.
Jesús se dedica a la venta de cerveza y productos de belleza, al principio empezó su negocio vendiendo pan y raspadilla en verano, luego con sus ganancias se inicio en la venta de productos de belleza, roscas, manjar, y cerveza, negocio que hasta ahora desarrolla en su propia casa y que le da muchas ganancias. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, lo invirtió en la compra de  quesos, roscas y manjar.
Con este crédito de 1500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza, productos de belleza e insumos para la venta de raspadilla.
Jesús sueña con construir su casa y tener una bodega.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jesus Angelita V. C. is 34 years old and lives in the Rinconada neighborhood in Trujillo, La Libertad, Peru. She was able to complete her studies through elementary school but left them because she was more inclined to working and because she came to live in Trujillo. She has two children who are dependent on her. Jesus works selling beer and beauty products; in the beginning she started her business selling bread and snow-cones during the summer. Later, with her income she began selling beauty products, small ring-cakes, caramel, and beer; she has developed the business out of her own home and it provides her with a good income. With her first loan of $100 which she received from Mujeres Decididas II (Decisive Women II) village bank, she invested in the purchase of cheeses, ring-cakes and caramel. With this $475 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of beer, beauty products and ingredients for the sale of snow-cones. Jesus dreams of building a home and having a small store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer, beauty products, and ingredients for snow-cone sales; Jesus dreams of building a home and having her own store

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Mr. Sarat C., 41, and his wife, Mrs. Thea Nhem, 36, were married in 1990 and have two children: a son and a daughter, who are both in school. The family lives along National Road Number 6, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sarat has been driving taxi in his village and the adjacent village for 6 years. His wife has been selling Khmer noodles (vermicelli) in her village for 2 years. Currently, Sarat and his wife stay with their parents but they would like to live in a home of their own. Sarat is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a house for his family.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en: Roland is a 30-year-old single man, living in Al Ashrafieh in the Beirut suburbs. Since 2008, he has owned a cafeteria at a University in Beirut where he services the students. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase a coffee machine to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase a coffee machine

loans.name: Edwige

texts.fr:
AGBANGLA Edwige est née vers 1972. Edwige est mariée à AGBOTOUNNOU Daniel. Edwige est mère de trois (3) enfants tous scolarisés. Edwige réside avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Edwige vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de mayonnaise, de beurre, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, papiers hygiéniques, de bougies,de mousticos, etc.). Le lieu de vente de Edwige, c'est le marché de Gbégamey, un quartier populaire de Cotonou. Edwige s’approvisionne en ces produits à Cotonou au marché international du Bénin. Edwige a besoin de moyens financiers pour hisser son activité à un niveau plus élevé afin de mieux servir sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Edwige sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
AGBANGLA Edwige was born around 1972. She is married to AGBOTOUNNOU Daniel and is the mother of three children, all in school. She resides with her family in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Edwige sells various goods (candy, cookies, canned milk, sardines, and tomatoes, mayonnaise, butter, sugar, pasta, soaps for the dishes and bath, toilet paper, candles, mousticos, etc.) Her sales outlet is at the marketplace of Gbégamey, a working-class district of Cotonou. Supplies of these goods are gotten in Cotonou at the international marketplace of Benin. Edwige is in need of funding to raise her business to a higher level in order to serve her customers betters. This is why she’s requesting a loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned milk, sardines, tomatoes, mayonnaise, butter, sugar, pasta…

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde sells palm oil, vegetable oil and foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount N70,000 to purchase more palm oil and vegetable oil. Kehinde is 32 years old and married with three children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil and vegetable oil to sell

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora O. is a widow with six children. She is 52 years old. She rears pigs to make a living.

She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more pigs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to rear and sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Mr. Jose R. earns his living by selling fishing accessories, which he and his father make from their home. He supplies his materials from Market 4 in Asunción, where he buys everything he needs to make these accessories.

Jose has a well-established clientele, which means that he does most of business through advance orders. Jose needs this loan for the purchase of materials that he will be able to buy in bulk for a lower price. He intends to buy leads, fishing line, poles, etc.

In the future, Jose wishes to be able to purchase a vehicle in order to better carry out his work.

loans.use: To purchase leads, fishing line, poles, etc.

loans.name: Riffat Rashid Group

texts.en:
Riaz baji and Kanizan baji each want a loan to buy clothes to sell. Nadia Saeed baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy ingredients like lentils, spices and cooking oil for her food selling business. Abida baji wants a loan to buy beads, colored thread and clothes for her decorative embroidery business.

Riffat baji is the leader of this group of ladies. All of them live in the city of Vehari, Pakistan. Her husband, R., works in a factory on a monthly wage. Riffat baji is a very hardworking lady. She knows that her husband’s income is insufficient to meet their expenses; therefore, she prepares decorative embroidery on clothes. Her purpose is to share the financial burden of her husband and to pay off the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy materials like colored thread, clothes and beads for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is now 48 years old and is married to Edemar D. R.. They are blessed with three children namely: Edilmar Lisa, Jay, and Edimar. Her children already have their own families and, at her age, Estelita already has grandchildren and one of them lives with her.

Estelita lives in the rural village of Catabban Burgos, Isabela. In the village her family lives simply, with farming as their main source of income. Estelita is raising a pig in their backyard to generate additional income for their needs. At the moment, Estelita is the one responsible for sending her grandson’s niece to school. She helps her husband in generating income for their family.

Estelita wants to borrow PHP 10,000 from Kiva as additional capital for her hog-raising and fish-vending businesses. She wants to sustain her businesses in order give her grandson and niece an education they will be able to treasure for the rest of their lives. She believes that hard work and patience are the best remedies in overcoming the difficulties of life.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is 42 years old, is divorced, and is the mother of a girl who is currently breastfeeding. As a single mother she always works hard to provide for, and provide health support for, her child. She is determined to provide for her child through hard work and commitment.

Dora sells cosmetics, clothing materials, traveling bags, etc. in the market center of her community where she lives. She has been in business for close to thirty years now. She says the selling of cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to sponsor her child’s education. She is very sure that your loan support will bring her the desired results.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Lavalea

texts.en:
"Lavalea S. (0) is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Solaua.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Lavalea owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling baked goods in the local community.  Lavalea has been engaged in this business for over 4 years.

Lavalea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lavalea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Lavalea is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Lavalea plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 33 year married with 4 children aged between 6 and 19 years.All her children go to school. Florence resides and owns a two roomed house where she staying with five people. There is electricity and no piped water at home. Florence takes care of additional family members aged 6 and 9 yaers  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 10 customers a day. Florence owns a retail shoping selling home products goods and other soft drinks in Kamwokya kifumbira and sells to all categories of people.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.  The major challenges she faces in her business are transportation and medication and feeding the family.  Florence has been with MCDT for 10 years servicing her twentieth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda and beer Florence is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business structure and also build a house from the available profits

loans.use: To buy more Merchandise and soft drinks

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie has been married to her husband, Arnel, for seven years now. They are blessed with four children, the eldest being fourteen years old. Jessie is thirty-four years old and tills a rice farm for a living. She is thankful her crops are growing healthy and this encourages her to take extra care of her farm. To achieve good harvest, her farm needs inputs. A new member of CEV, Jessie requested for a loan of Php6, 000. This loan will help Jessie and her family to produce good income from the farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel H. R. D. C. D. 50 años D. edad vive con su esposo e hijos en casa propia que se encuentra ubicada en el departamento D. San Salvador. Reina tiene nueve años D. administrar D. su negocio, es una tienda con productos D. consumo la cual hoy por medio D. este crédito desea surtir, Reina se compromete a ser muy puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel H. R. D. C. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and children in her own house located in the San Salvador district. Reina has been running her business for nine years, which is a grocery store. She would like to use this loan to buy supplies for her store, and she promises to be very punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for her business

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Ban V., 37, is married with a school-aged child. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia with her husband and her child. To make a living, she is employed as a chef for wedding ceremonies in the town and other places in the province, earning approximately US $9.9 per day as a primary source of income for the family. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Her husband operates a business renting the equipment for wedding parties, earning an income of US $5 per day. Mrs. V. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, V. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more cooking supplements to aid her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking supplements

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mr. Thorn T. is a villager who lives in Tralach village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Nhoan Noem, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice.  In this plantation, they face a problem because the field is infertile which it is bad enough to affect their crop. Thus, Mr. Thorn T. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the field. He would use the rest of the loan to buy more pesticides to make her crop more productive.

He is the father of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is enrolled in the local school. His wife is shown on the picture with him.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the rice field

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 58-year-old married man and father of three children. He has been working as a taxi driver since 2000 to earn income for the family. Today, Samir is requesting to borrow $600 to perform maintenance on his car to continue his work properly.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his car

loans.name: Chucks

texts.en: Chucks sells electronics and electrical materials at retail prices to his customers. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is 40 years old and married with four children. His eldest child is 9 years old. His children are still dependent on him, and they go to school. He is a hard-working man. He is an honest and faithful LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. He has been in this business for a long time. He is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more electronics and electrical materials to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics and electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en:
Ngozi has a bakery where she bakes loaves of bread to sell. She has been in this business for a long time. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

Ngozi is 38 years old and married with five children. Her youngest child is 10 years old. With the proceeds from her business, she has been able to take care of her family.

Ngozi needs a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more baking materials to bake more loaves of bread to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Ngozi is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials to bake more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Kaberael

texts.en:
Kaberael is a 40-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife. Kaberael has owned a butcher shop for over fifteen years. When he first started his business, he had some financial issues because the cost of his machines is high.
