He decided to operate his shop because he learned the business when he was young, and now has taken over his father's business. Kaberael is well known for his business because of the good quality of the meat he sells. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region.

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to repair one of his machines. This is the first time that Kaberael has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work by always providing the best to his clients.

loans.use: To repair one of his machines.

loans.name: Victoria Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en:
F. Ayubu is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is 35 years old and married with six children aged 12 to 2 years. He also takes care of three dependents, two of them orphans.

Ayubu operates a ferry service from Buvuma to Kiyindi, mostly operating from Kilongo landing site. He has transported traders for eleven years and he is able to make 70,000/= as profits every week. He says that this profit margin would have been higher only there is a ferry that offers free transport to traders and his only chance is that it is slow and takes a long time to fill.

Ayubu would like to expand his business. He already has four fishing boats and he would like to use his loan to buy fishing nets and hooks and employ three people on each boat for increased earnings.

Ayubu is such a friendly and hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and hooks for his four boats

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas L. has a sari-sari store. She also sells food items in the streets to be able to supplement her income. She has five children. Her eldest who is 24 years old hopes to go to school. Felicitas wants to have a bigger business to accommodate their daily needs.

She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc.  If she gets a loan, she will use it to buy food ingredients.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Levie

texts.en:
Levie M. is from the village of Pangabuan Tangub City. She is 35 years old. Levie is married and has 1 school-aged child. Levie owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, biscuits, noodles, toothpaste, candies and etc. in the local community. Levie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4900 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Levie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Levie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Levie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en: There are 11 members in the village bank loan located Kor village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sarom M. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. They will use the loans for different purposes. Mrs. Sarom M. and her husband, Mr. Marn Chey, are farmers who own a 3.50-hectare field to cultivate rice. They now face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their farm. Thus, Mrs. Sarom M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay out for plowing labor and farming labor. This couple has four children who are studying and also support their parent's farm. Mr. Phon Ouch who is a group guarantor is also presented in the picture with the village bank members.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for plowing & farming labor.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Jacinto tiene 39 años, convive con la madre de sus cuatro hijos, que se encuentra en etapa escolar y juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en un centro poblado de Ayacucho. Lo suyo es el campo, desde que tenía 12 años. Es así que cada mañana parte a su chacra, por lo que se siente feliz ejerciendo este oficio, de agricultor, siendo el cultivo de cacao lo que realiza. Jacinto sintió que tenía que entrar en acción, es por ello que está rescatando un patrimonio, de los que sus padres lo hicieron de la misma manera. Desde luego que en época de sembrío y cosecha necesita de sus peones, pero en tiempo de vacaciones escolares, entre Enero a Marzo, recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Generalmente  sus productos los vende en los Centros de Acopio de su comunidad, resultándole rentable esta venta, ayudándolo a sostener a su familia. En el futuro espera ampliar su terreno de cultivo, para que así pueda cultivar Café y Frutas cítricas. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, del cual se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos respectivos, además no tiene ninguna dificultad con sus compañeros de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su chacra, para que pueda en menor tiempo producir en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
Jacinto is 39 years old. He lives with the mother of his four children, who are of school age. They live together in their own house, located in the city of Ayacucho. The field has been his since he was 12. Thus every morning he leaves for his farm, and for this he feels happy, doing the work of a farmer, raising cacao. Jacinto felt that he had to take action; it is for that reason that he is redeeming a patrimony, just as his parents did. Since then, in the planting and harvest seasons he needs workers, but during the school vacations, between January and March, he receives the help of his children. He generally sells his products in the Collection Center of his community, which results in a profitable sale, helping him to support his family.

In the future, he hopes to extend the land he cultivates, so that he can also raise coffee and citrus fruits. This is his fourth loan from MFP, and he promises to make all the payments. Furthermore, he has no difficulties with the members of his community bank. With the loan he is applying for, he will invest in the maintenance of his farm, so that he can produce greater quantities in less time.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for his farm

loans.name: Mrs. Sophea Khim Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is for a group that consists of nine people who live in Stueng Chrov village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sophea K. is the leader of this group, selected by all the members of the group. Each member will use a loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sophea K. sells vegetables in a local market. Her husband, Mr. Choeurn Chey, is a construction worker and a fisherman. Her husband did not have enough fishing supplies to support his work as a fisherman. To improve this business, Mrs. Sophea K. is asking for a loan to buy a boat. She supports three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory. Another is a furniture maker. The third is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy a boat

loans.name: Ndathé

texts.fr: Ndathé T. est une femme de 37 ans, elle est célibataire et mère d'un enfant en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE dont elle est la trésorière depuis le 22 octobre 2007 et y a eu de bonnes expériences avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficier 5 fois de suite. Elle développe un petit commerce de produits cosmétiques depuis plus de 5ans, cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent d'équiper sa chambre, de satisfaire ses besoins personnels et ceux de son enfant. Son objectif est de renforcer son petit commerce et d'augmenter sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ndathé T. is a 37-year old single mother, and has been a member of the Diamaguene credit association, of which she is now Treasurer, since the 22nd of October 2007. She has received 5 loans from them. For the past five years she has sold cosmetics for a living, and this business generates profits which have enabled her to furnish her bedroom, and to see to her own needs and those of her child. Her aim is to boost her business and increase her customer base.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boost her cosmetics business

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina, de 40 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Iván de 42 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. El negocio de Alejandrina es la venta de Películas, canciones, documentales, dibujos animados, en formato DVD, aprovechando las ferias dominicales de la ciudad de Pichanaki para vender su producto, ya que sabe que existe una gran demanda por los DVDs y que es un negocio muy rentable. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede decidir cuando trabaja y cuando no, aunque le sea difícil tener que armar todos los días su puesto de venta, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Con el tiempo, desea tener una tienda de videos más adelante, con la cual obtenga mejores ingresos económicos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar puntualmente, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, donde participa activamente. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más DVDs, para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a 40-year-old mother, who lives in her own home with 42-year-old husband Ivan and her two children. They are the principal inspiration for her hard work and happy spirit. Alejandrina sells films, documentaries, cartoons and music on DVD at Sunday markets in Pichanaki, where demand for these products is high and business is very profitable. She has been working in this business for two years. She likes her work very much, particularly since it allows her to decide her own working hours. Setting up her stall every day is a chore but she accepts this is her job and something she has to do. In the future, she would like to set up a video store and improve her income. This is her second loan with MFP, which she is ready to pay on time, since she does not want to let down her business partners. With the two thousand soles she has requested, she will buy more DVDs to offer a greater range to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more DVD films and documentaries

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.en:
Maria Natividad R., a married woman who lives in Sito Canalum, Nangka, Bawayan City, Negros Oriental, earns her living by operating a general store business and as a chusphachem dealer. Her husband, Jenito R., 45, works as a farmer and a tricycle driver to earn his living. They have three children, ages 15, 17, and 19 years old.

Maria Natividad joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maria Natividad has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9000, thereby uplifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 as additional capital for business, for her children's education and to continue to save up for future home repairs. Maria Natividad R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Junior F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called In God We Trust. He is 31 years old, married, and has four children who range from 3 to 13 years old. He was able to attend school only through 9th grade due to poverty.
  
For two years, he has been selling batteries, soft drinks, candles, soap, cremes and so on in Pelele Town, Bong County, central Liberia. 

He plans to use his 4,000 LRD portion of this 20,000 LRD group loan to buy more batteries, soft drinks, candles, soaps, cremes, etc.

He describes himself as friendly. His dream is to expand his business and open a store.

loans.use: To buy more batteries, soft drinks, candles, soaps, cremes etc.

loans.name: Natividad Emperatriz

texts.es:
Natividad Emperatriz M. L. tiene 48 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  tiene 5 hijos, Fernando, Roxana, Mariana, Hernán y Jahaira vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.
 
Natividad  es una socia de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Natividad se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Realiza sus compras cada seis  meses en Matilde Esther y los productos los vende en la localidad de la comunidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra incrementar su negocio comprarse una casa y dar la educación a los hijos. Enfrenta desafíos  las enfermedades.

Le gusta criar pollos.
texts.en:
Natividad Emperatriz M. L. is 48 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and five children: Fernando, Roxana, Mariana, Hernán, and Jahaira. She lives in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar.

Natividad is a member of the Rey de Reyes rural communal bank, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 members in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they are taking out with Cooperativa San José.

Natividad works raising chickens. She makes her purchases every six months in Matilde Esther and she sells her products in the community.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of animals. She feels that the loan is a way of getting ahead. Her dream is to have money for shopping, to expand her business, purchase a house, and provide her children with an education. The challenges that she faces are diseases.

She likes to raise chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of animals.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: This is 21-year-old Jessica L.. She is married and has no children. In 2010, she established her tailoring business. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family. In the future, Jessica plans to earn more in tailoring. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: starting a tailoring business

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.en:
Sofia is 21 years old, married, and has one son. She owns a small, two-roomed house where she has lived with her family for over five years. Her house is situated in the Pakistani city of Multan, famous for its shrines and sweetmeats.
Sofia is a very talented lady. She owns and operates a sewing business in order to share the financial burden with her husband. She is good at her art and gets regular orders from her neighbors. She earns approximately 3,500 to 4,000 PKR from her work, which enables her to pay for the utilities.
Sofia's husband is A. M.. He runs a scrap shop in the market where he deals with rough and old items, such as wooden cupboards, book shelves etc. He has been doing this work for over four years. Sofia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband. With the loan, he will buy scrap for his scrap business and increases his profit on it. Sofia is on her second loan and has proved to be a responsible borrower during her previous loan term.
Note: In this photo, one of the group members, Shazia Perveen, is showing her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase scrap for her husband's business

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda F. is 32 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Kinura within Kalilangan municipality and Bukidnon province on the island of Mindanao. Belinda owns and operates a business venture providing motorcycle services to local community members. Her husband is the driver. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Belinda joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase materials needed to maintain her motorcycle service. She plans to use all additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials needed for her motorcycle's upkeep

loans.name: Orgilbulag

texts.en:
Orgilbulag B. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a "ger," a traditional nomadic housing tent, in Hovd province in western Mongolia. Her oldest attends a school while youngest child stays at home. Her husband works in construction; in short, he does all kinds of jobs that bring him money to supplement his family's income. 

Orgilbulag currently operates a grocery trading business at a local market. She started her business in 2009 in a rented store in her town. Her store location is in a popular spot that attracts many customers. Her daily income is between 50,000 and 100,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). For the future, she hopes to grow her business and have her own land with a fence for her family. She has good moral character. 

Orgilbulag is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more inventory for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita D. is 46 years old, married and has three children. She is from the village of Dicoyong, a part of Sindangan municipality, Zamboanga del Norte province on the Mindanao islands. Amelita runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008 Amelita joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Amelita is requesting a new loan, her sixth from PMPC, of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new items to expand her product offerings

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIWASI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra.Miriam; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias y también es ama de casa y le gustaría que sus hijos salgan profesionales,la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para gastos familares para la educación y mantención de sus hijos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “QORIWASI” communal bank. It is located in the district of Cuzco, province and department of Cuzco. 

The member is Miriam. She is 52 years old, married and the mother of 3. She is a housewife and she would like for her children to have professions. She wants to have a grocery store. She is asking for the loan for family expenses and for the education and support of her children.  

This member is grateful to those who are a part of her dream in this way and she is commited to making the payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan for family expenses for the education and support of her children.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora J.  is currently in the business of selling mixed goods like beans, maize flour, rice, etc.  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and maize flour to sell.  

Flora is 47 years old and is widowed.   She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land for her family.

loans.use: To stock rice and flour to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Viola

texts.en:
Ma. Viola M. is from the village of Barangay 5, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Ma. Viola is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Viola owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods, and spices like garlic and onions, in the local community. Ma. Viola has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ma. Viola joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Viola is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ma. Viola from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles K. is 50 years old and is married to Rosaline Cherop, who runs a dairy farm.  He has seven children which he supports, and also supports his parents.  His children are of the following ages: 26 years, 24 years, 18 years(twins), 16 years, 14 years, and 12 years.

Charles does farming, planting and selling watermelons.  He has been in business for two years and his monthly income from the business is Ksh 50,000.  He is borrowing a loan of Ksh 50,000 from KADET LTD, and will use the loan to purchase watermelon seeds and pay labour cost.  He will use the anticipated profit to build a shop and to pay his children school fees. 

This is his fourth loan.  His previous loan have been successfully paid.  His hopes and dreams is to expand the business and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and pay labour cost

loans.name: Nancy Njeri

texts.en:
Nancy is a 45-year-old single mother with three children. Her horticulture farm of 10 years earns Kshs 6,000  monthly. 

She has never borrowed from any other MFI,and this is her second loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous one. She plans to use the loan to purchase manure, pesticides, fertilizer and seedlings. She hopes to be a leading farmer and to give her children a quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy manure, pesticides, fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es una madre de familia de 59 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en uno de los distritos que conforman el distrito de Pacora, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lamayeque y que se encuentra situada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a trabajar en actividades relacionadas a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno. Ella cría vacas en la parte posterior de su domicilio, las alimenta de pastos naturales y cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente comercializa la leche que producen entre sus vecinos. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia por lo que siempre trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

Lucila desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de alimentos balanceado de modo que pueda mejorar la producción de sus animales y de esa manera percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternbativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Lucila is a 59 year-old mother who lives with her family in one of the districts that make up Pacora district.  This is an agricultural area, located in Lambayeque province, more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Lucila has been raising and selling cattle for four years.  She raises cows in an area behind her home.  She feeds them natural fodder and when they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the traders who visit her area.  She also sells the milk that her cows produce to her neighbors.  Her business is an important source of income for her family.  For this reason, she always tries to maintain it in the best possible way.

Lucila would like to expand her business by purchasing balanced animal feed so that she can improve her animal production and, in this way, make better profits.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed so that she can improve her animal production and, in this way, make better profits

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame B. sells clothes for men and women along with slippers and other items of clothing. She moves her wares from one area to another in Takoradi. Maame has completed junior high school and is married with three children. Her husband is a driver and she assists him in taking care of the family’s home. 

Maame will use her loan to buy more goods and expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos (Rocio tiene 25 años, Edit tiene 23 años y Genera tiene 20 años, ellas son independientes). Fortunata vende artesanía en la puerta de los hoteles, en la Plaza de Armas y en los monumentos arqueológicos de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella ofrece a los turistas chompas, chalinas, guantes todo de material en especial de lana de alpaca y oveja. La socia nos cuenta que ella compra sus productos de los mayoristas de la Av. Tupac Amaru que se encuentra al lado del Mercado “San Pedro”. Fortunata es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora que con el pequeño negocio de venta de artesanía saco adelante a sus hijas. Fortunata requiere el préstamo para comprar más  chalinas, chompas y guantes de lana. Fortunata pertenece al banco comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fortunata is 49 years old, married, and has three children: Rocio (age 25), Edit (age 23), and Genera (age 20). All of them live independently.

Fortunata sells crafts at the hotel entrances, at the Plaza de Armas, and at archaeological monuments in the city of Cusco. She offers tourists sweaters, scarves, and gloves made of alpaca and sheep wool. Fortunata says that she buys her products from the wholesalers at the San Pedro Market along Av. Tupac Amaru. She is a determined hardworking woman who engages in her small crafts business so that her daughters can ahead.

Fortunata needs a loan to buy more scarves, sweaters, and gloves made of wool. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Inti”, which is part of Asociación Araiwa. (“Inti” is a Quechua word that means “Sun”.) Fortunata is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase scarves, sweaters, and gloves made of wool

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia C. is a married woman who lives in Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: soft drinks, livestock and a general store. Her husband Alejandro, who is 53 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are 8 to 26 years old. Sergia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sergia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13,400, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000, which she intends to use to buy soft drinks. She also has an inventory of livestock so that she can continue to save up for future education and renovation of her house. Sergia C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Monsieur  Komla  est  âgé de  35 ans.  Il  habite N’kafu. Il fait la vente de cartes  de  recharge.  Il  a commencé  son  activité  en  2008 et s’approvisionne  en gros  à la direction Togocel, Togo Telecom      et  Moov.   Ensuite il  redistribue  en  détail.  Pour satisfaire  beaucoup  de  clients,  il sollicite un crédit   pour se  réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Mr. Komla is 35 years old and lives in N’kafu. He sells mobile phone recharge cards. He started this activity in 2008 and gets his stocks wholesale directly from Togocel, Togo Telecom and Moov for resale at retail. In order to meet customer demand, he is seeking a loan to replenish his stocks.

loans.use: To buy recharge cards

loans.name: Las Esperanzadas Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento "LAS ESPERANZADAS" se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro D. la Institución, compuesto por 9 personas,  sus actividades están entre venta D. ropa, comidas, albañiles, snack, fotocopiadoras y promotoras D. cosméticos, son D. la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa D. la Sra. Silvia que vive por la zona La Campana, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida en las noches en su casa venD.  a sus vecinos y conocidos ya que ella tiene mucha clientela con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Silvia comprara ingredientes y abarrotes para la elaboración D. sus platillos,   su esposo es contratista - albañil, juntos aportan a la economía D. su familia ya que viven en casa D. un familiar y uno D. los deseos D. la Sra. Silvia es el comprarse un terrenito y a si poder hacer construir su casita, es una persona muy trabajadora , esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The Banco D. Emprendimiento “Las Esperanzadas” (“The Hopeful” Communal Bank) is working it first cycle with this Institution. It is composed of 9 people engaging in different activities, such as: clothes sale, food sale, masonry, snack sales, photocopying services and cosmetics promoters. They come from the Plan 3000 area. The group was born out of the initiative of Silvia. She lives in the La Campana area, and she engages in selling food in her house in the evenings. She sells to her neighbors and acquaintances and she has many customers. Silvia will use the loan amount to buy ingredients and groceries to prepare her dishes. Her husband is a masonry contractor, and they sustain the economy of their family together. They live in the house of a family member, and one of Silvia’s whishes is to buy some land where to build their house. She is a very hard-working person, and she is thankful to the institution for the help provided.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and groceries.

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
Rosa Luz  es una confeccionista de ropa femenina  e infantil que vive y tiene su negocio  en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, un barrio donde interactúa lo comercial, residencial donde también están ubicados escenarios deportivos y recreativos,  entre los cuales se destaca el Estadio metropolitano de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde los equipos profesionales de Colombia practican el futbol, que es  deporte que concentra a todo el país  pero especialmente a quienes viven el la cálida ciudad de Barranquilla y la costa norte de Colombia.
Rosa Luz inició su negocio de confecciones en el año 2001, aunque su experiencia en este arte data desde 1977, época desde la cual ha  ido perfeccionando sus técnicas con el transcurrir del tiempo,  desarrollando una buena calidad en las prendas que elabora y por eso sus clientes la prefieren  y esto hace importante el trabajo que Rosa desarrolla   porque su mayor desafío es la competencia, la cual  incursiona con precios y productos de poca durabilidad. Este es su primer financiamiento y requiere comprar telas, hilos, encajes y botones en mayor volumen, para obtener descuentos especiales. Sus activos fijos asociados al negocio son una máquina de coser, una fileteadora y herramientas varias, ubicadas en el segundo piso de su vivienda. Los principales clientes de Rosa son personas tradicionalmente atendidas por ella, vecinas, familiares, referidos a los cuales responde sobre pedidos en la modalidad de contado y a crédito. 
Rosa Luz trabaja con una de sus cinco hijos en la microempresas y tiene como meta mas adelante adquirir una máquina de coser industrial para  aumentar los tiempos productivos y  la calidad del negocio, con ello logrará mejorar los ingresos y la  productividad y por consiguiente la calidad de vida familiar y es que este es aun su gran reto.
texts.en:
Rosa Luz is a dressmaker who makes women's and children's clothes.  She lives and has her business in Ciudadela 20 de Julio which is a neighborhood where commercial and residential areas mix.  It is also the home to sporting and recreational grounds, the most important of which is the city of Barranquilla's Estadio Metropolitano where Colombia's professional teams play soccer.  Soccer is a sport that unites the whole country but especially the people who live in the warm city of Barranquilla and on the north coast of Colombia.

Rosa Luz started her dressmaking business in 2001 although her experience in this art dates back to 1977.  Over time, she has perfected her techniques.  She makes good-quality clothes and, for this reason, she has loyal customers which is important because Rosa's greatest challenge in her business is the competition who make inroads into the trade with short-lasting prices and products.

This is Rosa's first loan and she needs it to buy fabrics, thread, lace and buttons in large quantities so that she can obtain special discounts.  Rosa's fixed business assets are a sewing machine, an overlock sewing machine and various tools which are all located on the second floor of her home.  Rosa's main customers are people who have traditionally been served by her: neighbors and family members.  She offers her products for cash or on credit.

Rosa Luz works with one of her five children in her small business and her goal for the future is to acquire an industrial sewing machine so that she can improve her production times and the quality of her business.  This will enable her to improve her income and productivity and, as a result, her family's quality of life.  This is still her big challenge.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, lace and buttons

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa S. is married with two children. 

She sells children's clothing at the local market. Raisa has been in this business for eight years. Long experience and optimism help Raisa to maintain good sales. Moreover, children's clothing is always in demand.

Raisa is requesting a loan of 12,000 UAH. She would like to purchase inventories for her second business location that she started recently. This gives her a competitive advantage in attracting more clients and increasing sales.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for the second business location

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 26 years old and has two children who are two years old and one month old. They are not yet in school. Her husband is a farmer. Angelique owns a shop in which she sells sugar, soap, fish, etc. She has done this business for four years and it has helped her develop herself. Angelique is requesting a loan to buy more items such as soap, sugar, etc. to add to her shop and make more profits. She plans to save the profits.

loans.use: To buy items such as soap, sugar etc.

loans.name: Hever Alexander

texts.es:
Hever, se dedica a la venta de mercería y accesorios para celulares, él vive con su familia y tiene el negocio en el centro de la ciudad, lugar propicio para vender ya que transita mucha gente.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de accesorios para celulares como cargadores, carcasas, protectores, llaveros, y más artículos para celulares. Esta compra le permitirá surtir el negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes mejores productos.
Su principal aspiración es tener éxito en su negocio y crecer como comerciante.
texts.en:
Hever works selling notions and cell phone accessories.  He lives with his family and his business is located in the city’s center, a good location for sales due to the number of people passing through.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of cell phone accessories such as chargers, covers, cases, keyrings, and other items.  This purchase will allow him to stock his business and offer better products to his customers.

His main desire is for his business to be successful and to grow as a merchant.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories like chargers, cases and covers.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel en la hermosa ciudad de Cartagena,  tiene un negocio de venta de refrescos y bebidas, con el cual logra apoyar el sostenimiento de su familia, conformada por su esposa y 4 hijos en las edades de 11 a 24 años. El inició su negocio vendiendo minutos a celulares y cervezas en su barrio y a este negocio adicionó un billar y vende cervezas no solo al detal sino también por cajas, aprovechando que sus vecinos comerciantes, se quedan sin inventarios en momentos de gran movilización comercial, por el poco capital de trabajo que manejan. Manuel es un buen miembro de familia, cuenta con el apoyo de todos los integrantes de su hogar y en el negocio con uno de sus hijos, que también trabaja con él.  Este es el segundo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cajas de cervezas por volumen y gaseosas, pues desde ya se está provisionando para la temporada del día del padre,  que viene con mucho movimiento comercial especialmente de los productos que Manuel vende. Su sueño es mantener activo su negocio y darle un apartamento a cada uno de sus hijos, con su financiamiento anterior logró aumentar su capital de trabajo y agradece la confianza que la Fundación ha depositado en él y en su familia.
texts.en: Manuel, in the beautiful city of Cartagena, owns a business selling refreshments and drinks, with which he manages to support his family, made up of his wife and four children who are between the ages of 11 and 24. He started his business selling cell phone minutes and beers in his neighborhood and, to this business, he added billiards and sells beer not only at retail but also by the case, taking advantage of the fact that his neighbors are traders who are left without inventory during moments of great demand due to the small amount of working capital they have to work with. Manuel is a good member of the family. He can count on the support of all the members of his family and, with the business, on one of his children who also works with him. This is the second loan that he has received from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy cases of beer and soda so that he is stocked for the father's day season that is accompanied by a lot of commercial movement, especially with the products that Manuel sells. His dream is to keep his business active and give an apartment to each one of his children. With his previous loan, he was able to expand his working capital and he is thankful for the trust the Foundation has given him and his family.

loans.use: to buy cases of beers and sodas.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. 

Rosario has a game shop that provides peso coin game machines. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the game machines. Rosario is a new member of HSPFI.  

In the future, Rosario hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the game machines

loans.name: Jesus Pablo

texts.es:
Jesús de 34 años , vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Su esposa se encarga de la tienda. Tienen dos hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás por medio de su esposa que quiso abrir una tienda de víveres. Su esposa es la encargada de abrir la tienda diariamente le ayuda a su esposa junta con sus hija cuando no tiene que hacer obras ya que el es albañil. En su tienda vende productos como azúcar, arroz, aceite todo tipos de víveres. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere compra mas mercadería como arroz por quintales atún y aceites para surtir mas su negocio. En un futuro quiere terminar su vivienda para tener una vida mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Jesús is 34 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran, an outlying urban area that originally had irregular terrain with hills, creeks, and lagoons. There are remnants of a deteriorating environment. His wife manages a store. They have two children who attend public schools.

Some time ago, his wife wanted to open a grocery store. She is in charge of opening the store every day. Jesús works as a bricklayer and helps out with the store when no construction jobs are available. His daughter also helps his wife with managing the business. The family sells products such as sugar, rice, oil, and all types of groceries. With the help of this loan, Jesús will buy more merchandise such as rice by the “quintal” (1 quintal = 46 kg), tuna, and oil to restock the business. In the future, he hopes to finish the construction of his home so that his family will have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, tuna, and oil.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 64 años, está casado con Inocenta de 54 años, juntos tienen 5 hijos y ellos habitan en la comunidad  de zanamarca distrito de Sivia. Antonio es un hombre dedicado a la agricultura, que gracias a la formación que recibió de sus padres y a los talleres que le dieron las instituciones, sobre cómo se debe tener un control de plaga de insectos que afectan el cultivo de cacao, de esta manera es como se interesa en la venta de agroquímicos. Actualmente está contento con el negocio que realiza, ya que es la fuente por donde capta mayores ingresos, además que tiene capacidad de venta en donde recurre a los conocimientos que tiene para orientar a sus clientes sobre las propiedades del producto que vende, es de esta manera que ha logrado tener muchos clientes. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en ser puntual en sus cuotas. Con los 3.000  soles que solicita, podrá adquirir más productos para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Antonio is 64 years old, and is married to Inocenta, aged 54.  Together they have 5 children and live in the community of Zanamarca in Sivia district.

Antonio is a man focused on agriculture, thanks to the training he received from his parents and the workshops that the institutions give on how to take control of insect pests that affect cocoa crops.  This is how he became interested in the sale of agrochemicals. Currently he is happy with the business he does, and it is the means through which he is able to earn a higher income.  Additionally he has sales abilities, where he uses his knowledge to guide his customers on the properties of the products he sells.  In this way, he has been able to gain many customers. 

This will be his second loan through MFP, so he is committed to being punctual in his repayments. With the 3,000 Soles for which he is applying, he will be able to buy more products to stock his store.

loans.use: to buy agrochemical products.

loans.name: Uba

texts.en:
Uba is a married woman with five children, one of whom still attends school while the other four have graduated. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business and live a better life in the future. 

With the 35,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan she wants to purchase cereals, sacks of beans, rice and bundles of wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, sacks of beans, rice, and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.name: Félix Fernando

texts.es:
El señor Félix femando vive en la ciudad de Managua 
Trabaja en una empresa situada en la ciudad de Managua.
Don Félix acudió a nuestras oficina para hacer la solicitud de un crédito  por que quiere mejorar el techo de su vivienda porque considera  que es necesario el cambio de el techo de su vivienda.
La inversión que el señor va hacer es en la compra de zinc y madera para mejorar el techo de la vivienda
El señor Félix se siente agradecido con ceprodel por que el tiempo que tiene de trabajar con créditos de ceprodel ha recibido buenas atenciones  y ha podido mejorar su condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Félix Fernando lives in the city of Managua.

Mr. Félix approached CEPRODEL's office to request a loan because he would like to improve the roof of his house. He considers replacing the roof to be a necessity.

He will invest in the purchase of corrugated metal sheets and wood to improve the roof of his house.

Félix feels grateful to CEPRODEL because in the time that he has worked with their loans, he has received good service and has been able to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to replace the roof of his house

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last five years. He is 25 years old and married to Joyce; they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to plow his land and prepare it for planting.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To plow his land and prepare for planting.

loans.name: Ursula Ines Nadine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 38 ans, célibataire et mère de 5 enfants dont l’age  varie entre 5 et 18 ans. Et après son divorce ayant la responsabilité de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants , elle se lance dans la vente des articles religieux, des aromates des parfums, des chapelets 
En 1991 , elle ouvre une boutique de vente des articles religieux pour non loin d'un marche et d'une église dans un quartier de la ville située non loin de sa maison. 
Elle a des vente de 12.000 frs a 35.000 frs par jour, a l'octroi de son nouveau prêt elle veut acheter des cartons de bougies de toutes couleurs, des aromates, des parfums, des chapelets et tous ce dont cherche ses clients.
Tres motivée , elle a l’intention d'aller loin avec son business,avec ses bénéfices elle prend soin de ses enfants.
texts.en:
She is 38 years old, single and a mother of five children between the ages of 5 and 18. After getting a divorce, as she is now responsible to provide for her children, she started a business of selling religious articles, fragrances, perfumes and rosaries. 
In 1991, she opened a shop to sell religious articles as her neighborhood is not far from the market and a church.
Her sales are between 12,000 CFA francs and 35,000 CFA francs per day, with her new loan she plans to purchase cases of different colored candles, rosaries, fragrances, and perfumes, all of which are in high demand.
As she is very motivated, she plans to have a very successful business and take good care of her children with the profits.

loans.use: to purchase cases of different colored candles, rosaries, fragrances, and perfumes

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a 55-year-old married woman. She has seven grown up children. She describes herself as patient, quiet, and responsible. 

She is a vegetable vendor in the community. She has been involved in this business for ten years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be loss of products due to the perishable nature of goods. She will use the P10,000 loan to add to her stock of potatoes, onions, tomatoes and cabbage. She hopes that within five years in the future, she will be able to educate her children to high levels of education.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes and cabbages to sell

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE WIMPILLAY CHOCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Cecilia; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también tiene un negocio de peluquería, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de peluquería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, mantequilla y leche al por mayor y para comprar materiales para la peluquería como tintes, ruleros y tijeras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia is a member of the “SEÑOR DE WIMPILLAY CHOCCO” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Ana Cecilia is 31 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities, her grocery store business and her hairdressing salon.  She serves her customers from 8.00am to 7.00pm and, through her businesses, she gets her children ahead in life.  Ana Cecilia would like to expand her grocery store business and her hairdressing business.  She is requesting this loan to buy products wholesale for her grocery store (rice, sugar, butter and milk), and to buy materials for her hairdressing salon (such as dyes, rollers and scissors).

Ana Cecilia is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products wholesale for her grocery store (rice, sugar, butter and milk), and to buy materials for her hairdressing salon (dyes, rollers and scissors)

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 64 years old and married, with 3 children.

Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Lucia has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from rice retailing & food vending.

Lucia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Do

texts.en:
Do, 36 years old, lives with her husband and two sons in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a coppersmith.

Do earns a living by sewing clothes at her house. She has worked in this profession for over six years. Do would like to take a loan to buy a new sewing machine, which will help her to produce a larger quantity and better quality of clothes. 

Do hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase her income. She hopes that this will enable her to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine to increase her production of clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a very hard-working woman who has been a mixed farmer for the past three years. She rears animals, sells milk, and also does horticultural farming. She is 33 years old, married, and they have three children.

She is applying for her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Safar

texts.en: Safar is a 52 year-old man who sells carpets from his house. He has three years of experience in this field. He usually brings carpets from other countries and resells them at a profitable price. His monthly income is 300 AZN. This is a very profitable business because carpets are very popular and every family has at least one in their house. Carpets are also an integral part of marriage dowries. Safar is married and has two children.  He has applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN in order to purchase more carpets and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase more carpets to cover customer demand.

loans.name: 050702-Đông Ngọc-Hoằng Phong-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Ngân is 47 years old. She is married and has two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 050702-Đông Ngọc-Hoằng Phong-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Ngân works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. Ngân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Ngân faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2003, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Ngân has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Ngân hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Meach

texts.en:
Mrs. Meach, 51, is a local farmer who cultivates rice and vegetable crops from the Kompong Speu province. She has been engaged in this business since 2000. She and her husband work on the same project. This couple is blessed with seven children. All of them are single and some are working to make a better living. 

With this loan, Mrs. Meach will use the money to buy a pumping machine to provide enough water to her vegetable crops. In this case, she will be able to grow more crops and expand her farming business.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine to provide enough water to her vegetable crops.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah, 35, is a married woman with six children: three boys and three girls. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing. 

For the past ten years Serah has sold flowers to earn a living, selling them to her neighbors and passersby. She also operates a food stall which contributes to her income. 

Serah decided to join Yehu to access their loans. With a 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase seeds to grow flowers for sale.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to grow flowers for sale.

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.en:
Ulimwengu, who is in his mid 20s is married with one child who is still young.  He has had a second-hand shoes business for three years now. He works from  3.00pm to 7 p.m daily (fours hours) and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the shoe inventory, pay household expense and he has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants this loan to  increase the second-hand shoe inventory. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Nuru" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase their second-hand shoes inventory.

loans.name: Meiko

texts.en:
The One Smart Cookie Company began as a home-based business in February 2008.  Owner and founder, Meiko, worked diligently for several months perfecting an old family sugar cookie and turtle cookie recipe.  After completing her final product, Meiko began sharing her sweet creations with family and friends, and received an overwhelmingly positive response.  Word spread of Meiko’s delicious delicacies and people began placing orders for all types of parties, celebrations, and other functions.  One business owner was so impressed with Meiko’s cookies, that he ordered 115 dozen to be shipped across the United States as gifts for his clients.  Needless to say, Meiko quickly outgrew the home and needed to move into a commercial building to support her rapidly growing business.

Today, One Smart Cookie Company has a total of 11 employees operating three locations and has expanded their product line to include deli sandwiches and catering services.  In the future, Meiko would love to franchise the company to provide her product to a larger target market. 

Meiko will use her Kiva loan to purchase baking supplies and signage for a new location set to open in January 2012.

loans.use: to purchase signage and equipment for a new location

loans.name: Marivi

texts.es:
Marivi, en vista que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para poder sostener los gastos que genera su hogar, donde convive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, decidió iniciar un negocio en el cual pueda estar al cuidado de las obligaciones del hogar y al mismo tiempo a la atención de su negocio. Marivi se decida a la venta de fresas con chocolate, y otras presentaciones con chocolate fundido, actividad que aprendió cuando conoció la máquina para fundir chocolate e inmediatamente vio una oportunidad de negocio. Esta actividad la inició hace aproximadamente 3 años, y gracias a su buena atención y la calidad de sus productos, es muy reconocida en su región. Debido a que inició su negocio con muy bajo capital, Marivi aún requiere la compra de algunas cosas para hacer su negocio más atractivo, una de estas es una sombrilla que la cubra del fuerte sol que hace todos los días y le da directo a su negocio. Es por esto que Marivi aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una sombrilla para tapar su negocio del sol, y la compra de insumos para su negocio, de modo que pueda hacer más atractivo su negocio para los clientes.
Marivi espera que de esta manera sus clientes aumenten, pues ya no tendrán que soportar el fuerte calor que hace, además, podrá ofrecer mejores productos con la compra de sus insumos. Marivi aspira a que con mayores ingresos pueda ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y cumplir el sueño de sus hijos de acceder a una educación universitaria.

loans.use: Compra de una sombrilla para tapar su negocio del sol, y la compra de insumos para su negocio, de modo que pueda hacer más atractivo su negocio para los clientes.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Paul.  Paul is an extraordinary farmer.  He comes from the South Rift region of Kenya, where dairy farming is a booming business.  Most, if not all, farmers there own dairy animals.  Most farmers keep traditional cattle breeds for subsistence, and a number of farmers have graduated into commercial farming by replacing the grotesque, unproductive, traditional breeds with higher grade cows.  However, only a handful of visionary farmers have taken the big gamble of investing in pedigree breeds. 

Paul, a father of 3, has been dairy farming for the last 12 years and is very passionate about the dairy business.  His passion drives his work as he strives to push himself up to a mastery level of dairy farming.  Throughout the years, he has observed that most dairy farmers are in the business because they were born in to families that are dairy farmers, or because everyone  else is dairy farming.  This mindset builds contentment and the kind of humility that kills any hope of progress.  For people like Paul, constant progress and adding value makes the world go round.  He uses every opportunity to learn more and keeps company with the best.

Paul is seeking a loan of 200,000 KES to buy a pedigree dairy cow.  Venturing down that route is by no means an easy option though, and it requires an  investment of both time and money.  But, Paul is ambitious and not afraid to invest in the future.  While other farmers may only have the ability to increase production, Paul can also sell good genetics, making this path worthwhile.  

With this loan, Paul is going to make a big difference.  Through Juhudi Kilimo, he has been able to attend numerous training programs.  He has solid knowledge on: Feeding the Dairy Cow; Improving Herd Fertility; Good Agricultural and Environmental Practice; Improving Herd Health; Record Keeping.
The money Paul will make from this investment will help him to comfortably afford other farm expenses.  Improving his dairy business will bring untold benefits to his family.  Paul's priorities include paying for food, paying for his children's education, and building up his savings account.

loans.use: to purchase a pedigree dairy cow.

loans.name: Christine Mary

texts.en:
Neneth is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fishing and raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Neneth dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 37 years old. She is a driven young woman living in the Nandihills area of Kenya an area that adversely affected with the post-election violence back in 2007.Mildred has been practicing livestock farming for seven years .She has raised cows on the farm. Mildred is seeking a loan to restock her cereals business. She plans to purchase and transport cereals in bulk to far markets where she will sell at prices high enough to cover all the expenses incurred while gaining a profit. Mildred is confident that she will be able to repay the loan in time because she is hard working and financially disciplined. Returns from the investment will change her life as she will use the additional income to raise her family's living standards. Mildred just needs a little help that she can get from you; a loan that may change her life.
Mildred patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting and earning income as well. Alicia has supported her husband doing this type of work.  Like a farmer, Alicia has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Alicia hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Olga Alicia

texts.en:
Olga Alicia is married and has two children and they live in the city of Monclova in the state of Coahuila. Her husband, Salvador Lozano, is a clerk in a company but he has only recently started his job 6 months ago. He was for some time unemployed because it was very difficult to find a job, and to be able to face this situation with the help of some family they started a small business, an office supplies store. But in order to her to continue with her project, Olga needs a loan of $250 to be able to purchase more merchandise and increase her sales. She will then be able to reinvest her earnings and keep expanding.

Olga\'s primary objective is to secure the daily sustenance and education of her little ones and of course help her husband during these difficult times of economic instability that they are going through. The decision is in your hands and your generosity can contribute to the security of this family. Help them.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga Alicia es casa y tiene dos hijos, viven en la comunidad de Monclova, ene el estado de Coahuila, su esposo, Salvador Lozano, es obrero en una empresa, pero únicamente tiene 6 meses con el empleo, hace tiempo que estaba desempleado, pues era muy difícil encontrar trabajo y para poder hacer frente a tal situación, con la ayuda de algunos familiares emprendieron un pequeño negocio, una papelería. Pero para continuar con este proyecto, Olga necesita un préstamo de $250 DLLS y así poder comprar más mercancía e incrementar sus ventas, para poder reinvertir las ganancias y continuar creciendo.

El principal objetivo de Olga es asegura el sustento diario y la educación de sus pequeños y por supuesto ayudar a su esposo en estos momentos difíciles de inestabilidad económica por ellos que traviesan. La decisión esta en tus manos, tu generosidad puede contribuir a la seguridad de ésta familia. Apóyalos.

loans.use: porchase merchandise

loans.name: Orkhan

texts.en:
Orkhan has been in this business for 7 years. In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 to buy 2 calves. The second time he borrowed a loan of $600 and bought 3 calves. The third time he borrowed a loan of $900 and bought 4 calves.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 7 calves.

loans.use: To buy 7 calves

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Mrs. Min T. is 53 years old and lives with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham, Cambodia.  T. runs a small business buying rubber in bulk, then selling it to retailers for a profit.  She is able to earn about $3 per day from this business.  Her husband, meanwhile, runs a roadside petrol station where he sells bottles of gasoline.  He also is able to make about $3 per day from this.  The couple has one child who is still in school.  They hope to use this loan to purchase rubber for T.'s business and petrol for her husband's stand.  In the future, they hope that they will have enough money to build a new house.

loans.use: To purchase rubber and petrol to expand their businesses

loans.name: Lemoe

texts.en: Lemoe A. Y. is a member of  the Samatau 3 center. She is thirty-four years of age and one of the successful businesswomen within the programme. Her business is fishing. Her father and brothers are the ones that actually do the fishing. The fishing can be done in the  day time but usually they prefer to do it at night. Lemoe is on her fifth loan and she is still doing the fishing business .Her income for a week is $300.00 tala and $1800.00 a week profit. She explained that fishing is a profitable business and also a very risky one. Lemoe dreamed of having a big boat so that her father and brother will fish more so that her business will become an industry where she and her family can export to the overseas market for a better price. Lemoe is asking for a loan of $1200  to buy fishing nets, hooks and other equipment.

loans.use: “Buy fishing nets, hooks and fishing equipments”

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
R. Gulnara is 37 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict in the Gubadli region, which is situated in the west partern of Azerbaijan in the Caucasus region. Right now, she lives in the city of Sumqayit. As she has a low-income, she is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy. Gulnara has a small flock of sheep. She buys lambs and raises them for half a year. She sells the sheep in the local market and then buys new lambs to reaise.  She spends the profit providing for her family's necessities. The business is very interesting but sometimes demands more funding than she has. Her husband helps her.

Timely investments are important for Gulnara. In 2004, Gulnara borrowed $500 from Normicro and expanded her business.  Currently, Gulnara would like to borrow a $1,500 loan in order to acquire five small sheep and raise them. She will repay the loan within 16 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business and that it will further improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to acquire 5 small sheep and raise them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Leyli

texts.es:
Mrs. Leyli is part of the “Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras”, she lives on Jr. Rosa Merino Mz. H Lt. 40, of Calleria District, Ucayali province. She is 40 years old. She is the mother of 2 small children. Her husband works in construction, but the salary he receives isn’t enough to cover family costs. That’s how Leyli decided to invest in a general store with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles ($100US).

Currently, she has a big store with great variety. She told us that she began by selling candy on a board and now she is the owner of a general store. She also has a food selling business with her mother in the evenings. Every day, they prepare the food together that they sell in the house.

With the current loan of 2,500 soles ($837US approx.) she’s received from Manuela Ramos, which will be paid back in 6 months, she’ll buy 2 bags of rice, 3 bags of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, 1 box of gelatin, 1 packet of detergent, a dozen bars of soap, 1 box of oil, etc. The rest of the loan will go toward the food sales.

Leyli is happy that her business if growing because she can give her family economic stability and educate her children. She feels comfortable working with her mother and to all women she says, go ahead and invest in your own business and look to Manuela Ramos for support.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

. La señora Leyli pertenece al Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras, vive en el Jr Rosa Merino Mz. H Lt. 40, del distrito Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos pequeños, su esposo es maestro de obras (construcción), pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos familiares, es así que Leyli, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en una bodega. En la actualidad ella tiene una bodega grande y bien surtida, nos contó que ella empezó vendiendo golosinas en un tablero y ahora es dueña de una bodega. También tiene un negocio de venta de comida, está asociada con su mama y realizan esta actividad por las noches, juntas preparan los alimentos que a diario venden en su casa. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500, (US$ 837.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 2 sacos de arroz, 3 sacos de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche, 1 caja de gelatina,1 paquete de detergente, 1 docena de jabón, 1 caja de aceite, etc., y otra parte del préstamo lo destinará para el negocio de venta de comida. Leyli se siente contenta, su negocio esta creciendo, puede darles estabilidad económica a su familia y educación a sus hijos. Se siente muy cómoda trabajando con su madre y dice a todas las mujeres que no duden en invertir en su propio negocio y que busquen el apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products for her store.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
Mrs. Antonia comes from a humble family. She, as well as her brothers had many difficulties to move forward, and with much strength and will was able to set up a tire changing shop. This activity also provided her with the opportunity to provide individual economic investments for her younger brothers who support her in caring for and providing attention to her business and to her young two year old daughter named Mercy. Presently, Antonia is living in a rented home, her dream is to build a small home which she will share with her daughter and younger brother in a stable and safe location. She is appealing to your good and generous heart and is asking for a loan which she promises to reimburse within six month in order to acquire larger quantities of tools for her small workshop. Thank you for your kind collaboration so that Antonia can accomplish her goals.

Translated from [language] by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Antonia proviene de una familia humilde ella al igual que sus hermanos tuvo muchas dificultades para salir adelante, con mucho esfuerzo y voluntad logró poner su vulcanizadora de llantas, con esta actividad también les está dando la oportunidad de obtener ingresos económicos propios a sus hermanos menores quienes la apoyan en el cuidado y atención de su negocio y la de su pequeña niña Mercy de 2 años de edad.Actualmente Antonia viene viviendo en un domicilio alquilado, su deseo es construir su casita, con el fin de compartir con su hija y hermanos menores un lugar seguro y estable.Con ese propósito recurre a tu buen y generoso corazón y hace la petición de un préstamo que se compromete a retornar en un lapso de seis meses a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de herramientas para su pequeño taller.Gracias a tu gentil colaboración Antonia podrá cumplir con sus objetivos.

loans.use: Purchase tools in order to provide better and faster service for her customers

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin R., 29, is a vendor of grocery products making on average about $1.50 a day in profit. Her husband Mr. Houn Pov, is a motor-taxi driver in Phsar Kompong Cham, and every day he earns around $2.50. This is not enough for this couple to survive since they also have two children, so they want to reinforce their business in order to provide a good family life.

Mrs. Rin plans to make her business more profitable. To make the business more profitable and provide better living conditions, they are asking for a loan from Kiva of $500. This money will be used to purchase more groceries for re-sale and also to help Mr. Houn to buy another motorbike to resell for a profit. Anything can change when they have enough capital to strengthen their business.

loans.use: purchase more groceries and a motor-bike to resell for a profit

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Born in Cotonou in 1963, Mrs. Julienne A. is from Grand Popo, a village in the department of Mono, of Plah ethnicity. She currently lives in a shanty town in Cotonou with her fisherman husband and 4 children. She is a retailer of smoked shrimp in the largest markets in Benin, notably in Dantokpa, which is the largest market in the southwestern part of Africa.
