The demand for her goods is clearly increasing, whereas the means she has at her disposal to create a supply are very limited. She is thus asking for this loan to increase her stock in order to respond to the demands of her current and future customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née à COTONOU dans les années 1963, dame A. Julienne est originaire de Grand Popo un village du département du Mono, de l’ethnie Plah. Actuellement elle vit dans un bidonville de Cotonou avec son mari pêcheur et ses 4 enfants. Elle est une revendeuse de crevettes fumées dans les plus grands marchés du BENIN notamment à DANTOKPA qui est l'un des plus grand marché de la sous région ouest africaine. La demande est en nette progression alors que les moyens dont elle dispose pour s’approvisionner sont très limités. Elle sollicite alors ce prêt pour augmenter son stock afin de répondre aux attentes de la clientèle actuelle et future.

loans.use: To buy 45 baskets of fresh shrimp

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mrs. Sary C. is 43 years old, and she lives in Kraing Metrey Village in the province of Kampong Speu. She is a farmer and the mother of eight children, five of whom study in the local school, two of whom work, and the last of whom stays at home. Her husband, Thy Kan, pictured on the left, works with her on the rice field. Despite the fact that the family is disease-free, the family nonetheless lives in very poor conditions. Further, Mrs. Sary C. has incurred significant expenses in recent years on account of wedding ceremonies, funerals, and other similar such expenses. As for her work in cultivating rice, she relies heavily on good weather conditions and she uses old equipment; in fact, she does not even have a draft animal to plow the rice field. Therefore, she is seeking a loan to be able to afford cows for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase cows to plow the rice field.

loans.name: Silvia Mery

texts.es:
Silvia belongs to Las Dalilas Community Bank, located in the Jr. Sucre 1013, in the Calleria District, in Ucayali, Peru. She is a 37 year-old mother of 2. Her husband is a bus driver. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos, she decided to begin selling frozen drinks.

With the earnings from this undertaking, she now has a place where she attends to clients with great care, sharing the care-taking of her store with some housekeepers, and counting on the help of her children and husband.

With this loan of $375.00, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy: sodas of all flavors and sizes, candies, and a few groceries.

Through working with Manuela Ramos, Silvia has found the motivation to move forward toward the well-being of herself and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Silvia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalilas, ubicado en el Jr. Sucre 1013, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es cobrador. Silvia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de bebidas heladas.

En la actualidad con las ganancias obtenidas ahora tiene un local donde atiende a sus clientes con mucho esmero, comparte la atención de su local con las labores domesticas de su hogar, contando con la ayuda de sus hijos y esposo.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: gaseosas de todos los precios y tamañas, golosinas en general, y un poco de abarrotes.

Silvia trabajando con Manuela Ramos le ha dado un motivo mas para seguir adelante por el bienestar de ella y de su familia.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca A. sells drinks. She is married, but her husband's income from teaching is not sufficient for Rebecca and her two children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business selling soft drinks.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Sonrisa Village Bank.

Olga is a 30-year-old mother of two children. Olga sells chickens in a rented location that is located in front of a grocery store in the city of Ayacucho. She acquires her chickens at different hen houses in the city and sells the chickens from six in the morning until one in the afternoon.

Olga needs a loan of 1200 Peruvain Nuevo Soles ($450 USD) to invest in eggs to expand her business.

Olga´s dream is to expand her business, build a home, and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: Olga needs a loan to invest in eggs to expand her business.

loans.name: Mirzosharif

texts.ru:
Mirzosharif A. lives in the city of Yavan. He is a driver. He is married and has six children. In his free time, which he usually has during the week-ends, Mirzosharif buys and sells animals at the local market. He buys a couple of bulls and then resells them at a higher price. He has been in this business for 9 years. In order to increase profit, he needs additional funds. Mirzosharif wants to receive a loan in order to be able to buy and sell more. This way, he would be able to purchase well-bread cows and bulls. He plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Ашуров Мирзошариф проживает одном из кишлаков города Яван. Работает водителем . Женат и имеет шестерых детей. В свободное от работы время , а это обычно в субботу и в воскресенье он выходит на животный рынок и занимается перепродаже скота. Покупает пару бычков подешевле и тут же перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 9 лет. Для того , чтобы увеличить прибыльность необходимы дополнительные средства. Он хочет получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. Таким образом он сможет покупать породистых коров и бычков. Погасить кредит он сможет в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the number of animals

loans.name: Ššaha

texts.en: Šaha is 50 years old and she is from Tesanj. She is married with two children, and her husband is retired. Šaha works in a manufacturing company, and she earn 250 KM per month. She also has a cattle business and she is requesting a loan to buy another cow for her cattle business. This is her third loan from WWI in the amount of 1,200 KM.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es una mujer con mucho valor, sobre todo muy trabajadora, es agricultora, labor que le acompañó desde niña, con la cual sus padres pudieron educarla y velar por ella, ahora la historia se repite, tratando ella de dar lo necesario a sus 4 hijos.  Ahora que es casada desarrolla esta habilidad que adquirió hace varios años, para toda la vecindad es de las personas más dedicadas a sus labores y obligaciones tanto de agricultora como de madre.  Para seguir adelante tiene pensado acrecentar su producción, para consolidar este deseo Julia invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de herramientas y abonos, para el incremento de sus productos y para que estos puedan ser de mejor calidad, con esto podrá obtener mejores ganancias económicas cuando los venda en los mercados de sus alrededores.
texts.en:
Julia is a very valued woman, and more than anything she is a hard worker. She is an agriculturalist, a job that she learned as a child and with which her parents could educate her and watch over her. Now history is repeating itself and she is trying to give her 4 kids all they need. Now she is married she has developed this skill that she acquired as a child, and out of the whole community she is one of the people most dedicated to her labors and obligations as an agriculturalist and as a mother. To move forward she would like to increase her production and to consolidate this desire Julia will invest the money she has asked for in buying tools and fertilizers to increase her produce and so that they will be of a better quality. With this she will get better earnings when she sells in nearby markets.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the fertilizers and tools necessary for her work as an agriculturalist/Compra de abono y herramientas necesarias para su labor como agricultora.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en: Mr. Chun C. is a villager in Ta Tep village in Kampong Cham Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Om Yoer, are farmers who cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn a living. They now have a small problem because they do not have enough money to buy cassavas to grow. Thus, Mr. Chun C. decided to request a loan for this purpose. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan. He is 44 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is a farmer who helps the parents, while the other attends the local school. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cassavas to grow.

loans.name: Juana Licelda

texts.es:
Juana Licelda es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería que ha nacido por sus grandes sacrificios que ha hecho para subsistir. La pulpería tiene actualmente 17 años y hoy en día ella se ha preocupado por desarrollarla y es por esto que ha decido invertir en ella.

Para ver logrado su sueño de ver mejorada su pulpería ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos para comercializarlos. Por este motivo espera que su solicitud crediticia sea aprobada y de esta forma continuar esforzándose por mejorar su negocio de pulpería en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Juana Licelda is the owner of a small convenience store that came about from great sacrifices she has made to support herself. The convience store is now 17 years old and currently she plans to develop it further, which is why she has decided to invest in it.

To see her dream of an improved convenience store come true, she has come to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan that will permit her to purchase products for resale. With this goal she hopes that this loan will be aproved and, in this manner, keep struggling to improve her convenience store, located in her own home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Khursheed Bibi Mr. Rafiq Group

texts.en:
My name is Khursheed Bibi. I am a fifty-year-old woman. I have lived in the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan, for 15 years. My husband, Mr. R., is a mason. I have three kids: one son and two daughters. My son runs a furniture making business. My elder daughter is in 9th standard and my younger in 8th standard. I run a decorative embroidery business. I embroider dresses and sell them in clothing markets. I charge $3 per dress. I invest my income in my daughters’ education (paying school and tuition fees). I’ve successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy lumber to expand my son’s furniture making business. 

I am the leader of a group of entrepreneurs sharing this loan. Abida Irshad Baji wants a loan to buy jewelry to resell. Qambar Baji wants a loan to buy paint to stock her paint shop. Zareena Baji wants a loan to buy groceries to restock her grocery shop. Safia Baji wants a loan to buy silver from which she manufactures jewelry to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy lumber for a furniture making business

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: Agé de 28 ans Matar est un celibataire sans enfant.Il a abandonné les études à, l 'école primaire pour apprendre le metier de tailleur ce qui lui a permis aujourd'hui  ouvrir son propre atelier qu'il gere depuis cinq (5) ans.Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent d'entretenir ses parents et ses freres.Avec le prêt sollicité.Matar envisage d'acheter une nouvelle machine à coudre  pour faire face aux mutations du metier.
texts.en:
Matar is 28 years old, single and has no childrren.She left school at the primary level to learn the trade of tailoring, which allowed her to start her own workshop, 5 years ago. The revenue earned from her business enables her to look after her parents and brothers. With this requested loan, Matar hopes to buy a new sewing machine to keep up with changes in the trade.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Nguyen Thi Dieu

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Diệu Quyên  năm nay 31 tuổi. Gia đình chị có hai con còn nhỏ. Chị Quyên tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2008. Chị hiện đang làm kế toán  còn chồng chị làm nghề lái xe. Ngoài ra gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng gia đình chị Quyên đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Diệu Quyên, 31 years old, has two young children. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2008. She currently works as a bookkeeper, and her husband is a driver. She and her family also raise pigs to earn some additional income. With their income of 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) per month, Mrs. Quyên’s family is now able to gradually improve their standard of living. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to buy more pigs and feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 38 years old. He lives in the Khachmaz region, in the Pirgulu-Oba village. He is married and has one child. Three years ago he started a taxi business. Now he needs a loan of 1500 AZN to buy spare parts for improving his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Yeadze

texts.en: Yeadze M. is married with 1 child and has received schooling through Senior High School.  Ms. Yeadze sells jewellery in Elmina, which she has done since 2007. Her husband is a businessman.  The loan will enable Ms. Yeadze to purchase more jewellery so that she may, in turn, sell it and create a profitable business.  The profits gained from the loan will be saved and used towards the ultimate goal of opening a store where Ms Yeadze will continue to sell her jewellery.

loans.use: to purchase more jewellery for re-sale

loans.name: Imonkul

texts.ru: Имонкул - молодой человек 33 лет. Женат. Имеет 4-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота.  Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Жена занимается переработкой шерсти скота и продает ее на рынке, и еще помогает по хозяйству дома. Имонкул хочет увеличить количество своего скота, потому что ему досталось небольшое количество от отца, и теперь он сам должен увеличить количество своего скота. Для этого он взял кредит, чтобы купить еще несколько скота.
texts.en:
Imonkul is a young man of 33. He is married and has four children. He raises and sells large and small-horned cattle. He purchases the livestock at the market and after fattening them for two to three months sells them at the same market. His wife spins the wool into yarn and sells it at the market. She also helps out at home on the farm. Imonkul wants to increase his herd. He received several head of cattle from his father, and now must add to them himself. To do so, he has taken out a loan to buy several head of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en: T. Florence is a very determined lady with a business-oriented mind. She is married and has 3 children between 6 and 13 years of age. Her eldest child is in secondary school while the other two are in primary and nursery school. Florence has had a retail shop in Nkondo for 8 years where she also sells green bananas used for making matooke (cooked green banana dish). She further stresses that the location of her business helps her to succeed by making a lot of profit, once she stocks her shop with more goods. Florence has a dream of developing her shop into a wholesale shop and to see all her children educated through to the University. She will use her loan to restock her retail shop. Her previous loans have been helping her to avoid a shortage of goods in her shop.

loans.use: Buying more stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Velikhan

texts.en: Velikhan M. is a 46-year-old farmer who has been breeding calves since he was young, thanks to his father's instruction. He raises calves and sells them for meat production. He also has his own land where he cultivates fodder and wheat. Velikhan is married and has one adorable daughter. Velikhan has applied for a $1200 US loan in order to purchase two more calves.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Tilata Group

texts.es: El grupo denominado “Tilata” esta conformado por doce señoras que en su mayoría radican en la zona Tilata D. ahí su nombre, la directiva esta conformada por la señora AyD., Olivia Marisol y Rita Cecilia que son la presidenta, tesorera y secretaria del grupo. Los miembros del grupo se dedican a la venta D. diferentes productos como la comida, ropa, CDs., abarrotes y a la atención en puntos D. llamadas, tiendas D. barrio y a la confección D. chompas D. lana. Dentro del rubro D. oferta D. productos existe gran nivel competitivo es por esta razón que los socios requieren D. este crédito para poder hacer frente a la competencia con la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que mejoren la calida D. sus productos para generar mayores  ingresos para el sustento D. sus familias. Este grupo esta emprendiendo su quinto ciclo demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad con sus pagos.
texts.en:
The group called "Tilata" is conformed by twelve ladies who live in the Tilata area. The direction is under Mrs. AyD., Olivia Marisol and Rita Cecilia, who are the president, treasurer and secretary of the group. The group members are engaged in the sale of various products like food, clothing, CDs and groceries trough neighborhood grocery shops, and the making of wool sweaters. The category of products that they are offering is highly competitive and it is why they need a loan in order to face competition with the acquisition of materials, supplies and tools that will improve the quality of their products to generate more income that will allow them support their families. It’s the fifth cycle of this group, demonstrating honesty and responsibility with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena V. is a 29-year old farmer and mother of four children. She lives in Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur, a poor community in Mindanao whose livelihood is predominantly agriculture. Life is never easy to her since she is just renting the land that she tills. The income that she gets from her farm goes primarily to paying for household expenses, including tuition fee for their her children's education. 

With her desire to grow her business more, she seeks assistance and applies for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She looks forward to the positive results of investing bigger amount in her business.

CEVI helps small business grow. All clients received loans, trainings and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers, herbicides, ammonium and other farm needs.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 3 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en la Parcialidad de Quicañamayo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  el cual utilizó para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor (para engorde y cría).

Su deseo es seguir trabajando con ganado mayor.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria is a member of the community bank "Manuela de Hoy" (Today's Manuela) that is located in the La Llave district, Province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 43 years old, married and mother of 3 children. She has finished secondary school and lives in the area of Quicañamayo. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 5 years. Her first loan was for 300 new soles which she used for the purchase of small livestock. At this time she is in need of a loan of 1200 new soles for the purchase of small livestock (to fatten up and raise). Her wish is to continue working with large livestock. She likes the easiness of the loan process.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock for fattening up.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is already 58 years old. She manages a general store business in their simple village of Siempre Viva Sur Mallig, Isabela. She is married to Melecio Berbol, 56 years old, whose occupation is farming. They are blessed with four children who all have their own families now.

Milagros continues to dream of a good quality of life with her supportive husband and the assistance of Kiva from whom she is requesting PHP 25,000 as additional business capital to improve her store.

Furthermore, Milagros also maintains a hog-raising business at the moment. She is not losing her hope that someday she will achieve all her goals in life thru hard work, strong determination, and faith in God. She is a determined entrepreneur, doing all her best for the welfare of her family and the education of her future grandchildren.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos Hernández de 39 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua,  trabaja como contador  en la alcaldía, lleva veinte años trabajando a mucho esfuerzo para poder salir adelante con su familia. Su meta es poder  dar educación a sus hijos. Con este préstamo es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer un por porche  y poder darle a su familia una mejor comodidad. Da las gracias a ala institución por los beneficio de poder hacer las mejoras a su casa ya que solo por el financiamiento puede hacer estos logros.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 39 years old and lives in the Sandino Memorial Community in the capital city of Managua. He works as an accountant for the city. He has twenty years of experience working in this business that has allowed him to improve his family’s life. His goal is to provide an education for his children. With this loan, which is his fifth one with Afodenic, he would like to buy materials to build a porch for his family and thus provide them with a more comfortable life. He gives thanks to this institution for the benefit of being able to improve his house. Only with this loan would he be able to achieve this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to build a porch for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Soybean

loans.name: Kitonzi United Kunihira Eflazia Group

texts.en: K. Eflazia is a 50-year-old single mother of five and guardian of three dependents. Two of her children currently attend school. Eflazia has sold fresh food for over 10 years. She wants to use this loan to expand her business's stock by purchasing more foods such as bananas, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions. She is a hardworking and promising businesswoman whose dreams include educating her children and constructing a permanent house.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh food to expand her business's selection of goods.

loans.name: Mrs. Pov Ek Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov E. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members in Ba Khong Khang Lech village in Takeo province. She is a breeder who raises pig and she also is a farmer. Since breeding pig is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for her breeding. Her husband, Mr. Ngaet Vai, is a laborer who can earn a little money to support the family. Mrs. Pov E. is 44 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school.

Four members in this village bank loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for her breeding.

loans.name: Rose Jerotich

texts.en:
Rose is a vegetable vendor who is married and blessed with three children. Her business is located at Tembeleo in Eldoret.

She was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by another group. With the loan she is taking from KADET, she will buy a sack of vegetables to sell. Her future dreams are to improve her business and to be able to provide basic needs for her dependents.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a sack of vegetables to sell to customers

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma sells snacks in the school canteen in Rizal Santiago City. She is 35 years old and married to Felimon. Felimon is a driver in their village.They are blessed with four children: Geraldine (13 years old, 2nd year high school), Gerald Mon (11 years old, Grade V pupil), Erskene Jake (6 years old, Grade I pupil) and Kristine Joy (four months old). Due to the large size of their household, the income they are generating is not enough to meet their basic needs and maintain their businesses. That’s the reason Gemma would like to obtain a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos.

According to Gemma, she would like to improve her business, and she wants to buy additional merchandise so that she can generate more income for her family's needs. Her husband is in full support of her business. This couple works hard to double the income they generate. She hopes that her loan will be granted, because it will be very helpful to buy more snacks to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to improve her snack vending business

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: K. is married and the father of 2 young children. He has owned a car painting shop since 2000. Their is great demand for his services, which is why he is requesting a loan of $1,100 to buy more merchandise for his clients.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel sells handbags at retail prices in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is 39 years old, married, and has 5 children. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Mabel is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more handbags to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand handbags to sell.

loans.name: Nyoka

texts.en:
Nyoka M. is currently in the business of selling dried fish, beans, and sugar. She is requesting a loan to buy fresh fish and more dried fish to sell. Nyoka is 28 years old and married; her husband is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for renting.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy fresh and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
El señor Braulio C. S. tiene 64 años y vive en la localidad de Mallco Chapi a unos 21 km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Braulio está casado por más de 36 años y tienen 3 hijos de 26, 22 y 19 años. Los dos menores viven con ellos y a demás de ayudar con el cuidado de las vacas también está estudiando en un instituto profesional en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Braulio se dedica a la producción de leche cruda por más de 20 años y trabajaba sembrando diferentes productos en sus tierras. En esta casa es donde tiene 5 vacas lecheras que son su mayor fuente de ingreso.

El crédito será destinado a la compra de alimento para ganado lechero que en esta época por la falta de lluvia el precio se incrementa, para de este modo poder alimentar a su ganado con normalidad y que su producción lechera y sus ingresos no se vean afectados. También será destinado para el pago de una acción del pozo de agua que construirán en la zona para el riego de sus tierras.

Braulio nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad que pueda a su esposa y a sus hijos, ya que su casa por el momento no cuenta con muchas comodidades o con los servicios necesarios. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que saque quisiera utilizarlo para poder construirles casa a sus hijos, y así vivan más cómodos.
texts.en:
Mr. Braulio C. S. is 64 years old and lives in the town of Mallco Chapi, about 21 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. Braulio has been married for more than 36 years and they have three children who are 26, 22, and 19. The younger two live with them and along with helping care for the cows, also study at a technical school in the city of Cochabamba. Braulio has worked in fresh milk production for more than 20 years, and also farms different crops on his land. At his home he has 5 dairy cows, and they are his main source of income.

The loan will be used to buy food for the dairy cows, since the price has increased from lack of rain. In this way he can feed his livestock the normal amount and their milk production and his earnings will not be affected. The loan will also be used to pay for his share of the water well that they are building in the area to irrigate his land.

Braulio tells us that his biggest dream is to provide every comfort for his wife and children, since their house does not currently have many luxuries or necessary utilities. He also tells us that with the next loan he gets, he would like to build a house for his children, so that they can live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for dairy cows and to help pay for a well

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 29 years old and lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Zeinab has been working as a seamstress since 2007. She sews all type of clothes, such as men’s suits, women’s dresses, and sweaters. Her work helps her to supplement her family’s income, and allows her to have her own income. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new sewing machine and thread for her business. This is the first time that Zeinab has requested a loan. 

Zeinab is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and does it well. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had some financial issues. She decided to start her business because she had been sewing since she was young.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and thread for her business

loans.name: Khamro

texts.ru: Абдулхамидов Хамро проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 67 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Хамро более 6 лет занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает пшеницу и вывозит на рынок. Этот бизнес ему приносит хороший доход. Жена и дети ему помогают в этой деятельности. Кредит просит для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений. Хамро хочет расширить свой бизнес. Он намерен посадить фруктовые деревья.
texts.en:
A. Khamro lives in the Shahrituz region. He’s sixty-seven years old, married and has six children. For more than six years Khamro has been a farmer, growing wheat, which he sells at the market. This business, in which his wife and children assist him, is very profitable for him. He’s requesting a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. Khamro wants to expand his business and plant some fruit trees.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mamadjon

texts.en: Mamadjon is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising and selling cows and sheep at the local market. He is 57 years old and married with three children. They live in Djabbar Rasulov, a region in northern Tajikistan. Every year he purchases young animals from local villagers and raises them over a 5-6 month period. Later, he sells the cows and sheep to local butchers. Mamadjon is thinking about expanding his business as his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase calves and feed for them. That’s why he is requesting a loan of $1,500 US. Extend your solidarity to Mamadjon so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase calves and feed

loans.name: Juanilyn

texts.en:
Juanilyn B. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 20 years old, single, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Juanilyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fish in the local community. Juanilyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Juanilyn joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda A. is from the village of Danao. She is 45 years old. Nilda is married and has 3 grown-up children. To make a living, Nilda has a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in her local community. Nilda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Nilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Nilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mirian Oneida

texts.es:
la sra. Mirian Oneida O. E. se dedica a su negocio que es una pulpería y venta de frutas la cual esta ubicada frente al estacionamiento de buses de la Terminal de transportes de Jutiapa Jamastran; actividad en la cual cuenta con 4 ½ años de experiencia.
El crecimiento de su negocio es notable y esto debido a la buena atención que le brinda sus clientes y por la administración que le da al mismo.
Doña Miriam, es casada y su esposo emigro para USA hace 3 ½ años, con la visión de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y tener su propia vivienda, sueño que hasta el momento casi lo logra en su totalidad, ya que doña Miriam tiene 4 meses da vivir en la casa que tanto soñaron juntos, aunque todavía le faltan muchos detalles, pero ella se siente feliz de vivir en su propia vivienda, para la construcción de la vivienda su esposo le mandaba el dinero en remesas pero muchas veces se pasaba del presupuesto y ella de su negocio terminaba de cubrir los gastos.
Del matrimonio ellos procrearon tres hijos, los cuales dependen a un 100% de ellos y en los últimos años doña Miriam ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos. 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia para su pulperia.
texts.en:
Ms. Mirian Oneida O. E. runs her own general and produce store, which is located in front of the bus terminal of Jutiapa Jamastran. She has 4 1/2 years of experience.

Her business has grown significantly due to her great customer service and management skills.

Ms. Mirian is married, and her husband immigrated to the USA 3 1/2 years ago, with the hopes of improving his living conditions and of obtaining his own house, a dream which he has almost completely achieved. Mirian has been living in their dream house for 4 months even though there is still some work to be done on it. However, she feels happy to live in her own home. In order to build this house, her husband would send her remittances from the US, but she would sometimes go over the budget and would have to cover the additional costs with the money from her business.

They have 3 children who depend on them 100%. Mirian has been both a mother and a father to those children in the last few years. She will use this loan in order to purchase merchandise for her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, doughnuts, churros, bathroom tissue, candy, beans, juice, chili peppers, and grains

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María Ángela H. A. de 33 años de edad, posee una venta de zapatos deportivos y formales para mujeres y niñas, las cuales comercializa en la zona urbana de San Francisco Goteras, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán, lugar en el cual también vive junto a su esposo quien es comerciante y junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad quienes se dedica atrabajar. La zona en la cual se encuentra María con su negocio es un lugar muy apto para este tipo de ventas ya que no existen muchos almacenes formales  por lo que las personas en su mayoría deben comprar en estos lugares, así también son de bajo costo, lo cual las personas buscan. Este negocio es fundamental para la economía familiar de María, ya que representa gran parte de los ingresos los cuales son utilizados para todos los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de zapatos, lo que le permita ofrecer mayor variedad de estilos y colores a sus clientes y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Ángela H. A., 33 years old, sells sports shoes and clothes for women and children. She sells them in the urban zone of San Francisco Goteras, located in the Morazán department, a location where she lives together with her husband, a businessman, and their two small children who work. The zone where María works is very apt for her business, as there aren't many formal stores and so the majority of residents must buy from María. These sales represent the greatest part of her earnings, and are used to cover household costs. María is seeking a loan to purchase a greater quantity of shoes, which will allow her to offer a greater variety of styles and colours to her clients and in this way increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes and women's clothing

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a single young man from Rafah City in the Gaza strip, Palestine. Muhammad is 28 years old and runs a fruit and vegetable store in the city. He started the business four years ago and has earned his living from it for the past four years. The store is located in Rafah market.

Muhammad decided to take a $2000 loan from FATEN to purchase a larger quantity and variety of vegetables and fruits. Since his store is well-known and has established a good number of clients, Muhammad would like to expand his business.

Muhammad stands in his store in the picture shown above.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 28 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edgar de 42 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles unos buenos estudios. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana Lidia abre su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus vecinos, ella es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y siempre los termina convenciendo de comprar algo más. Su tienda esta muy bien surtida, ya que siempre se preocupa por comprar los productos que le hacen falta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la relación que tiene con sus clientes, sin embargo lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. Con el tiempo espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda para poder vender más productos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta ahorrar todos los días un poco, para poder pagar su crédito por completo, en su grupo comunal es muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Lidia is 28 years old and is a very hard working and loving mother. She lives in her own home with her husband, 42 year old Edgar, and her four children to whom she wants to provide a good education. Every day she opens her grocery store early in the morning in order to service her neighbors. She is a very able salesperson who knows how to treat her customers. She usually convinces them to buy just a little more. Her store is very well stocked and she manages it well. What she enjoys most about her work is the relationships she has with her customers. Her biggest challenge is having to stay in her store all day. Eventually she hopes to expand her store in order to be able to sell more items. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is prepared to save a bit each day in order to be able to make her payments. She is very responsible within her communal group. She will use the money from this loan to increase her grocery inventory and stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Ron

texts.en:
Mrs. Ron S. (pictured here), 31, and her husband, Mr. Chumsambath S., 41, live along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1998 and just have one son who attends school.    

Ron has been selling roasted beef in front of her house for two years. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for fifteen years. She is requesting her first loan in the amount of US$ 500 to pay for house building.

loans.use: To pay for house building

loans.name: Trabajando En Armonia Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. MARIA EUFROCINA, TIENE 47 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE DOS HIJOS UNO DE 15 AÑOS Y OTRO DE 11 AÑOS, HACE CINCO MESES FORMA PARTE D. GRUPO "TRABAJANDO EN ARMONIA", QUE ESTA FORMADO POR 10 INTEGRANTES TODOS ELLOS RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE LA FLOR EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO.
HACE TRES AÑOSINICIÓ SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE SALCHIPAPAS Y SE UBICÓ FUERA DE DOMICILIO COLOCANDO UNA MESITA EN SU PUERTA, CADA VEZ QUE HABÍAN EVENTOS EN SU ZONA APROVECHABA QUE AUMENTABA LA VENTA, LUEGO DE UN TIEMPO UNO DE SUS HIJOS EMPEZÓ A ESTUDIAR REPOSTERÍA POR LO QUE IMPLEMENTARON UNA VITRINA DONDE EXHIBÍA LOS POSTRES PREPARADOS POR SU HIJO.
ELLA CONSIDERA QUE ÉSTE NEGOCIO LE BRINDA MUCHA AYUDA ECONÓMICA, POR LO QUE HA PODIDO PAGAR LOS ESTUDIOS DE SUS HIJOS YA SEA EL COLEGIO COMO EL INSTITUTO DE REPOSTERÍA, ADEMÁS DE APOYAR A UNA SOBRINA QUE ESTÁ A SU CARGO.
SU PROXIMA META A LOGRAR SERÁ IMPLEMENTAR UN RESTAURANTE EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO PARA ASÍ APROVECHAR EL ESPACIO DE SU CASA Y NO TENER QUE PAGAR ALQUILER.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS AL POR MAYOR PARA LA PREPARACIÓN DE SALCHIPAPAAS COMO SACO DE PAPAS, HOT DOG AL POR MAYOR, LAS CREMAS, LOS DESCARTABLES Y EL ACEITE.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Eufrocina, 47, has two children who are 15 and 11 years old, respectively. Five months ago, she joined the Trabajando en Armonia ("Working in Harmony") community bank, a group of 10 members, all residents of the La Flor neighborhood of Carabayllo. Sra. Maria started her business three years ago, making and selling salchipapas (a local hotdog-like dish), by setting up a table outside the door of her house. Whenever there was an event going on in the neighborood, she made the most of it to increase her sales. After a time, one of her sons began studying pastry-making so she set up a stand to display her son's pastries. Sra. Maria believes this business will be much more profitable and provide her a way to pay for her children to go to school. She is also supporting a niece who is in her care. Her next goal is to start a restaurant. She wants to set the restaurant up in a space at her house so that she can avoid paying rent. Sra. Maria will use this loan to buy wholesale supplies of the products she needs to make salchipapas: sacks of potatoes, supplies of hotdogs, condiments, paper plates and cooking oil.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for food business.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. prepares banku at Elmina for sale.  Araba has not received any form of education.  She is married and has seven dependants. Her husband is a fisherman. She is responsible for helping her husband pay for school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more corn to cook banku and also to sell some of the raw corn to customers. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to take care of her children.

loans.use: To buy more corn to cook banku to sell

loans.name: Jackline Timale

texts.en:
Jackline has been rearing goats and sheep and then selling them in Naivasha town for the last 11 years. She is 30 years old and married to Peter A.. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy more goats, which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

Jackline also hopes to start selling paraffin as a secondary business. Paraffin is in high demand in Naivasha town, and she believes it will be profitable. She hopes to grow her business and improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Liv

texts.en: Mrs. Liv D., age 53, is a widow with one married daughter who also lives in the family home. They live in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Liv has been selling fish for five years. She buys fish from the market, approximately 5 kilometers from her house, and resells it in her village. She is requesting her first loan, in the amount of $600, to purchase a motorbike for transporting fish.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transporting fish.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida C. is from the village of Nabannagan, Lasam, Cagayan. She is 37 years old. Zenaida is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling fruits and vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fruits & vegetables in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Zenaida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees and allowances of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Kum Sum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kum S. was born in 1970 and is the village bank president, selected by nine people who make up a village bank loan, located in Ta Loung village in Takeo province. They will each use their portion of the loan in varied ways She is a farmer who owns a 0.50-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell  to support her family. 

Her problem is that her field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. Kum S. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and hire a plow to plow her field. Her husband, Mr. Sarum Nouy, is employed in a private company. She is a mother of five children, four of whom are students in school, while the youngest one is just three years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire plow

loans.name: Selfha

texts.en:
Selfha S. is from the village of West Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Selfha runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Selfha has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Selfha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Selfha is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz tiene 29 años, es una joven madre de 2 hijos, vive en compañía de su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años,  Liz se dedica a la venta de ropa, mediante el pedido que le hacen sus clientes,  ya que desde niña fue su mayor anhelo. Hoy su gran carisma le ha dado ventaja para vender rápidamente sus productos, es por tal razón que siempre trata de complacer a sus clientes con variedad de prendas. Siente que su trabajo es muy rentable, ya que gracias a él, puede ayudar a su esposo en cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que esta al pendiente de la moda, disfruta mucho de su trabajo, aunque eso implique que tenga que caminar mucho. Con el tiempo, desea poner un bazar donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad sus prendas casuales. Es su sexto crédito con MFP y está muy feliz de poder obtenerlo, manifiesta que invertirá en su negocio, para que pueda desarrollarse y crecer comercialmente. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más ropa para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de donde elegir.
texts.en:
Liz is 29 years old; she is a young mother with two children and she and her husband live in their own house. 

For the last three years she has been selling clothing made to order for her clients. This had been her dream since childhood.  Today, her great charisma allows her to sell her products quickly, and she always tries to oblige her clients with a range of different clothes. Her work is very profitable, thus she is thankfully able to help her husband with the school fees for their children. What she likes most about her work is that it revolves around fashion. She enjoys it very much, even though it means that she has to do a lot of walking. In the future, she would like to have a market stall where she could sell her casual clothes more comfortably. 

This is her sixth loan with Kiva Field Partner, MFP, and she is very happy to have it. She will use it to invest in her business so that it can develop and grow commercially. She will buy more clothing so that she can offer her clients greater choice.

loans.use: To stock up with clothing.

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
Daria A. is a married woman who lives in Prk. San Juan, brgy. Patao, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  a Sari-Sari (general) Store and a Wholesaler of Soda business. 

Her husband Agapito A., who is 48 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 4 children who are 9 to 25 years old.  

Daria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Daria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brows. 

Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she could continue to save up for future improvements of her business. 

Daria A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). 

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To use as working capital for businesses.

loans.name: Dou Tha's Group

texts.en:
This village loan is made up of 15 members located in Traeuy Troeng village in Kandal province. The group selected Mrs. Dou T., a 49-year-old married woman, as the village bank president. Each member of this group loan will use their portion of the loan to support a different purpose.
Mrs. Dou T. is a farmer who rents some land to cultivate rice for a living. She does not have enough money to grow rice and is therefore requesting a loan to buy rice seed and to hire laborers to plow her farm. Her husband, Mr. K. S., is a farm laborer and also helps in his wife's farming. This couple has five children: one is a mechanic, one a knitter and the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and hire laborers to plow her farm

loans.name: Mario Santiago

texts.es: Mario Santiago tiene 30 años, su estado civil es casado. El se dedica al destace de cerdo. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio vendiendo pocos cerdos, ya que no tenía mucho capital de trabajo. Por lo que el principal objetivo es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ofreciéndoles lo que ellos solicitan. Es así como recurre a Fundación León 2000 ya que por medio ella las organizaciones amigas dan el apoyo necesario y solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para materia prima. El deseo de Mario es mejorar cada día más su negocio.
texts.en: Mario Santiago is married and 30 years old.  He butchers pigs and has been doing this work for more than nine years.  He began by selling a few pigs; he did not have much working capital.  His goal is to satisfy his customers by offering what they request; therefore, he turned to Fundación León 2000 (local lending institution) to ask for this loan, which will be used as working capital, for the purchase of raw material.  Mario's desire is to improve his business every day.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Manjula

texts.en:
Manjula S. is a forty-year-old woman. She was born in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Manjula is married and has three children. Her husband is a health inspector and two of her children are attending primary school and one is in secondary school. Manjula sells toothpastes, air-fresher, drinks, powdered milk, sardines, candles, soaps, etc. She has been a businesswoman for ten years now.  

Manjula S. has requested for a loan of SLL 4,000,000.00 from Kiva field partner, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), in order to expand her business. She will use the loan to buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock. In this way, her business will improve both in size and quality, attracting many customers into her business.

loans.use: Buy toothpaste, air-fresher, drinks, powdered milk, sardines, candles, soaps, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Silvana Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Tamarindos de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Orquideas.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Silvana, ella tiene 36 años de edad, está divorciada y tiene una hija de 15 años de edad la cual estudia en colegio. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 8 años  y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.
 
Tiene una lavadora de carros en la Avenida del Ejército en la cual además de ofrecer este servicio también vende refrigerantes y líquidos de batería, además en las noches utiliza el lugar como garaje. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, con ella trabajan tres personas a quienes ella les paga un sueldo semanal.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar una máquina para limpiar y lavar alfombras. Sus metas son hacer su propia casa y tener su propio local, ya que donde vive y tiene su negocio es arrendado.
texts.en:
The members of the “Damas Positivas” (Positive Women) Communal Bank meet every two weeks in Portoviejo city, the capital of Manabí. It has been known as the city of the Royal Tamarinds for many years.

This is where we find Silvana, age 36.  She is divorced, and she has a 15 year old daughter who is in high school.  She has been in the communal bank for eight years, and she likes it because the loans are fast and do not have so many requirements.

She has a carwash on the Avenida del Ejército.  In addition to carwash services, she also sells antifreeze and brake fluid.  Also, in the evenings she uses the place as a garage.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She pays a weekly salary to the three people that work with her.

She will use the loan to buy a machine for cleaning and washing carpets.

Her goals are to have her own house and her own place.  She rents where she lives and the place where she has her business.

loans.use: To buy a machine to clean and wash carpets

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet A. is married and has four children. She has had senior high school education. Janet sells fresh and frozen fish, meat and chicken in Takoradi. Her husband is a merchant. Janet uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Janet will use this loan to purchase more fish and meat to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Janet plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and meat

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with six children – two still attend school and four had graduated. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a leso's (Kikoi's) business for the past year, selling retail and from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanamisi faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demands in her business. During the months of January to May, the demand for Kikoi's is lower compared to the December holidays when the demand is very high. She hopes to expand and employ workers in the future.

With the 15,000  Kshs, she wants to purchase a bale of Leso's (Kikoi's) to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of  Leso's (Kikoi's)

loans.name: Hermocilla

texts.en:
Hermocilla is a married woman who lives in Arbor, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store and a vehicle transport business. Her husband Leonardo, who is 43 years old, works as a taxi driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 14 and 20 years old. Hermocilla joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Hermocilla has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,800, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 24,000, which she intends to use to buy stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of children. Hermocilla is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Jason

texts.en: Jason B. is from the village of Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. He is 32 years old. Jason is single and has one young child. Jason owns and operates a business raising crabs for sale. Jason has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 6,830 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2008, Jason joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jason has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby crabs to raise and sell. Jason is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase crab feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jason from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Dania Magaly

texts.es:
Dania Magaly de 21 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, casada, no tiene hijos, labora como Enfermera Profesional desde hace 3 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad y honestidad en la clinica Medica Asunciòn, su espso trabaja como mecanico de carros y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, como pocos jovenes muy responsables en sus actos y compromisos de pagos, tienen un alto espiritu de superacion, son personas responsable y amables, dedicados a sus trabajos el que desempeñan con amor y eficiencia.  

Requiere apoyo del Fondo Kiva en su 2do crédito para comprar zinc y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de la casa de su padres. 

Desde muy niña ha soñado llegar a ser  una doctora con mucha experiencia para ayudar a su comunidad
texts.en:
Dania Magaly is 21 years old. She lives in her parents’ house, she is married and has no children. She is a professional nurse and she has been working for 3 years in the Asunción medical clinic, performing her duties with great responsibility and honesty. Her husband is a mechanic, and he helps her paying for family expenses. Notwithstanding their young age, they take extreme responsibility for their actions and in respecting their payment obligations. They have a great desire to improve themselves, and they are responsible and kind people dedicated to their jobs, which they perform with love and efficiency.

She is requesting support to KIVA for her second loan, which she will use to buy zinc in order to improve the conditions of her parents’ house.

Even since she was a little girl, she dreamt of becoming a well-experienced doctor in order to help her community.

loans.use: To buy zinc to change the roof of her parents' house.

loans.name: Akoemba

texts.fr: Madame Akoemba est ménagère âgée de 40 ans elle réside à Avépozo, mariée à un conducteur de taxi-moto, elle a en sa charge 03 enfants. Elle a démarré son activité en 2001 par la vente de porte- monnaie. Son approvisionnement se fait au grand marché de Lomé et la revente se fait au grand marché de Lomé au niveau des revendeuses des produits congelés. Elle est à son second prêt et désire avoir ce montant pour l’achat de porte- monnaies  en vue d’agrandir son activité et de s’occuper en partie du foyer.
texts.en: Mrs. Akoemba is a 40-year old homemaker. She lives in Avépozo, is married to a motorcycle taxi driver and has three children in her care. In 2001, she launched her business selling purses. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé and resells at the big market of Lomé, in the row of frozen food vendors. She is on her second loan now and would like to receive these funds in order to purchase more purses to expand her business and cover part of the family budget.

loans.use: to purchase purses

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou R. is from the village of San Pedro, Alicia, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Marilou is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Bethy Elena

texts.es: Betty Elena de 57 años de edad es una mujer casada y con 3 hijos en las edades de 26 a 34 años, que vive en Costa Hermosa, barrio del municipio de Soledad, donde vende mercancía variada. El primer negocio de Betty fue de confecciones de vestidos de niñas, sabanas, suéteres  y desde el años 2005 empezó a comercializar calzado fabricado por su hermano, y posteriormente se dedicó a vender bolsos, cubrelechos y accesorios femeninos; en la medida en que el negocio de Betty fue creciendo así mismo aumentó su entusiasmo y aun no se detiene, por eso ha logrado conseguir buenos clientes, pero aún no tiene un capital de trabajo grande, para responderles de manera oportuna; en su negocio está involucrado su hijo que hace las compras de las mercancías y esto es un gran apoyo, para que ella las distribuya a crédito entre su gran diversidad de clientes; Su Credikiva  es el segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que le ha apoyado el crecimiento de su capital de trabajo, su sueño es tener una miscelánea en la casa, para descansar un poco de la distribución persona a persona, eso sí teniendo todo los que sus clientes necesiten, e ir diversificándolo cuando el mercado lo requiera. Con su credikiva comprará bolsos, sandalias, calzado femenino en general, pantalones, gorras, jeans, fantasías y accesorios; todo esto sobre pedidos lo cual garantiza el éxito en su rotación de inventarios  entre los mejores clientes, para así lograr una pronta recuperación del capital.
texts.en: Betty Elena is 57 years old. She is a married woman and she has 3 children, aged 26 and 34. She lives in Costa Hermosa in a community within the municipality of Soledad. She sells a variety of merchandise. Betty's first business was a sewing business where she made girls' dresses, bed sheets, and sweaters. In 2005 she started selling shoes made by her brother and later she sold ladies' handbags, comforters, and ladies' accessories. As Betty's business grew her enthusiasm also increased and still today there is no stopping her. This is how she has earned herself good clients. But she still doesn't have a larger working capital to respond to them in an opportune way. Her son is involved in her business. He purchases the merchandise and this is a great help. She later distributes among her very diverse clientele. Her Kiva loan is her second with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). This organization has supported the growth of her working capital. Her dream is to have a general store in her house, to take a rest from having to distribute client by client. She will be able to have all that her clients need and she will be able to diversify whenever the market requires it. With her Kiva loan she will purchase ladies' handbags, sandals, ladies' shoes in general, pants, hats, jeans, fashion jewelry, and accessories. She conducts her business by taking orders, which guarantees success in the rotation of inventory among her important clients to ensure a quick recovery of her capital investments.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' handbags, sandals, ladies' shoes in general, pants, hats, jeans, fashion jewelry, and accessories.

loans.name: Nohemi Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Nohemi, la socia  tiene 45 años de edad y La socia es soltera; La socia  tiene 2 hijos, de 16,14 años de edad;  La socia 
alterna sus actividades del hogar con comercio, la socia compra al por mayor golosinas, helados, la socia desea implementar su negocio y para ello comprara, golosinas, al por mayor, y los insumos para la elaboración de helados. La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de golosinas e insumos.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC".  She lives in the district of Huancha, in the province and department of Cusco.

Nohemi, 45, is single and has two children, ages 16 and 14.  She alternates her daily activities with her retail business selling sweets and ice cream.  She plans to use the loan to buy wholesale sweets and ingredients to make ice cream.

She is very grateful for the loan, which will help her improve her lifestyle, and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy sweets and supplies.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van was born in 1974. She lives with her husband and two children in Dai Bi village. Her husband is a builder and both of her children are going to school. Not only does she grow vegetables and rice, but she also sells clothes in the market, where she has a shop. She has had this job for three years. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2005 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Jinky has a retail shop that sells rice & cassava cakes. She has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients to make these native snack delicacies.

Jinky is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients to make snack food

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Akou est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un directeur de société. Elle a 02 enfants.  
Akou travaille comme couturière depuis 2000. Elle travaille avec 10 employés.  
Akou a requis son deuxième crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des machines à coudre.
texts.en: Akou is a 42 year old woman.  She is married to the director of a company.  She has two children.  Akou has worked as a seamstress since 2000.  She works with 10 employees.  Akou is requesting her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong is a local rice farmer who lives in Prey Chor district.  She and her husband have done this job since 1998.
