They are blessed with eight kids, seven of them are single, and one is married and lives independently. She has some income from her two children who are employed in a restaurant in Phnom Penh City of Cambodia. Through help from their kids, Mrs. Hong’s house is getting older and older and she really wishes to rebuild it again, but she has still not enough money to do so. That is why Mrs. Hong would like to borrow some fund from Kiva loan to purchase columns in order to start building a new house. From this, Mrs. Hong and her family can live in the new house which is more safe than before. For her expectations in the future, Mrs. Hong wishes to send all their children to study at excellent schools.

loans.use: to purchase columns for building a new house.

loans.name: Fredisminda

texts.es:
Fredisminda, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta D. panes con pollo, inicio hace muchos años con el negocio, venD. panes todas las tardes y actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. bebidas, panes y pollo, para preparar la venta.
Dicho préstamo le ayudara para tener todo lo necesario y elaborar la venta diariamente sin mayores contratiempos. Su aspiración es incrementar en negocio, y ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Fredisminda lives with her husband and two children. She engages in selling panes con pollo*, an activity she started many years ago. She sells panes con pollo every evening and she is currently requesting a loan to buy drinks, bread and chicken to prepare her sales.
This loan will help her getting [the ingredients] she needs and preparing her products without major setbacks. Her goal is to improve the activity and to offer a better standard of living to her children.


<cite>*chicken sandwich with lot of vegetables</cite>

loans.use: To buy drinks, bread and chicken for her activity.

loans.name: Rwenshama Boda Boda Association A Group

texts.en:
The economic status quo in Uganda at present is, to say the least, adverse, what with the rising costs of doing business and the high costs of living, food and other commodities. As things spiral out of control, many entrepreneurs are putting on a brave face.

Swaibu, 46 years old, is a risk tolerant, proactive and enterprising businessman who has operated a fish sales business in Rukungiri for 10 years. Although this district is not known for this activity, business people like Swaibu have taken root. Swaibu purchases most of the fish he sells in bulk. Demand for his fish has been growing recently; to cope with the rising demand, he buys fish from as far away as Bushenyi, which is also in the west of Uganda. Whilst this means more sales revenue, it’s also costly in terms of transportation.

With the present adverse economic situation, Swaibu has been hard pressed. He is undeterred, however, and with his upbeat disposition, he is hoping for a positive economic change soon. He has not bought into the idea of increasing the prices of his fish since most of his clients have low incomes. Swaibu says he makes close to UGX 50,000 daily from his business. He intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more fish in bulk to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Alba Nury

texts.es:
Después de trabajar durante algunos años en un almacén y motivada por tener su propio negocio, Alba Nury con sus ahorros empezó a vender mercancía entre tenderos conocidos, actualmente se dedica a esta labor y gracias a ella obtiene sus propios ingresos, los cuales kle sirven para aportar al cubrimiento de los gastos del hogar. 

En el futuro esta emprendedora sueña con ampliar su mercado y tener cada vez más clientes con el fin de crecer su negocio, por ahora necesita de un préstamo para adquirir mercancía y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
After working for a number of years in a store, and motivated to have her own business, Alba Nury started to sell merchandise among some well-known shopkeepers using her own savings.  This is the work that she is doing now, and thanks to this business she generates her own income, which she uses to contribute to the household expenses.

In the future, this enterprising woman dreams of expanding her business and gaining more and more customers over time.  For now, she needs a loan so that she can acquire merchandise and in this way increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Halimahon's Group

texts.en:
Halimahon is the treasurer of this group. She is 53 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband she has raised a daughter and a son. The son works in Russia and the daughter is a schoolteacher. Halimahon has been working as a teacher of mathematics for twenty years. 

She also breeds cattle for making additional money. She breeds cattle and then resells it at the higher price after being fattened. In this way she earns an additional 4,000 soms per month. 

With money received from the loan she wants to purchase sheep for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, Halimahon plans to finish their house construction.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 36 años, es una mujer dinámica, emprendedora y muy trabajadora; convive con su pareja, con quien tiene tres hijos de 15, 13 y 1 año y medio. Juntos habitan en su casa propia  comparten los días educando e intentando brindarle s una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ella se dedica a diversas actividades, pues posee un restaurante ofreciendo desayunos y jugos por las mañanas, al medio día expende comida, y por las noches ofrece pollo broaster. Asimismo posee un terreno, a 60 km de su vivienda, en ella siembra productos como el cacao y frutas cítricas, a la vez que cría aves de corral. Su esposo es quien más la apoya en el trabajo, al igual que sus hijos. Pero el trabajo que más la apasiona es la de cocinar y eso se demuestra en la buena sazón que tiene, y eso le ha dado mucha ventaja en su negocio, pues son muchos los clientes que recurren a su establecimiento.  Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, y por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará pollitos para criarlos para luego convertirlo en materia prima para la preparación de sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Flor is 36 years old.  She is a dynamic, entrepreneurial and very hard-working woman who lives with her partner.  The couple have three children aged 15, 13 and 18 months.  They live together in their own home and spend their days educating their children and trying to provide them with a better quality of life.

Flor is engaged in a number of different business activities.  She owns a restaurant where she sells breakfasts and juices in the mornings.  At midday she sells meals and, in the evenings, she sells fried chicken.  She also owns a plot of land, 60km from her home, where she grows products such as cacao and citrus fruits.  In addition, she raises poultry.  Her husband is the one who supports her the most in her work but her children help too.  The work that she is most passionate about is the cooking and this shows in the great flavor that her food has.  This gives her a great advantage in her business as she has many customers who come to her establishment.

This will be Flor's third loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your support so that she can continue in her work.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy chicks to raise and then turn into ingredients for making her food.

loans.use: to buy chicks

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Fish is the main fresh food for most people, in particular the families who depend on fishing and fish selling. Mrs. Soeun is one of those people who currently depends on selling fish at the local busy market. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. Soeun is a humble mother who has been blessed with three lovely children who are living under her care. From this type of business activity, Soeun can earn approximately $4USD for each day. Soeun and her husband have been in this business since 2000. To upgrade their living standards, Soeun and her modest husband would like to purchase fishing equipment but lack the cash.  She has decided, with her husband, to request funds through HKL, a partner with Kiva. She expects that these funds will improve her revenue. She and her husband are very thankful to all kind lenders who always help her family. This is her third cycle of her loans with HKL and the first loan with Kiva partner. She expects to have a a comfortable house, and send her children to get a good education at a high level.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 45-year-old married father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Phuong runs a small general store where he sells electrical products such as fans, lights, clocks, and household appliances to people in his community. He has been in this business for ten years. 

Phuong is requesting a loan to increase the quantity and variety of the electric products and household appliances that he sells from his store. He hopes that his loan will enable him to attract new customers and better serve his existing customers. Phuong also hopes that he will increase his income and improve his family's life.

loans.use: to purchase household electrical products and appliances

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji is 32 years old and married with a 12-year-old child who is currently attending school. For the past five years, he has run a general merchandise store in Grassfield, in the eastern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. Alhaji sells books, pens, milk, butter, sugar, and assorted other goods. His major business challenge is slow business during the rainy season.

Alhaji is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more books, pens, and provisions to sell.  The extra income from his loan will help him improve and maintain good health. In the future, Alhaji would like to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase books, pens, milk, butter and other items to sell

loans.name: Umoja Shg Group

texts.en:
Martin is the facilitator of Umoja SHG group. Martin and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Martin takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to ensure food security for his family and educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Martin had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 ½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Martin was only able to harvest five bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Martin will educate his children and ensure food security for his family.

In 2012, the members of Umoja SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Martin is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 36 years old and married to a farmer. They are thankful because they were blessed with three healthy children.

Marietta has owned and managed her retail store for five years and she is able to earn about PHP 5,000 per month. She utilizes her income for the family’s daily household expenses:  allowances, her children’s tuition fees, and an amount toward the maintenance of her rice fields.
 
In this situation, Marietta is aiming to increase her sales and profits because her income is not enough to cover all their daily household expenditures. Marietta is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase   merchandise such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, cooking oil, milk, sugar, ingredients, shampoo, and detergent for her retailing business. 

Marietta said that running a retail store is quite difficult due to some customers’ credit. So, nowadays she does not allow credit because it prevents her from reinvesting her income to make her business grow.

She is hoping that she could continually acquire financial assistance from the lending institution, so that she could improve her financial stability and improve her family’s living conditions. Through this loan amount, she could attain her goal in life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, cooking oil, milk, sugar, ingredients, shampoo, and detergent for her retail business.

loans.name: Penelope

texts.en:
Penelope is 38 years old, married and has five children.

Penelope owns and operates a business driving a taxi. She has many years of experience in this business. Penelope needs a loan of WST 1,000 to maintain her vehicle. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 500 or USD 208 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Penelope joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Penelope's first loan with SPBD.

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a very hard working woman who is a fruit vendor. She is 35 years old, married and they have three children. 

She is applying for her first loan which she plans to use partly to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and wheat seeds) and partly to use in the fruit vending business expansion. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, she hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and wheat seeds

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Morn, 51, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Morn and her husband are farmers. Morn is requesting a loan of US $500 to pay for her son’s wedding expenses. In the future, Morn would like to purchase a plot of farmland to grow more rice for sale. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to pay for her son's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Akala

texts.en:
Akala is 59 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Akala owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell.  She has three years of experience in this business.    

Akala is requesting a loan of 2,000 WST to purchase herbicides such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit generated from her business (estimated to be 600 WST per week) to financially support her immediate family members.

In 2009, Akala joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Akala's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Mujeres Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es:
ERIKA CECILIA, tiene 33 años de edad, ella es soltera, forma parte del grupo "Mujeres sin Fronteras", éste grupo está integrado por siete socios, todas ellas mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras, cuya meta es hacer prosperar sus negocios.
Erika Cecilia se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de verduras der forma ambulatoria, inició éste negocio con muy poca mercadería, poco a poco ha ido creciendo su negocio.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de verduras en mayor cantidad y la compra de algunas mesas para colocar sus verduras.
texts.en:
Erika Cecilia is 33 years old and single. She is a part of the group "Mujeres Sin Fronteras." (Women Without Borders). This group is composed of 7 members, all of them are perseverant and hard-working women whose goal is to make their businesses succeed. Erika Cecilia has worked for more than 5 years as a vegetable street vendor. She started this business with very little merchandise, bit by bit she has grown her business.

The loan requested will be utilized in the purchase of shelves and to improve the tables where she places her vegetables.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of vegetables to increase her stock.

loans.name: Moline

texts.en:
Moline is a 24-year-old mother of two. She currently lives in Mbire District of Zimbabwe. For the past three years, Moline has successfully operated a grocery shop at the local business center where she sells sugar, cooking oil, matches, chips, macaroni and flour. The business is well stocked and has a flea market base in the village. The customers are happy for they get most of their supplies from the shop. 

She would like to use the second loan to expand her business.  Increase in the profit will mean better living conditions for her family and support to vulnerable children in her community.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking oil, matches, chips, macaroni and flour.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to pull through, overcoming different obstacles that have arisen in her life. She is a mother of four, and from Kitale, a remote town in the Rift valley province of Kenya. 

Beatrice has spent the past 10 years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Beatrice is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in; poultry farming is closest to her heart. 

Beatrice wants to diversify and start a business selling cereals. She is requesting a loan to buy cereals to sell. The Kitale area has a ready market for cereals, but the problem is that there are no cereal suppliers. With your loan, Beatrice will be able to sell cereal to the local market and to her neighbors. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. 

Beatrice is very concerned about her four children’s education, so profits from selling cereal will go to pay her school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children. Joan awaits your kindness with open hands.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Vergensita

texts.en: Vergensita is 64 years old married living in Maloro, Tangub city. Vergensita earns a living from selling personal and home use products in her dry good store while her husband is a retired teacher and helping managing their business. She has been doing this for many years and she  earns well and improve the business. Her earnings goes their daily family expenditures To have more stocks to offer,  she borrowed a loan from GDMPC amounting 13,000.00 to buy more stocks like plastic ware, laundry soap, perfumes for her retail store in order to raise more profits. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of providing better education to her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase stock for his shoe sales

loans.name: Adila

texts.en:
42-year-old Adila was born in 1965 in Salyan region, Yenikand village. She is married and has 2 children.
Having borrowed a loan of $600 she bought perfumery and decorations. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy  bridal dresses. Adila wants to start selling bridal dresses in order to improve her business.
She has been in this business for 5 years.

loans.use: To buy bridal dresses

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Born in 1969, Alice is married and has five children. Realizing the heavy school needs of her children, she sought assistance from GHAPE when she joined the program in 2005 and took her first loan of $40 which she invested in the production of tapioca. She has suceeded in this business because she grows the cassava herself and on her own piece of land. There is a ready market for her Gateau, provided by the nearby school. School children have been benefiting immensely from her activities as they are the greatest consumers of her produce.

Given a loan of $500, she hopes to increase the size of her cassava farm to meet the increasing demand. She equally hopes to buy 50kg of flour, 10 tins of palm oil, 20kg of sugar and some yeast. She plans to repay the loan during the term.

loans.use: Production of Tapioca and frying of Gateau.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru:
Муж Зухры находится на заработках в России вот уже несколько лет. Сама Зухра не имеет постоянной работы и сидит дома. Ей 34 года и она воспитывает 3 детей. Для пополнения семейного бюджета она занимается выращиванием домашнего скота дома. Это приносит солидный доход. Опыт работы Зухры в животноводстве 4 года. В Микроинвест она кредитуется недавно. На займ Микроинвест она приобрела одного бычка. На новый займ она собирается приобрести еще одного бычка.

For several years, Zukhra's husband has been in Russia working as a seasonal laborer. Zukhra has no permanent job and stays at home. She is a 34-years-old single mother of 3. To supplement her family budget, Zukhra raises cattle at home. The business brings a sizable income. Zukhra has 4 years of experience raising cattle. Recently, she joined MicroInvest lending program and purchased a young bull. With the new loan, Zukhra plans to buy another bull.

loans.use: For purchase one more gow

loans.name: Asiah

texts.en:
My husband and I have been making paper envelopes for several years now. We both work extremely hard to meet our expenses and to provide for our eight children.

We now want to expand our business by taking on more orders. This requires us to buy a larger amount of paper and to hire an assistant for us. This expansion will help us to provide better food and clothing to our children. We are thus asking for a loan of $325 USD.

loans.use: To expand the envelope making business

loans.name: Gilma

texts.es:
Gilma lives in San Martín, Peru, and her business is located in her own home in the Jirón Ramón Castilla neighborhood. She runs a convenience store selling items like vegetables, meats, sausages and soft drinks. It's much like a small mini-mart. Gilma belongs to the Communal Bank of the Immaculate Virgin.

With the loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, Gilma will purchase supplies like 50kg sacks of sugar and rice, two packages of oil, milk, canned goods, sausages, noodles, detergents, and other items her store needs. Gilma feels that her business helps out a lot and she provides good customer service, keeping her store open for clients all day long. She wants to keep growing the store and buy a cooler.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Gilma pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen D. la Inmaculada, vive en la región San Martín, provincia D. San Martín, Distrito D. Tarapoto, departamento D. San Martín, su negocio está ubicada en su propia casa situado en el Jirón Ramón Castilla cuadra 6 y se dedica a su bodega donD. venD. Abarrotes, verduras, carnes, embutidos, gaseosas, es como un pequeño mercadito. Con el crédito recientemente recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,500.00 ($ 500.00), que pagará en 4 meses, comprará abarrotes como azúcar y arroz en sacos D. 50 kg cada uno, dos paquetes D. aceite, docenas D. leche, conservas enlatadas, embutidos, fideo en paquetes, docenas D. jabones, detergentes y todo lo referente a la bodega. Gilma, siente que su negocio le ayuda bastante, da buen trato a los clientes que es la clave para que acudan a comprar y mantiene abierto todo el día. Desea más adelante comprar una conservadora D. alimentos y tener su minimarket.

loans.use: Purchase various items for convenience store

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia is the mother of 7 children, all of which have supported her more than her husband, which is the reason why they have made it through the hard times. Her business, which has now been running for 20 years, she began by selling her products among her neighbours to earn some money and provide her children with supplies, because her husband was not very responsible and spent his earnings on other things. Some time later Flavia saw that she needed to invest more time in the sales of her products because her husband suffered an embolism. Slowly but surely Flavia started to earn more clients and with their business she was able to offer more selection. Today Flavia sells seasonal clothing, perfumes and jewellery.

Flavia is requesting a loan of US$625 that she will repay in a term of 4 months. With these funds she will be able to purchase new lines of clothing and she will be able to fill the orders that have already been placed so that she will be able to offer something new for the holiday season. With your help Flavia will be able to succeed and she will be able to assist her husband recover from that terrible condition.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Flavia es madre de 7 hijos de los cuales ella considera que fue por su ayuda más que por la de su esposo que sus hijos salieron adelante. Puesto que desde hace 20 años, Flavia comenzó a vender productos entre sus vecinas para poder sacar un poco de dinero para poderles comprar útiles a sus hijos, puesto que su esposo se veía un poco irresponsable al gastarse sus quincenas en otras cosas. Tiempo después Flavia tuvo que dedicarse más tiempo a la venta de estos productos puesto que su esposo padeció de Embolia, así que Flavia tomó Poco a poco Flavia comenzó a hacerse de clientes y por lo tanto a ofrecerles más productos. Actualmente Flavia vende ropa de temporada, perfumes y joyería.

Sin embargo actualmente Flavia está solicitando un crédito de US $625 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses, con este dinero poderá comprar productos nuevos como ropa y comprar la mercancía que le solicitaron para poder tener algo nuevo que ofrecer en la temporada navideña. Con tu ayuda Flavio podrá salir adelante y sacar a su esposo delante de esta terrible enfermedad.

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia has belonged to the community bank Señor D. Huanca for eight months. She mentioned that in the bank she has learned to save, to be responsible, how to manage money, and about good nutrition.

Basilia is 48 years old. She is married and has seven children. Basilia owns a bakery where she makes a variety of breads. For the past five years Basilia has worked together with her children and husband to make the business successful. She and her husband started out as employees in another bakery but little by little were able to open their own store. They sell their bread from their house and at a variety of markets in the towns of Putaja and Tambo Cucho.

Basilia needs a loan of 2600 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying flour, butter, and yeast. Basilia will use her savings to build a house out of more durable materials. Her dream is that her business will continue to grow and that her children will be professionals.

loans.use: Basilia needs a loan of 2600 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying flour, butter, and yeast.

loans.name: Nazaket

texts.en: Ms. Nazaket is a 34-year-old local resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with her husband and four children. She breeds cattle in her yard with her husband. They have been engaged in this business for 15 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. They also sell milk and other dairy products. Nazaket wants to increase their number of cows. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $600.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla F. is a lady that, since her childhood, has grown up in the municipality of El Sause in the city of León. She has been dedicated to agriculture. That is the business that permits her to make a living for her home and thus to maintain her two small children (a youth of 15 years and a boy of 3 years.)

It is apparent in the area where she lives, one can not count on electric power because they are very rural. She has very wisely decided to acquire a solar panel to obtain lighting and so that her children can study with no problem. Upon acquiring the panel, she will repay the debt very responsibly. For that reason she has applied to Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will give her the benefit of electric power for her tasks in the home and for her daughter to study.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Karla F. es una dama que desde su niñez se ha desarrollado en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León dedicándose a la actividad de la agricultura que es el negocio que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y así mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos (una jovencita de 15 años y un niño de 3 años.)

En vistas a que en el local donde ella vive no se cuenta con energía eléctrica por estar muy alejado, ella muy sabiamente decidió adquirir un panel solar para obtener iluminación y que sus hijos puedan estudiar sin ningún problema. Al adquirir el panel, muy responsablemente debe de cancelar esta deuda y por este motivo es que acude a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan cancelar esta deuda y así sacarle el provecho a la energía eléctrica para sus quehaceres del hogar y para el estudio de su hija.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel for her house,

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 21 years old and is single with 2 children, ages 5 and 1. Mariam is a firewood seller; she started her business in 2007. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 3:30 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her business

loans.name: Dilbaroy

texts.en:
Dilbaroy K. is 35 years old, and she is the loving mother of two children. Dilbaroy’s husband is a businessman. They both work extremely hard in order to support their family and to ensure that their children have the opportunity to receive a higher education. For the past 6 years she has been selling bed clothes in the local market known as “Somon-bozor,” which is a very popular market among the population and is why Dilbaroy has a great deal of clients. Generally, Dilbaroy travels to Bishkek, which is located in the neighboring country of Kyrgyzstan, to purchase new goods. When purchasing new goods, she tries to choose various products of high quality at reasonable prices, which allows her to maintain a dedicated and loyal client base.

The business generates stable income and thereby allows Dilbaroy to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for the needs of her children as they grow older. Dilbaroy is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to increase her inventory of bed clothes and to expand the range of goods she offers to her customers. Dilbaroy would like to thank everybody for supporting her and promises that she will pay the loan back within the 9-month loan term.

loans.use: To expand her inventory and to meet her customers' demands by purchasing a wider array of goods

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery has worked filling orders for a variety of products on demand for 20 years. Her customers are friends and acquaintances. Some time ago, she used to offer a daily lunch in her home, but she had to stop doing that because of personal problems. Two years ago, Mery began selling cosmetics by catalog, but she had to stop doing that activity as well, because there was too much competition.

Nonetheless, Mery never stopped selling products on demand. She offers her customers what they desire. She has even organized social activities for her customers. She is also a school promoter for a school close to her home. She works there for 6 hours every day.

The loans that she has requested thus far have helped her. Mery would like to obtain more capital in order to open a storefront for sales of a variety of items.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Mery se dedica a la venta de diversos productos a pedido desde hace 20 años. Sus clientes son sus amistades y conocidos. Hace algún tiempo, ella ofrecía menú en su casa, pero tuvo que dejar esta actividad por problemas personales. Igualmente, hace 2 años Mery incursionó en las ventas de cosméticos por catálogo, pero tuvo que dejarlo, ya que había mucha competencia.

Sin embargo, Mery nunca dejó las ventas por pedido. Ella le ofrece al cliente lo que él desee. Incluso ha organizado actividades sociales por encargo. Asimismo, ella es promotora escolar de una escuela cerca de su casa. Allí trabaja 6 horas diarias.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido. Mery quisiera hacerse de un mayor capital de dinero para así instalar una empresa de ventas múltiples.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of products that her customers request

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria Eugenia has a store where she sells general goods (good like, bread, sugar, soda, sweets, etc.) located in the Ex Tranca of Rio Seco in the city of El Alto. Her husband does not have a stable job, only working occasionally as a driver or a bricklayer. They have three children of 16 years, 8 years, and 6 years of age. Their home is located in the Yunguyo zone of El Alto.

This loan will be used to purchase concrete (cement and sand that they mix themselves) to renovate their home, which is in bad shape and needs urgent repairs. This is her second loan with Kiva, the good history of repayment allowed her to be approved for the new loan that she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Eugenia tiene un puesto de venta de abarrotes (tienda donde vende pan, azucar, refrescos, dulces, etc) ubicado en la Ex tranca de Rió Seco en la Ciudad de El Alto, el esposo no tiene un trabajo seguro solo realiza labores eventuales como chofer o albañil; tiene tres hijos de 16, 8 y 6 años de edad su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Yunguyo de la Misma Ciudad. El crédito lo destinara a la compra de cemento y arena para refaccionar su vivienda, la cual está en malas condiciones y necesita urgentemente los arreglos. Es el segundo crédito con Kiva, el buen comportamiento de pago le faculta para la aprobación del nuevo préstamo que está solicitando Maria Eugenia.

loans.use: Purchase of concrete (cement and sand) to repair her home.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil, 49 years old, lives with his wife and 3 children in the South of Lebanon, close to Tyr. Khalil owns a small restaurant that specializes in Hummus (made of chick peas) and Foul (made of beans), which are traditional Lebanese breakfast dishes. He needs a loan of USD 1,200 for the purchase of a large inventory of chick peas and beans. This is the second time Khalil has requested a loan from Al Majmoua [Kiva’s Field Partner]. He successfully repaid his previous loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase of a large inventory of chick peas and beans

loans.name: Mr. Khut Khum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people in Chrey Kaong Lich Village in Kampong ChhnA. Province make up the village bank loan and they plan to use it for multiple purposes. Mr. Khut K. is the village bank president and he is a palm juice collector who gathers palm juice to process into palm wine or sugar. Aside from this business activity, he is a fisherman in the local lake. His wife, Mrs. Suong Mom raises three cows and two pigs. Since her cows and pigs grow bigger every day, Mrs. Suong  does not have enough money to buy grass for the cows and pig food for the pigs. Thus, Mr. Khut K. decided to ask for a loan for his wife. Mr. Khut K. is 26 years old and the father of a four year old child who is too young to work or attend school.  Mr. Phon S. and Mr. Chea P. could not come to take the loan but their wives came to take the loan instead so they are in the picture. 

Twelve members have end-of-term loans and these members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main policy because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy grass for the cows and pig food for the pigs.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia es  una mujer muy empeñosa y laboriosa, con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logró instalar una tienda en su casa, en la cual se ocupa el mayor tiempo del día y al mismo tiempo dedicarse al cuidado de sus 2 hijos.  Gracias también al trabajo de su esposo como cerrajero lograron implementar esta pequeña bodega, donde muy alegremente  atiende a sus clientes y sobre todo, trata de brindar los productos de primera necesidad.  Pero Silvia ha tenido diversos problemas económicos, que han hecho que  su negocio decaiga, por ello solicita un préstamo, para comprar mercadería al por mayor en la ciudad, y así seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes productos de calidad. Su contribución logrará hacer de esta bodega, un negocio sostenible para Silvia.
texts.en:
Silvia is a very hard-working, laborious woman who, with a great deal of effort and sacrifice, was able to put up a small store in her home. She tends to the store for most of her day so that she can also take care of her two children. Thanks to her husband's work as a locksmith, they were able to start this small shop where they happily attend to the customers, and more than anything try to offer the most basic products for their clientele. Silvia has had various economic difficulties which have made the business struggle which is why she needs a loan in order to purchase wholesale merchandise in the city to continue offering quality products to her customers. Your contribution will help Silvia make her store a sustainable business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire merchandise at wholesale prices to supply her store

loans.name: Somean

texts.en: Mr. Somean C. lives in Ra village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a construction worker and his wife, Mrs. Phum Hun, owns a small grocery store in the local village. Aside from these businesses, they own a small piece of land where they cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn a living. They now have a small problem because they do not have enough oxen to plow their fields; thus, Mr. Somean C. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox, to add to his old one, to plow the fields. He is 25 years old and the father of three children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy an ox to plow the fields.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun S., a 39-year-old resident of Kompong Tom Province and the mother of five children who are all in school, grows rice and vegetables to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Bunny Chouk, 25, is a house decorator who also rents out decorations and musical instruments for wedding parties and other occasions.

Because he needs to improve his business but lacks the capital to do so, Soeun is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more loudspeakers and fans for his service. (Mrs. Soeun's husband is pictured because she was not available)

loans.use: To buy more loudspeakers and fans.

loans.name: Arcenia

texts.es:
Arcenia, tiene 48 años  es separada con dos hijos  mayores de edad y profesionales, con sus familias formadas e independiente de ella. La misma se dedica a la venta de comestible como por ejemplo: empandas, marineras, milanesas croquetas y todo tipo de comidas rápidas.


Arcenia  se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de dos años y su local comercial se encuentra en la zona del km 9 Acaray donde da de comer por día a 53 clientes debido a que su comida es la más rica en la zona.

 
Arcenia, con sus ganancias de las ventas hace frente a los gastos de la casa y también recibe el apoyo de sus hijos que le pasan una mensualidad.





Arcenia, comenta que tiene bastante venta. Es por ello que  desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías como frutas, verduras, productos cárnicos, arroz, aceite, azúcar, etc., de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona y tener mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Arcenia is 48 years old, separated, and has 2 grown children who are professionals with their own families and no longer dependent upon her. She sells food such as: turnovers, fried, breaded meat and croquettes and other types of rapidly-prepared food. Arcenia has been preparing food for over two years and her business is located at the kilometer 9 Acaray area where she prepares food every day for 53 customers as her food is the most delicious in the area. Arcenia, with her profits from her sales, pays her household expenses and also receives support from her children who give her a some money monthly. Arcenia says that she has enough sales. So she wishes to acquire a large quantity of merchandise such as fruit, vegetables, meat products, rice, oil, sugar, etc. and in this way she will be able to meet the strong demand that she has in this area and have a greater number of customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, vegetables, fruit, baked goods, meat

loans.name: Muhaiyo

texts.en:
I. Muhaiyo is 43 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Muhaiyo is a market vendor. She started out three years ago with only a few products, but her business is currently more stable. Muhaiyo sells fruits such as apples, bananas, mandarins, pomegranates, and pears. In the market, she is known for her friendliness and for the attractive prices. All of this allows Muhaiyo’s business to generate a good, stable income for her family. Currently, Muhaiyo wants to expand her business and she is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (US $575), which she will repay in 6 months. She would like to thank everyone for supporting her.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets (including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing fruit to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Doãn Thị Nhạn năm nay 56 tuổi.  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện tại chị đang chăn nuôi lợn tại nhà, chồng chị làm bảo vệ tại Hà Nội. Cùng với sự hỗ trợ cúa các con đã đi làm hàng tháng thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm lợn và sửa sang chuồng tại phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Doãn Thị Nhạn, 56 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2005. Currently, she works at home raising pigs, and her husband works as a security guard in Hà Nội. With some additional support from their grown children, their monthly income is about 5,000,000 VND (288 USD). In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (575 USD) to buy more pigs and to repair her pigpen.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Fatuma Seleman

texts.en: Fatum Seleman M., a married Tanzanian woman, has operated a pharmacy in Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam for four years, purchasing her business stocks from the Kariakoo wholesale shops. She is now requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to expand the business

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman Q. is 48 years old and married with three children. Mehman sells confectioneries, such as candies, cookies, pastries, and fruit jellies. He proudly states that he has been in this line of business for approximately twenty years. Mehman purchases his goods from the neighboring city. The income he is able to generate from his business allows him to support his family. He is the sole breadwinner in his family. 

Mehman will be using this loan to expand his inventory of goods. He plans to purchase additional confectioneries. Mehman thanks everyone for their support, and he promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more confectioneries.

loans.name: Ugul

texts.ru: Угул женщина 50 лет , замужем имеет троих детей.Она раньше ни где не работала и ей было очень скучно сидеть без дела дома.Увидев , что матери плохо,сыновья ей посоветовали выйти на рынок и торговать продуктами питания.Снабжают товаром её сами сыновья.Не дают ей трудной работы.От соседей по бизнесу Угул узнала , что в кредит возможно увеличить оборотный капитал, она решила расширить ассортимент своих товаров.В основном она торгует макаронными изделиями.Получив займ она добавит разные продукты питания.
texts.en:
Ugul is 50 years old, married and has three children. In the past, when she was not working outside the home she was very bored. Seeing that their mother was feeling poorly, her sons advised her to open a stall at the market to sell food products. Her sons keep her stall stocked with inventory, and do the heavy work. Ugul learned from neighboring businesses that credit could be used to increase working capital, and she decided to expand the assortment of products she offers for sale. She generally sells pasta. but after receiving the loan branched out into other food products.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food products

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin sells building materials.  She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more building materials to sell.  Toyin is 35 years old and married to O. who is a commercial driver.  They have four children.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria O. is 49 years old and she is married with four children. She sells sarongs of various colours. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
Maria  es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Maria es casada tiene 36 años, dos hijos de 15 y 8 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Maria tiene una tía que se dedica ala venta de vinos y su tía la animo a que entre al negocio ella se animo  a vender y le  esta yendo bien  vende 80 botellas semanales.
Desde que Maria esta en  Finca aprendió a trabajar con el préstamo, a invertir, su negocio ha crecido. 
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para comprar botellas de vino, bidones de vino en chincha.
El sueño de Maria es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo (San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank). Maria is married and is 36 years old; she has two children aged 15 and 18 that are studying in the public school.

Maria has an aunt who sells wines and her aunt has inspired her to enter the same career. She is motivated to sell and her sales are good, selling 80 bottles each week.

Since Maria joined Finca she has learned how to work with the loan and how to invest, her business has grown. Maria needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy bottles of wine and barrels of aging wine. Maria’s dream is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To puchase bottles of wine and barrels of aging wine.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mrs D. lives in Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, married, and blessed with four school-aged children. She owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, making and selling snacks and other delicacies. She has been engaged in this business for more than 12 years, and earns 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.

Mrs D. joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family and to have some savings.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elbis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Elbis S. se dedica a la actividad Agrícola en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León donde a diario se esfuerza grandemente laborando en el cuido, conservación y protección de las tierras y las siembras.

Hoy en día, el señor  S. ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para abastecer por medio de recursos agrícolas su actividad por medio de la siembra esperando tener una excelente cosecha para mejorar su condición financiera en su localidad.
texts.en:
Elbis S. works in agriculture in the municipality of Telica in the city of Leon, where he works hard every day to care for, conserve, and protect the land and his plantings.

Now Mr. S. has asked for a loan from Ceprodel to supply himself with agricultural resources for planting. He is hoping to have an excellent harvest in order to improve his financial condition in his town.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agricultural preparation and planting

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Cette femme a ouvert en 2004 une boutique de vente de produits pharmaceutiques et des produits génériques. Son stock de produits pharmaceutiques a connu une baisse, elle veut se réapprovisionner pour cela, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier cycle de prêt pour rehausser son stock de produits pharmaceutiques.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Avec son revenu elle contribue aux dépenses de son foyer.
texts.en:
In 2004, this woman opened a store selling pharmaceutical and generic products. Her stock has depleted so she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to re-stock her generic products. She is married and has one child. With her income she contributes to the household expenses.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of pharmaceutical and generic products

loans.name: Ivania Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ivania está formado por Ana Julia S. H., Ivania Balladares C. y Petrona del Socorro G. B.. Tres mujeres originarias de la comarca José Dolores B., ubicada en la ciudad de Masaya.

Ana Julia trabaja en la elaboración de artesanías bordadas con su hija de 19 años, doña Ana inicio su negocio desde hace 5 años, impulsada por su hija, quien había aprendido a bordar y motivo a su mamá a trabajar en conjunto. Ana corta las piezas y su hija hace los bordados. Esto les ha ayudado a generar más ingresos ya que Ana solamente trabajaba en la elaboración de comida los fines de semana. Así su hija hoy está estudiando en la universidad y pretende superarse.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para ir ampliando el negocio, sueña contener un tramo en el mercado de Masaya donde puedan ofertar directamente sus trabajos a los turistas y clientes que visitan el lugar.

Ivania trabaja en la elaboración de tortillas y posee una mini pulpería que desea ir ampliando; Petrona vende ropa usada y elabora comidas por las noches.
texts.en:
Ana Julia S. H., Ivania Balladares C., and Petrona del Socorro G. B. make up the Ivania group. These three women are from the José Dolores B. region, which is located in the city of Mayasa. Ana Julia makes embroidered handicrafts with her 19 year old daughter. Ana started the business five years ago. Her daughter learned how to embroider, and she encouraged Ana to work with her. Ana cuts the pieces, and her daughter embroiders them. This has helped generate more income because Ana used to only work at making food on the week ends. Her daughter is now studying in the university, and she is trying to improve herself. The loan is to buy raw material to expand her business. She dreams of having a place in the Masaya market where she could sell her work directly to the tourists and customers who go to the market. Ivania makes tortillas. She has a small mini market that she wishes to expand. Petrona sells used clothes, and she makes food in the evenings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to meet the demand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build some shelves

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 33 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Moustafa has been working as a motorcycle repairer since 1999. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase motorcycle spare parts for his work. This is the first time that Moustafa has requested a loan.
Moustafa is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Moustafa first started his business, he had financial issues. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, as well as he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Chhork N. lives in Kampong Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she has a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Nub Chhork, has been by the people to take a photo. He is also a hunter. This couple has three children who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday cracks and sells palm cannel. He is 39 years old and married with 4 children. He lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. He has been in LAPO for over 2 years now. 

Sunday is requesting a loan of 120,000 NGN to purchase more palm cannel. He says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm cannel.

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en: Enkhbold D. is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Tuv province of central Mongolia. His daughter, 6, attends a local primary school and his son, 2, stays at home. D. operates a stove and scrap-metal business in his town. He began as a scrap-metal purchaser in 2004 and since then, has expanded his business by also building stoves. D.’s wife purchases scrap metal from people in his town and then he transports it to Erdenet city to sell to the recycling plant. They operate their scrap-metal business from land next to their house, where his wife purchases the metal. D. operates the stove building/welding side of their business from a shop downtown. He wants to be able to afford an apartment for his family one day where they will be more comfortable. D. is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan in order to be able to purchase more scrap metal, welding materials and cement blocks for his business. XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap metal, welding materials and cement blocks for his business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.fr: K. Ruth est née en 1975. Mariée et mère de cinq enfants, dont trois sont à sa charge, Ruth vit avec son mari et ses enfants à PK11 à Sèmè-Podji sur la route de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. C'est depuis 8 ans que Ruth vit dans ce quartier. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Ruth vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Ruth a très tôt abandonné l'école. Il y a deux ans de cela que Ruth mène comme activité, la vente de tissus, habits et chaussures par le système de distribution. Ruth s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo pays voisin du Bénin, et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Ruth n'a jamais obtenu de crédit à ALIDé. C'est pour renforcer son commerce en l'agrandissant afin de faire face à la demande de ses clients, que Ruth sollicite ce premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Madame Ruth K. was born in 1975. She is married and has five children, three of whom are in her care. She lives with her husband and children in PK11 in Sèmè-Podji on the way to Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin; she has lived in this neighborhood for eight years. All her children attend school. Madame K. helps her husband out with the household expenses. She abandoned her own schooling at a young age. For two years she has been selling fabrics, clothes and shoes through the distribution system. She stocks up in Lomé in Togo, a neighboring country to Benin, and in Benin's international market, Dantokpa. Madame K. has not had a loan from Kiva Field Partner ALIDé before. She is requesting this first loan from ALIDé to strengthen and grow her business to meet her clients' needs.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bolts of fabric and pairs of shoes

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji F. sells charcoal and beans in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Keji is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a tailor. She has 3 childrenwho go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Albertina Pedro

texts.pt:
Albertina Pedro G. nasceu na Província de Sofala, centro de Moçambique, tem 54 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 8 filhos de 28 a 18 anos de idade, destes tem dois pares de gémeos de 3 de 26 anos e 2 de 24 anos de idade, os mais novos frequentam a escola. Fez somente 1ª classe não continuou porque os pais não deixaram. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e ainda ajuda a irmã e 4 sobrinhos para o sustento da família. 

Saiu de Sofala para Maputo no Distrito de Boane com o seu falecido marido ainda militar, fixaram sua residência em Boane e mais tarde o marido perdeu a vida. Iniciou uma actividade agrícola para poder sustentar os filhos, esta actividade aprendeu com os pais ainda em sofala. Recebe a pensão do falecido marido no valor de 4.000.00mt e 1.500.00mt provenientes da ajuda prestada pelos filhos que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária e no Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa) mensal. 

Nunca teve empréstimos em bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (barrotes, chapas, cimento, areia e janelas) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 8.500.00mt, 13.000mt e 13.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
 
 Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Albertina Pedro G. was born in Sofala Province in central Mozambique. She is 54 years old, a widow, and the mother of 8 children who range in age from 28 to 18 years old. Of these, she has two sets of twins: one pair that is 26 years old and one pair that is 24 years old. The youngest go to school. She only went to school through the 1st grade because her parents wouldn't let her continue. She lives in her own home with her children and even helps her sister and 4 nieces and nephews with family support. She left Sofala for Maputo, Boane District with her now deceased husband when he was still a soldier. They made their home in Boane and later, her husband lost his life. She began agricultural work in order to support her children. She learned about this work with her parents when she was still in Sofala. She receives the pension of her deceased husband, which has a value of 4,000 MZN. 1,500 of the aid given for her children goes toward household expenses. She even manages to save some monthly in her bank account and in Xiqitue (a traditional rotating savings system). She never has had loans through banks. She found out about Hluvuku through neighbors who are also clients of this institution. This is her 4th loan, which has a value of 15,000 MZN. With it, she plans to buy construction materials (beams, panes, cement, sand, and windows) in order to continue with the construction of her house. The previous loans had values of 8,500 MZN, 13,000 MZN, and 13,000 MZN. All were for the same purpose. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans in order to continue with the construction of her home and to provide better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, etc.)

loans.name: Donald Agustín

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo en el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Donald B. se dedica arduamente a trabajar para llevar el sustento a su hogar y así brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia por medio de la reconstrucción de su vivienda que ha estado en malas condiciones por mucho tiempo pero ahora ha iniciado a mejorar gracias al apoyo del señor Donald.

Con la obra de mejoramiento de vivienda saldrá adelante brindando mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y esta es la razón por la que solicita un crédito en Ceprodel el cuál invertirá en la compra de los materiales de construcción para culminar su obra y lograr la satisfacción de su familia.
texts.en:
Donald B. lives in Somotillo in Chinandega department. He works hard to support his family and provide better living conditions for them through home improvements. His house has been in poor condition for some time now and he has started to make improvements, thank to help from Donald. This construction project will improve his family's living conditions so he is asking Ceprodel for funding to be used to buy building materials so that he can complete the job to his entire family's satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents and two siblings.

In 2007, Hasan opened a small shop to sell music, movie discs and tapes and some gadgets. His small business allowed him to provide better living conditions and to ameliorate his living situation.

Today, Hasan is requesting $1,000 to buy more merchandise and to make some modifications and renovations to his shop.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and make some modifications and renovations to his shop

loans.name: Gerlie's Group

texts.en:
Gerlie G., from the village of Bagong Tanza, is the 40-year-old group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

A married mother of five school-aged children, Gerlie's main income is derived from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gerlie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise, Gerlie is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will her sixth from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mahamatrasul

texts.en: Since 1999, Mahamatrasul has been a livestock farmer. He raises calves, cows and sheep. He is married and has two children to support and give a proper education. Mahamatrasul has improved his financial situation by wisely using the loans he has received from IMON International to breed his animals. Nowadays, his biggest dream is to expand his business and to also offer dairy products in his community. Therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Rosauro

texts.es: Sr. Rosauro Nacio en Ayacucho-A.Ibañez-S.C.el 07 de Octubre de 1956. Concuvino (no son casados pero viven en pareja)con la señora Maria Isabel, ellos tienen dos hijos hace 20 años que el señor compro su parcela en la banda del rio son 20 Hectareas. El señor actualmente esta sembrando arroz, yuca (La yuca es un cultivo perenne con alta producción de raíces reservantes, como fuente de carbohidratos y follajes para la elaboración de harinas con alto porcentaje de proteínas. Las características de este cultivo permite su total utilización, el tallo (estacón) para su propagación vegetativa, sus hojas para producir harinas y las raíces reservantes para el consumo en fresco o la agroindustria o la exportación), maiz y tambien tiene 3 Hectareas de pasto para su ganado todos sus producto que el señor cosecha lo vende en el mercado Central El Torno. El cliente esta agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo que le a brindado ademas que es su primer credio y se siente bastante contento. El dinero que solicito es para la compra de semillas para sembrarlas en epoca de siembra y asi poder incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosauro was born in Ayacucho-A.Ibañez-S.C. on October 7, 1956. He lives with his common law wife Maria Isabel. They have two children. Twenty years ago Rosauro purchased 20 hectares of land on the riverbank. He grows rice, yucca, and corn. (Yucca is a perennial crop with tuberous roots, which are a source of carbohydrates and foliage that can be used to make flour with a high percentage of protein. The characteristics of this crop all for complete utilization, the stem for plant propagation, the leaves for production of flours, and the tuberous roots for consumption, or agroindustry, or exportation). He also has 3 hectares of pasture for his livestock. All of the products Rosauro raises are sold in the El Torno central market. He is thankful to the organization for the help it has provided. This is his first loan and he feels very happy. The money he is requesting is for the purchase of seeds which will be sown in the planting season, so that he can increase his working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Парпиева Дилафруз проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст, 28 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке, где продает вещи необходимые хозяйству. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и открыть собственный магазин.
texts.en:
Dilafruz P. lives in the region of Gissar. She is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. She has secondary education. She has been in the sales business for more than five years. She has a vendor point on the market where she sells household goods. She is taking out the loan to increase sales of goods. She wants to expand her business and open her own store.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales of goods

loans.name: Los Triunfadores Del Rimac Group

texts.es:
LOS TRIUNFADORES D. RIMAC
Erlinda  Azaña D. 63 años D. edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos mayores D. edad, socia  D. la Alcancía Los Triunfadores D. Rímac, La Alcancía está integrada por 8 socios  quienes vienen trabajando  con la Institución  ya  desD. hace 3 años.
Se emprenD. en su labor  como negociante D. forma ambulatoria, ella venD. chocotejas  y papas rellenas en los mercados D. Chosica, también venD. cerveza en su domicilio, Inicialmente comenzó con 2 cajas D. Cervezas, y posteriormente fue mejorando su ingreso, llego el punto en que necesitaba comprar más mercadería  y fue que  a través D. una vecina, quien la invito a participar  en este tipo D. crédito grupal. Su primer préstamo lo invirtió en la compra D. bebidas (4 cajas D. cervezas). Con su préstamo actual realizara  la compra D. insumos tanto para la preparación D. papas rellenas y chocotejas 
Su meta es lograr incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar su nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
LOS TRIUNFADORES D. RIMAC Erlinda Azaña is 63 years old. She is married and has 2 adult children. She is a member of the communal bank Los Triunfadores D. Rímac. The communal bank is maD. up of 8 members who have been working with the institution for more than 3 years. She works as a street vendor. She sells chocotejas and stuffed potatoes in the markets of D. Chosica. She also sells beer from her home. She started with 2 cases of beer, and later improves her income to the point that she needed to buy more merchandise. It was a neighbor that invited her to participate in this type of group credit. She invested her first loan in beverages (4 boxes of beer). With her present loan, she will buy ingredients to prepare the stuffed potatoes and the choctejas. Her goal in to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare stuffed potatoes and chocotejas.

loans.name: Sles

texts.en:
Mrs. F. is an older woman, 72 years old, and lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is jobless and stays at home to do housework. She is married but her husband died of senility years ago. She has a financial earner in her son who drives a motor taxi (Tuk Tuk), and who is now married and lives in the family home. 

The family relies on the income from the taxi service. Unfortunately, the taxi broke down when picking up a passenger and their daily revenue has been affected. To avoid the problem, F. decided to borrow the money from Kiva’s project partner, HKL, in the amount of $800 for her son to replace his old taxi. (Mrs. F. was busy when the photo was taken so her son is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To replace his old taxi.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: EL joven José  de 24 años de edad, vive en el barrio Rene Cisneros junto a su esposa y tres hijos. Su trabajo es la venta de  atol y arroz de leche ambulante, desde horas temprana sale aveder, este oficio lo logro ya que su mama también se dedica a la venta de atol, su inversión es poca, por eso quiere el financiamiento para lograr la compra de paca de ropa usada el cual se vende mucho por su calidad y precios accesibles. Lo que se beneficiara para mejorar la economía de su familia ya que le es difícil cuando las ventas bajan. Su objetivo es lograr ventas altas, invertir en la venta de atol, con el propósito de ahorrar y poder ofrecer a sus hijos una buena educación para que sean hombres de bien, ya que la delicuencia asecha al pais debido a la falta de empleo y educacion.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old and he lives in the Rene Cisneros neighborhood along with his wife and three children. He sells atol [a cornmeal-based beverage] and rice pudding as a street seller, starting very early in the morning. He started in this line of work because his mother also sells atol. He doesn’t have much capital to invest, and so he needs the loan to buy a bale of used clothing, which sells well because of its good quality and affordable price. This would be beneficial for his family’s economic state because it’s difficult for him when sales go down. His goal is to achieve high sales and invest in his atol business, with the goal of saving and being able to provide his children a good education so they can be good citizens, since delinquency is a big problem in the country due to the lack of employment and education.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana S. B. is a hard working mother who tries her best in order to improve her farming business for the benefit of her family. Hard work and patience are her foundation in achieving a good life. Lack of business capital encouraged her to seek financial support from Kiva lenders. The loan she is using amounts to 43,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from the lenders and is helping her improve her business by purchasing different commodities needed for farming. 

This loan was a great help in the maintenance of their farming business particularly in their rice production by purchasing fertilizers and rice seeds. Aside from farming, she also sells Avon Products as supplementary source of income.
