Luciana is thankful for the support of ASHI and is hoping to further improve their crop production in the future through work and continuous assistance of the lenders. This would not only provide her with happiness in life, but would also make her business improve and make more profit, which will allow her to support the basic needs of her family.

Her long term goal is to have their own tricycle transport business (three-wheeled vehicle) for additional revenue to build a sustainable life that is out from  under the umbrella of poverty. Through hard work and focus, Luciana is determined to improve her standard of life with the kind-hearted support of ASHI and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase different commodities needed in her farming business

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn L. is from the village of Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Merlyn is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For labor costs and to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: EFua S. is a fishmonger, married to a farmer and lives with her six dependants. She has no educational background.  Efua uses her income in support of the children’s welfare.  Efua will use the loan to obtain more fish to be able to supply more to the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To obtain more fish

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie A. is from the village of Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 29 years old. Angelie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Angelie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Angelie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angelie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Angelie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Angelie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou C., 25, is married with one young child living at home in the Takeo province. She is a garment worker, typically making US$3 each day and her husband is a motorbike mechanic. Her husband typically makes about US$4 each day. She would like a loan of US$800 to purchase tools for her husband to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina A. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old. Marina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Marina has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Marina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Marina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Mrs. Juvy L. is from the Barangay of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years of age, married and blessed with four children, all of whom all are now school age.  To make a living, she is presently engaged in fish vending and in a motorcycle delivery service together with her husband as the driver. She’s been engaged in these kinds of businesses for five years already and earns approximately PHP 6,000.00 a month.

In the year 2005, Juvy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy, as an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out to the rural communities, has successfully repaid a loan of PHP 20,000. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 as her ninth loan to be used as additional capital for their fish vending and delivery activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the businesses to improve the general living conditions of their family, including meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, children’s education, insurances and possible business expansions. 
		
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for their existing fish vending activity

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en: Batmunh M. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvs province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife is currently unemployed and looks after their three young children at home. Batmunh operates a taxi service in his town. He has been driving a taxi since 2000 and has gained much experience. After several successful years of operation, he used his earnings to buy a new car in 2008. He has taken out leasing loans from XacBank twice in the past and has proven himself to be a trustworthy customer who always pays on time and in full. He used his loans to purchase a refrigerator, beds, etc. worth 600,000 MNT. With his earnings, he is able to provide for his family. He says, "I am now preparing for the coming extreme winter by purchasing firewood and coal." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase items such as winter tires, oil, etc. for his car.

loans.use: to purchase items for his car

loans.name: No Problem Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “No Problem” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Susan D. K.. Susan is age 35 and was born in Magburaka town. She is married with three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary school.  

Susan sells palm oil, rice and groundnuts. She has been doing this business for many years. With her share of this loan, she will buy palm oil and rice in a large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice and groundnuts

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose S. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members (3 relatives).    

Rose has a tailoring business.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Rose works in a shop, by means of retail.    

Rose has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more  clothing materials like African Tunics (Gomesi skirts and blouses) and threads. She also generates additional income through selling bricks and repairing torn clothes.

The main business challenges for Rose are transportation and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are starting a tailoring school and also owning a bridal boutique.   

Rose lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and threads

loans.name: Eshbay

texts.ru: Субанов Эшбай проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат. Имеет 9 детей. Дети находятся на заработках в России. Сам Эшбай имеет среднее образование. Занимается растениеводством. Имеет земельный участок, где выращивает овощи и сажает деревья. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 18 лет. Целью кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Eshbay S. lives in Shahrituz.  He is 57 years old, married, and has nine children.  His children are working in Russia. Eshbay has a secondary education. He works in agriculture.  He has a plot of land where he grows vegetables and plants trees.  He has been doing this work for eighteen years. He is using this loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: Buying mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Williams Geovanny

texts.es:
Williams Geovanny C. B. tiene 36 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL BATAN se encuentra ubicada 90 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla esta conformado por 21 socios que se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Williams se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz desde hace mucho tiempo. Compra sus productos en el Cantón Bucay y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y ver que aumente los cultivos.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Williams Geovanny C. B. is 36 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has three children.

The 'El Batan' community bank is located 90 minutes from the Chillanes regional office, in Chillanes canton.  The group has 21 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing cacao, cassava and corn.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Williams has been growing cacao, cassava and corn for a long time.  He buys his products in Bucay canton and sells them in Chillanes market and in the same district.

Williams is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his cacao crops.  The support of this loan will help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in weather.  His dream is to continue working and to see his crops increase.

He likes to take part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his cacao crops
